Reviews.Title: “The Heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SandraM200
Reviews.Content: I have stayed numerous times at the Handlery in the heart of Union Square when I'm in town to cheer on the San Francisco Giants. Great staff, comfy room, fantastic location and within walking distance to AT&T Park (about 1 mile). The Handlery regularly advertises package deals that include parking so the price is always right for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Union Square hotel”
Reviews.Author: yma7956
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at the Handlery. Staff has always been polite and helpful even though we travel with kids. Rates are very reasonable for the area and parking rates are great if you are just looking for somewhere to park near Union Square. The kids enjoyed the pool. Wi-fi was free both times we stayed. Very close to what you need and want in San Francisco. Rooms are clean. Nice vanity outside the bath area. Hope you enjoy it as much as our family.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel, SFO”
Reviews.Author: tracyt22
Reviews.Content: This is a friendly family run hotel in a superb loctaion in San Francisco. Lovely sized rooms, friendly staff, good value and with the added bonus of a very nice roof pool to unwind at the end of a busy sight seeing day on a warm summers day. We did try the breakfast which was awesome, a wonderful helping of buttermilk pancakes, blueberries and maple syrup. If your looking for good value, great loctaion and the bonus of a pool, especially if you are travellling with the family then I highly reccommend Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shopping dinner shows and tours but room was a let down”
Reviews.Author: Business_Barbie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel April 25 - 29. Location to Union Sq was great we could walk to great shopping, dining, hop on hop off bus stop, cable cars etc The Daily Grill is the in house dining and was awesome recommend. The room was below average. The bathroom was meh and the sink is in your bedroom lounge room area? I thought we would have a window... We did, that looked straight across in to another hotel guests room, make sure you get a room with external window! There was no free wifi which is not cool in this day. The door staff were lovely and genuine but I found the concierge disinterested. For location can't beat it but don't expect 5 or even 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Average, Good location”
Reviews.Author: Jenko90
Reviews.Content: I stopped at the Handlery for 3 nights in April 2012. The Hotel is in an excellent location, close to Market Street where the main shops are. It's a ride from Fisherman's Wharf and you will need a cable car or bus to get there, since its a fair walk. The Hotel is welcoming with people at the doors ready to open them for you. As you go to your room you will notice that the hotel is quite aged which isn't a problem. The room was average, good points: Nicely decorated, huge tv, cleaned every day. Bad Points: Small pool, Bed was rock hard, View of a wall, Windows weren't sound proof so you are woken up every morning by the chanter's who stand outside the hotel screaming "WAKE UP" at 7am every morning! Not enough storage space, 3 of us shared a room and there was only one small area to hang clothes and 2 draws. WiFi isn't free, but there is a Starbucks 2 minutes around the corner if you need to check-in for flights, etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Too Tired”
Reviews.Author: Evelina62
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was highly recommended by friends who live in San Fran and work at the hotel. As soon as I checked in, I was bombarded by all the noise from across the street, where a group of people were protesting unfair policies of Frank Hotel. They used mega-phones and shouted slogans for two hours! I started a headache and raced out of the Handlery in search of peace! The furniture in the suite was extremely old and frayed. The sofa bed must have been 50 years old. The front desk was very polite and helpful though. When I had difficulty opening the sofa bed, they sent someone up in 2 min., at 11 p.m. to open it up for me. The following morning, I was, once again, awakened rudely by the same protesters! at 7:00 a.m! Apparently this has been going on for 4 months now, and no one has any idea when it will end. I was going to book a block of rooms for an upcoming destination wedding. But after experiencing this fiasco, I decided to take my business elsewhere and not subject out of town guests to San Fran's mayhem.

Reviews.Title: “Will avoid next time...”
Reviews.Author: jenlinc
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a good size and clean but the hallways and common areas are depressing. The pool is really more of a smoking lounge with a large water feature at the center.

Reviews.Title: “you can do better in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: snoopguy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights...in a "premiere room". Though the room is nicely appointed (bathroom is small), my biggest complaint is the lack of sound-proofing for the room. Both the door and sliding doors overlooking the pool provide no sound buffer at all. When someone is talking in the hall (and several parties of guests did each of my three nights), it is as if your door is wide open. Same with anyone in the pool below...and there were kids in the pool every afternoon. The sound travels up into your room as if the balcony has no doors at all. Poor design. Also had an issue with not being given a pass code for internet (which is free for premiere room guests). Had to have the manager correct the situation (which he did), but if a friend staying here hadn't alerted me to this, I would have ended up paying $10 a day for internet access. Also, beware that there are many, many, aggressive pan-handlers and many homeless individuals all around Union Square, along Market Street and in every tourist area of the city. There was even a flyer posted in the hotel one day warning of a dangerous man named Bo who was to be avoided at all costs. The city needs to get better control of this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Leah H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March and was our first stop on arrival from Oz. We really liked this hotel. The staff were very helpful and did a lot to assist us. It is in a prime location right at Union Square. It is with all the top class department stores and has the cable car running right past.Resturants are all close by too. The room was very comfortable although abit small. I understand this is how it is in the US. The only critic of the place is that I would have liked to have a kettle to make tea and coffee as we required but this place like all the hotels here only had a small coffee maker. The bar next door Lefty O'Doulls deserves a mention too. The barman Paul was very helpful when I sprained my ankle and the food for breakfast is really cheap and really good. Also had good busness centre for internet access. Go there if you visit San Fransico.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn022
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the historic building facing onto Geary st. While it was a bit noisy it didn't disturb us. The rooms had been renovated to a very good standard however the structure itself (hallways needed a makeover, floor was a little uneven, no soundproofing) was showing definite aging. We had no problems with cellphone coverage, maybe other reviewers were in the other building. But has to be given full marks for location, so handy to transport, shopping malls, food outlets, information centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to everything downtown.”
Reviews.Author: zeerider
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Historic room, which meant that we were in the older of the two hotel towers. The room was situated on a corner, so it was nice and quiet due to only having one wall face the interior courtyard. It was also at the end of the hallway, so no loud noises from people passing by the door. However, one of the two windows faced a wall, so if you're looking for scenic view, this room wouldn't be a good choice for you. The room was clean and had a large LCD TV. The bed was comfy and the duvet had a nice, freshly washed cotton cover. (I'm very glad that most hotels are going this route now.) The bathroom was on the small side, but it was clean and had good lighting. Be sure to let the CFL warm up in the shower light! My only mild complaint is that there should be a phone or intercom to allow people checking in (and without key cards) to enter via the O'Farrell garage entrance. I understand the security aspect, but if you're walking up from Muni or BART with luggage, not having to go all the way round to the Geary entrance would be nice :)

Reviews.Title: “Not business friendly”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravellerJK
Reviews.Content: You have to pay for wifi - $9.95, which I wasn't pleased with, but I accepted. What annoyed me was that it sucked - speed was awful. Cell phone coverage is non-existent in the rooms, especially as they have wire mesh built into the glass - this literally creates a faraday cage to kill your signals. Open the window if you want to get signal! Rooms are ok, beds squeak which was annoying. Walls are thin, most people staying here seem to be noisy college kids, drunk and happy - but annoying. Overall... not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...& great service!”
Reviews.Author: Reno_NevadaTrvlr
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is perfectly located in the middle of San Fransisco, diagonally from Union Square. You never need to take out your car since you can walk to most things or take trolleys that run closeby or convenient buses to venues further out. Service is excellent. We spent our anniversary there, and the bell captain remembered us and that we were celebrating throughout our stay. This was our third stay at the hotel, and we plan to make staying there "a habit". Look online for the "room with parking" package. With SF hotels charging around $50/night for parking, the package makes rates at the hotel very reasonable. We especially like the premium rooms with balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Great location....great Hotel, (your "Aussie cousins")”
Reviews.Author: sancrox1
Reviews.Content: Before leaving Australia we researched for a Hotel with a central location surrounded by amenities, We were not disappointed, great Hotel with character,,excellent service..really good breakfast and evening meals served in the restaurant. Our advice, make sure you opt for a queen size....the doubles are a little small,ok for a single person. We had a great stay and would not hesitate to revisit next time in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Boerner820
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is a wonderful hotel in a great location. We stay there several times a year due to the proximity to Union Square. We will also walk to see a Giants game or take Bart to see an A's game! It's a great find!!

Reviews.Title: “Prefect Location”
Reviews.Author: Carol E
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with a nine year old. It was a perfect hotel with its swiming pool, restaurant, and location. And wonderful Concierge who was more than willing to work with a nine year old request. Great room with everything we needed. Would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location ... well priced”
Reviews.Author: Ility
Reviews.Content: The Handlery could not be better located, the rooms were fine - bathrooms a little compact. The staff were helpful - the Concierge - John? absolutely outstanding gave us the best advice on everything. A great base for a stay in this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service and good value in SFO”
Reviews.Author: XmasKid
Reviews.Content: We recently returned to The Handlery a year after our first visit for a few days in San Francisco. What attracted us back was the good experience last year plus the great location of the hotel in the midst of the city. This time though, we decided to opt for the newer modernized wing. To our delightful surprise, the hotel could guarantee interconnecting rooms which was perfect for our needs - a family of four with two teenagers. The hotel had not changed much and we recognized some of the staff from last year's visit - a good sign. The bell boy came to our rescue immediately as the taxi drew up and front desk staff were friendly and courteous. The hotel lobby was still as busy and was humming with guests. Our rooms were on the 4th floor and had a view of the pool courtyard. Both were spacious and inviting - one with a king bed and the other with two queens - and very different to the older style rooms in the historical wing we stayed in previously. We loved the storage space provided and the comfortable beds. Internet access was complimentary as part of the room tariff. There was no mini bar but the hotel provided bottled water and coffee making facilities in the rooms. There is a restaurant on site which provides in-room dining which we had on one night. The menu was extensive and our order, although reasonably large, arrived within 30 minutes. The price of the appetizers and salads were between USD$7 - 15 and mains ranged from $USD20 - 35. Quality was variable; a word of warning that we found some of the meals way too large for one person even with a big appetite so it may pay to ask for some guidance. The salad starters were nice and fresh. Worth considering is the Endive and Pecan Nut Salad with Blue Cheese dressing. The mains that deserve a mention are the chicken pot pie which was a hit with our daughter but was large enough for 2-3 servings, and the Pork Chops with Blueberry Sauce. The latter came with a large dollop of mashed potatoes and a good portion of spinach. The NY pepper steak could have been good but the portion my husband had was too sinewy for the price of the dish. The chocolate layer cake dessert offering was fantastic but again a 2-3 person serving size. Step out of The Handlery and you will find yourself in the midst of things. The hotel is surrounded by a large range of restaurants and cafes so guests are actually spoilt for choice if they are eating out. A short walk down Maiden Lane is Bistro 69, an unpretentious Italian joint serving well priced good fare. The coffee is superb! The hotel is also great for the shoppers amongst us being a short step away from high end designer and main street shops. Macy's is up one block from the O'Farrell entrance. Art galleries are also aplenty and are great for a browse. Those interested in catching the historic San Francisco trams will find a stop at Powell St. This line services the trams that head towards Fisherman's Wharf and is fequented by tourists. If looking for a joy ride, go early as the queues can get horribly long. After two more nights at The Handlery this year, it still has the thumbs up from the family. We would certainly return again especially to the rooms in the new wing. Unless a bedroom by the poolside was definitely wanted, avoid the 2nd floor rooms as there is little privacy.

Reviews.Title: “A centrally located, friendly, well appointed and great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gail P
Reviews.Content: Centrally located,friendly, well appointed hotel. Of the older style but all redecorated and very clean, quiet and plenty of room in the rooms. The bathrooms were a little small with no bath but the extra room in the rooms was worth it. The front desk were extremely obliging, offering suggestions and letting us check in early. Great value for money. Would happily stay here again and recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: betsieboo
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a very convenient location. You are just a few blocks away from the major shops and easy to get to public transport links for anywhere else. Doorman very helpful with directions and cabs. We were upgraded on arrival to a more spacious room. Staff were helpful and attentive to every request. Rooms are pleasant and nicely furnished (though we had no view). We were given complimentary breakfast and my only complaint is that the service was not great in the restaurant, slow and orders muddled.

Reviews.Title: “Great location room could have been better”
Reviews.Author: PenKim7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just off Union Square, perfect for sightseeing buses, cable cars and shopping On arrival we asked for a quiet room which to be fair it was quiet enough but the room was small with there was nowhere to store suitcases and with no view. Bathroom was very small and basic. Hover bed was very comfortable and the room was clean Outdoor heated pool was a great extra and the Daily Grill great for food, although a pity breakfast was not included in the room tariff

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Alastair B
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was excellent. Great location. Our room (in the older section of the hotel) was enormous and had 2 king sized beds in it. The room was literally twice the size of most modern hotel rooms. Bathroom was good too - my only criticism might be that the shower was slightly weaker than I am used to but was more than adequate. The bath tub was a sort of mini size, maybe 1500mm long and fairly shallow, but perfectly useable and better than just having a shower tray. Decor was good. Room was quiet once we switched off the heating/aircon unit which had a fairly noisy fan even on its lowest setting. we tended to leave it on when we were out to warm the room up and turn it off when we got in. Not a problem as the temperature was OK but in winter or maybe mid summer if might be slightly annoying. The Daily Grill restaurant which is attached to the hotel was excellent - food was good and the staff very friendly and helpful. Huge prtions and I would recommend the so called lighter options (under 600 calories) which are generally more than enough. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonable rate, good location”
Reviews.Author: Contentnz
Reviews.Content: Had a twin room in the historic room. It was well furnished with very comfortable beds and nice clean linen. Room itself was large with plenty of space for two but bathroom a bit more on the historical size side. Only gripe would be the pillows weren't to my liking but not enough to see if there were other options and my travelling companion loved them. We stayed four nights and I would definetely stay here again - right on union squre, clean and friendly staff with 12pm as the standard check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Very annoyed.”
Reviews.Author: Woottos
Reviews.Content: This review would have been very postive but for an incident that started on the second to last day of our stay. I'll start with the postive bits. We ( 2 adults 2 children 13 and 15) were travelling with my brother and father in law. The check in was very smooth and we were given 3 rooms next to each other which was great. When we arrived in our room we noticed that the 2 beds in the our room were fairly narrow, much closer to a large single than a double, we decided that we couldnt spend 4 nights sleeping virtually on top of each other and rang reception to ask if anything could be done. the recptionist said they were very sorry and that porter would be up very shortly to move us to another room. A few minutes later the porter arrived and moved us to another room (actually a suite of 2 rooms ) this room was great and very spacious, but it had the same sized beds as the last room. I pointed this out and after a further conversation with the receptionist we were moved to a suite which had a king sized bed and a large pull out sofa. the room was clean and very nicely furinshed with flat screen TVs in both rooms. The room overlooked the main street and whilst this meant you heard traffic noise, I dont mind this as I quite like the noise of a city. We recevied vouchers for a free breaksfast every morning and this was so good that we used them every day. you can choose between a very nice fry up (American breakfast) or Muesli (Granola) or a belgian waffle, accompanied with penty of sour dough toast (delicious!). The bar was also very nice with a broad choice of quality spirits and a decent range of bottled beers. We looked at both the pool areas and the gym, but didnt use either. They were both very pleasant and well maintained. To sum up an excellent hotel right in the heart of the city, with first class amenities. This is the incident that spolit my stay. On our second to last day we were woken at 7 am by a protest taking place at a hotel about 150 yards up the road. There were approx 7 people with placards and loud hailers protesting about being harshly treated by that hotel (they were either current or former employees). This protest went on for an hour and we were then able to return to sleep. The following morning, our last day at the hotel, exactly the same thing happened. given that we were travelling that day I knew I wouldnt have time to return to sleep so rang reception to complain about the second early wake up and ask couldnt something be done. I was then informed that the protestors had a PERMIT to hold this protest EVERY morning, I asked why we hadnt been told this and was told this was an oversight. I then went over to have a word with the protestors, one my way back in I was asked by reception how I was that day, given that I was by now hopping mad, I told them, this resulted in the manager coming down to speak with me, he was very apologetic. I pointed out to him again that he should have told us this was going to happen regularly so we could have requested a quieter room. At this point the lady who had checked us in said she had told us all upon check in that the protests would be taking place. This was a lie! She hadnt, or at least if she had it had been done in such a way that none of the 7 people in our party had absorbed the fact, which seems extremely unlikely. I guess, if you feel that way inclined, its ok to lie to your boss about imparting information to customers when they arent there. But to do so in front of the customer concerned is terrible, I was outraged. The whole situation could have been avoided by them telling us that the protests were scheduled, the hotel failed to do this simple thing and then tried to tell me that they had. A very poor custmer experience indeed, during an otherwise great stay at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nicola069
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from San Francisco with my husband and daughter. We stayed at this hotel and it was superb. We were warmly welcomed and our room was lovely. We were in the older part of the hotel and our room was perfect. The hotel is very central and all the tourist buses can be accessed down from the hotel at Union Square. We were given complimentary breakfast vouchers which allowed two breakfasts per day. However, my daughter and I shared breakfasts as the portions were so big. The Daily Grill is an excellent restaurant, we ate there several times as it was convenient for our daughter who was tired after a day of sightseeing in San Francisco. The waiting staff were polite and the service we received was excellent. We intend to return to SF and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Comfortable and Quiet Stay”
Reviews.Author: Johnmont
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only 1 night as we were in transit after disembarking a cruise ship. We were delighted to be allowed into our lovely top floor room at 9.30am. We had 2 double beds and the room was spacious, well appointed and comfortable. We didn't hear a sound all night. The location is wonderful. The breakfast which was included was very nice and the service was efficient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kirk and Dee C
Reviews.Content: We have tried other places and keep coming back to the Handlery. The location is perfect, it is ALWAYS clean, the staff is great, and the price is right! Parking right under hotel and it is EASY access from the highway. We love it! We love all of the staff, but want to give a special shout to Hermie. You are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and budget friendly, but dreary”
Reviews.Author: MBA60302
Reviews.Content: My husband selected this hotel because he needed an inexpensive hotel within easy walking distance to the Moscone Center. The first room offered was tiny and noisy; a request for a better room resulted in one that was somewhat larger, but by no means spacious, overlooking an interior air shaft. The furnishings were drab and dated. The bathroom was just barely adequate in size with a small stall shower with anemic water pressure. For maybe $10-$20 more per night there are much better hotels available in SF, including the Financial District. So unless this location is paramount, I would not recommend it. And, in comparing prices, be aware that there is a surcharge of $10.99/ night on the standard-size room rate for wi-fi, and that charge is device-specific -- that is, if 2 people want to each use their own laptop (even at different times) that's $22/ night more. There is free wifi at the Starbucks around the corner but, depending on your needs that may not be adequate

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: angler70
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great location for a stay in San Fancisco. 20m from union square. 5 min walk from the BART and 3mins to the cable car and tram/bus lines. The hotel rooms are adequate for a few nights stay. Having just come from Las Vegas the room seemed small. The bathrooms were quite cramped but functional. The rooms could probably do with a little updating as we were on the front and it was quite noisey (no double glazing). Staff were friendly and very helpful. Especially the doormen and concierge. The free breakfast was a surprise and very welcome. It's a lot better than it sounds on paper. Very filling. Union square is a great place to shop. Macy's, Sak's and Bloomingdales all a short stroll away. As for a drink on a night. Try Lefty O'Douls next to the hotel. Lots of different beers and the food is cheap and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: cfrankli
Reviews.Content: This was a good value in the heart of San Francisco. I read the reviews and don't agree about the noise. It was quiet and clean and comfortable. The attitude of the staff varied. Checkin was good and the very young bellhop was excellent. But there is a surly older gentleman who had really bad beside manners. The fridge is a good addition. For a clean place to sleep, shower and have the occasional meal while you enjoy San Franciso, this fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Location doesn't make up for aging hotel”
Reviews.Author: Opiedog
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel approximately 20 years ago, and remembered the great location. I've stayed at a few other places nearby in the intervening years, but thought I should try it again when my daughter and I planned a trip for spring break. Unfortunately, it seems as if the hotel has not had any work done on it since my last visit. Our small, dark room had two windows, looking into a sort of courtyard and directly into other rooms. The room had a stale, musty smell, almost as if there had been water damage at some point. There was a mini bar with nothing in it - I'm guessing the type of guests who stay here either can't afford the cost of a drink or two, or that the hotel can't control 'shrinkage'. Pretty sad. The worst part was the shower (no bath), which was so tiny that I could barely turnaround in it, with a flimsy curtain that did little to contain the water. The morning after our first night (we had booked for a week), I called the Westin St. Francis next door and got a reservation: goodbye Handlery! Our room at the Westin was only $60 - $70 per night more, for a much bigger room, larger bath room, sitting area, etc. The most interesting part was that no one asked us why we were leaving after only one night. I assume they are used to this happing.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: slakes
Reviews.Content: Great three nights @ the Handlery. Complimentary breakfast in the daily grill during our stay. Staff were all really helpful. Location was brill, within walking distance of Powell St station and the Bart to the airport. Enjoyed a drink or two in the bar and a couple down the road at Lefty O'Douls. (Amazing carvery) Loved San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: RU4Real_204
Reviews.Content: First, booking directly through the hotel as it is cheaper than all the online services. We flew in and took the BART from the airport then walked a couple of blocks to the hotel. Getting to the hotel is easy. I'm not sure why the hotel doesn't use it as a selling point. I would. We checked in a couple of hours early. We expected to drop off our luggage and come back later but we were checked in right away. Check in took about two minutes. Our room was what we expected but was more comfortable and roomy than the pictures online depict. The bed was excellent. All the room amenities were as advertised. Free wireless was nice. The location is excellent. The MUNI and BART transit systems are minutes away or you can just walk. The Concierge will help you with anything you need. The complete staff was excellent. We went as sightseers and highly recommend The Handlery. We did our homework and it paid off.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time Staying. Sorry not this time....”
Reviews.Author: Yonkers_au
Reviews.Content: While my last two reviews on this hotel have been good, unfortunately this time I can't say that it was. Other than check-in, my stay wasn't all that great. While it was understood that I was booked into (and paid for) a large room in the historic wing, I was actually given a room the size of a "shoe box". I was also put into a section where a family had been split into a number of rooms and they insisted on running up and down the halls and slamming doors at all hours of the night/morning. On my last day, I had arranged for a very late check out. When I rang to organise this the person on the phone was extremely rude even after I explained that I was willing to pay for the extra time. When I checked out, I was waiting in the front of a line for over 15 mins to be served. During this time, my airport shuttle had turned up and was waiting for me. Noticing that I couldn't really wait any longer, one of the bellmen came over and had arranged for me to check out so I could get to the airport in time to make my international flight. There should be more than 2 people serving during peak check-in/check-out times. As I said, I'm sorry that I couldn't give it a good review this time.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTraveler7740
Reviews.Content: My assistant booked rooms here for my partners and I because SF was nearly sold out, and because the reviews were not bad. As I texted to her immediately upon my arrival in the room - never again. The hotel is super odd - you need to go up a flight of stairs (no elevator), across and open courtyard with a pool, then into another building, to get to the elevators to most rooms. The people a few doors down from me took full advantage of the medical marijuana laws in CA to keep the hall reeking like a dorm. The room was moderately clean, the bed not fully uncomfortable (although the pillows left a lot to be desired), and the location is convenient. Despite these facts, the three of us felt disdain for the property and would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Four excellent nights for us Kiwis!”
Reviews.Author: temaiku
Reviews.Content: We felt most welcomed and comfortable at the Handlery. The staff were most obliging, the breakfasts very good, cleanliness excellent, and comfort of room and beds made it a haven after hitting the top tourist spots and shopping. Very convenient for lots of restaurants - we ate Mexican, (twice), Chinese, Italian and snacked at close convenient locations, at reasonable cost.We loved the family aspect, and so much appreciated a friendly and welcoming call from the owner, Jon Handlery. (On the hotel website, check out the videos - brilliant!). This will be the hotel of choice for our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location!”
Reviews.Author: Luana29
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was terrific and reason enough to stay there again. We were greeted by smiles the second we entered the door. Everyone was helpful. Their recommendations for dinner in the city were spot on. This hotel was so central for us. Great food and shopping right out the door! You can get to the cable car line in less than a 5 minute walk. We like to walk so we walked (it's a work out!) to Fisherman's Wharf, to good Italian dining in North Beach, and to China Town. The room was reasonably priced for being in such a convenient location at $189 per night, (except Saturday was $209). We had two queen beds, a small refrigerator, free wi-fi in the Premier section of the hotel. It is a bit of a walk to your room in the Premier section initially. However, after check in, you can come in the back door where there is an elevator that will take you right to your floor. We were next to the elevator, so a bit noisy, but not enough to ask for another room. At check-in, we were given a choice of rooms and told that if we were not happy with our first choice, they would be happy to move us. The room was very clean although the grout lines in the shower could use some bleach! All in all, we would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: kswim
Reviews.Content: What a perfect location on Union Square! This hotel has great character. The doormen greeted me every morning as I headed out and every evening on my return so it always felt warm and welcoming to come back. In fact all of the staff were very friendly and helpful and made my stay much more enjoyable. When I arrived at check-in, there was a gentleman holding things up for a lost reservation. When he finally searched his email for his confirmation number it turned out his reservation had actually been for the prior day but the front desk staff quickly corrected the problem. I had to wait while all this was happening but they were sure to make eye contact with me, smile and acknowledge my prolonged waiting time. It's amazing how far just being acknowledged and not being ignored goes. The management should be commended for their attention to customer service and the staff for bringing that focus to life! The rooms are nicely decorated and clean. The bed was very comfortable and I slept like a rock! All in all a very nice place to stay and at such a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Five Great Nights”
Reviews.Author: Margaret S
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Handlery. Good rates, excellent location, friendly, knowlwdgeable staff, top-notch service, large rooms, a great hotel experience. We will definitely visit the Handlery again! We arrived around 1:00 am on a Monday morning. The staff was helpful and quickly got us an extra bed (called a "cot", but really a full-sized twin bed), for our daughter. There was ample space for the extra bed in the room, which was a nice surprise. The location is excellent - a half block away from Union Square, and very close to the famous "Sears" restaurant. I had forgotten my coat, but Macy's is on Union Square and there is also great shopping just 1.5 blocks away with Bloomingdales, Nordstroms and all the major shops of most large malls. At Macy's I found a perfect coat for the weather and used my 10% discount card that is printed on the back of the room key. We had planned to rent a car, but with the easy access to public transportation - the Cable cars mostly - we only needed a car for one day when we took a trip out to Muir Woods. Nice surprise again - The rental place was within shouting distance. We had a great vacation and staying at the Handlery was a large part of making it a success. P. S. Our daughter loved the heated pool!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Focused”
Reviews.Author: andrew16017
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem.Staff are wonderful and the room we had was very comfortable and clean..Stayed streetside but double glazing ensured restful sleeps on pillow mattress..Reasonably priced in a fantastic location ,Shops,restaurants ,cable cars and bars ,what more could we want? Even the weather early March was fantastic.Nothing is too much trouble for the staff here ,special thanks to a living treasure Shirley (on front desk) and Hermie, A very memorable stay

Reviews.Title: “Great central location”
Reviews.Author: Lee H
Reviews.Content: First time visit to San Francisco and we stayed at this hotel which was in an excellent location. Rooms are spacious which suited us as we were three people sharing. Breakfast was good and prices were reasonable. Close to the cable cars and surrounded by lots of shops!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: labonvoyer
Reviews.Content: So you've decided to visit San Francisco and want to be in the middle of theater, shopping and the bustling Union Square. You thought hey it might be nice to stay right on Union Square and in the front of the Cable Car line, So you check the St Francis rates...ouch. Here's an alternative: The Handlery Hotel on Geary St right across from the St Francis. Although it's a small hotel, the rates aren't always fabulous because of it's location, when they are, grab a room. The hotel has 2 buildings. One is a newer building that backs onto Ofarrell St and the older section is the front where the lobby is located and is on Geary St. I stayed there several years ago when I attended a conference. I stayed in the older building which they call "the historic rooms". At that time, they up graded me to a room that had a sweet sitting room attached to it with sofas. This time they were having a promotion and I booked a "historic room". I requested a view if possible and I was given a room on Geary St. Do not make that mistake, I was wokened up at 3am by what I surmised as the clanging of garbage trucks. The room was small but had a quaint bay window in it. I usually don't mention bathroom size, but, this was the smallest bathroom for hotel room with the exception of Parisien hotels I've stayed in. They have done a nice job with decor. When you step into the hallway you can tell that this was an old hotel. The floors creaked when walking down the hall and plumbing pipes are mounted where you can see them as is some of the electrical ware. The stairway is narrow. Again, it is well decorated and reminds you that the heart of SF was bustling before indoor plumbing and electricity. But, here's the real plus-the location. You are 1/2 block from Macys, close to all the Union Square shopping, down the street from the Broadway type theaters, 3-4 blocks from shopping on Market St and the Hyde-Powel Cable Car turnaround. The staff will help you if you would like to catch a bus to ...? They also have a concierge. I did not use the pool, but it is encircled by both buildings so is protected from the wind. It is a fairly large size with a few tables and lounge chairs. It would be especially nice if traveling with children and having something for them to do at the end of a day of museums and shopping. Can't comment on newer side, but if location is important and you can live with European size bathrooms and you get a good rate, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “A rooftop getaway”
Reviews.Author: paulandsteven
Reviews.Content: The Handlery has a unique Rooftop room that is like your own house in the middle of downtown. We live in San Francisco and went to the tree lighting on Union Square as a start to the holiday season. The garden suite is really a fun and secluded spot to call home base while enjoying the city. Room service didn't even know it was up there. You don't have a view of the city, but is your own little enclave with a nice pool downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pool located in heart of DT San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: mollyd2
Reviews.Content: There are 2 blogs that comprise this hotel. We stayed in the upgraded area in back bldg. we had a small balcony overlooking pool. Due to the two bldgs being "back to back' there is a bit of a walk and a flight of stairs from main lobby since this bldg is separate. We had 2 queen bed room w plenty of space and large bath dressing area. I have stayed in several DT SF hotels but this is a new favorite. I have a feeling not all rooms may be as nice as ours but I like the location and personnel seem nice. Coffee maker and mini fridge in this room. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: RonnieCampbell
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced and situated in the heart of San Francisco. Room was very clean and the staff extremely friendly and attentive. The concierge knew all the spots -- where to go and where to stay away from. I'd certainly recommend staying at the Handlery and would, myself, be a repeat guest.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: The_Meeks
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good and well situated. Our original room was on the front of the hotel which we found to be extremely noisy (from the bar next door and also the cable cars in the next street). However, the next morning we asked if it was possible to change rooms and we were given a room at the back of the hotel immediately. The facilities at this hotel are very good - heated pool, gym, internet access etc. The staff are very helpful and service is excellent. The restaurant serves a varied and high quality selection and overall we would say this hotel is extremely good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MelMel87
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in December. Great location for Shopping and getting around the rest of the city. Friendly service. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JamesArabiaFelix
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great location right off of Union Square. I had a large king room in the newer part of the hotel. Room was modern and clean. Two Starbucks locations and a few nice diner-style restaurants are very close. There is only one quibble: if you select for the breakfast included package, the choice is very limited. I thought allowing only one beverage (juice or coffee or tea) was unfortunate. I will definitely stay at this hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery met my group's business needs”
Reviews.Author: M C
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is conveniently located to transportation, and walking distance to Union Square, Chinatown, and lots of good restaurants. The staff were very courteous and responsive to our information requests. They always held the doors for us. The fitness room was small, but with abundant hills and walking opportunities, it turned out I didn't feel the need to use it. Internet access, couch, and refrigerator came with my room (upgrade). I really enjoyed this business trip stay from Mon-Fri, late February-early March. The weather was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Like a gracious European hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: gosmom
Reviews.Content: Disclosure: We spent a night at the Handlery because we had successfully bid on a certificate that the Hotel had donated to our kids' school auction. We were expecting to be given a very standard/bad location room since they had donated and weren't making any money on our visit. WRONG! The hotel staff treated us like royalty from the minute we walked in. (Actually, even when we drove in to parking lot--very professional.) We arrived in City early and expected to have to stash our bags for awhile. Our room was not ready, but they offered a room overlooking pool, which we took. (6th floor). We didn't really care as we wouldn't be spending lots of time in room. Room was extremely spacious (king, plus couch, coffee table, comfy chair, desk, chair, dresser, flat screen, refrigerator). There was a balcony with two chairs overlooking pool. New decor, sleek and sophisticated. Luxurious linens on extremely comfy mattress. Bath was small but ample, and a separate make-up area, mirror and also makeup mirror. Scale in bath, robes in closet, plush towels. Staff sent up water and treat bag with chips, granola bars, nuts.....and a bottle of wine. Nice! Doormen were always prompt, polite. Didn't have chance to use workout facility, but looked sufficient. Daily Grill restaurant attached had delicious breakfast the next a.m. The only "complaint" we would have would be that the cleaning staff could have been a little quieter with their chatter the next a.m. We awoke to an interesting conversation :) The location near Union Square is perfect. We actually walked thru Chinatown, down to North Beach for lunch, over to the Embarcadero, Financial District and back. Great walk. Would definitely return and have no problem recommending to anyone! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “top location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: I happened on the Handlery Union Square when I asked my travel agent for a reasonably priced central hotel for a lay-over in SFO. The location in Geary St is excellent, and the hotel is well presented, staff very friendly and helpful, rooms very satisfactory, very clean and bathroom well appointed. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, a bit small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: ScholarGentleman
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel. It's comfortable enough, and has a decent bed & shower. Nice to have the fridge in the room. Overall, I'd stay here again, and be happy enough, but it certainly wouldn't be my first choice. Mostly, this is because it's an old hotel. It's updated and clean, but it suffers from paper-thin walls and oddly shaped rooms. This means that once furnishings are in, there is not a lot of room--and this is coming from someone who lived in Tokyo and now lives in Manhattan. It's a tight squeeze. I'm a big guy, but I had to turn sideways to get to the sink. Normal conversations travel through the walls easily, and when people walk in the room above you you hear every step. So, again, if you are looking to save money and this is in your budget, you can certainly go and know that it will be clean, in a great location, and has a (generally) friendly staff. If you have a bit more money to spend, there are some more comfortable hotels in the area...

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Chris Z
Reviews.Content: I liked the historic hotel room and found everything to be very clean and in order. The staff was super friendly and eager to help. I made a couple of mistakes in booking my room and the front desk staff had it fixed with no questions asked. The only reason I won't give it a 5 star is the charge for wifi access. Nice enough that you can buy what you need, but in this day and age wifi is pretty important for figuring out where to go and how to get there in a big place like Union Square San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit, One Year Later”
Reviews.Author: whmurray
Reviews.Content: All right, Let's get this out of the way up front. Like most moderately priced hotels in San Francisco, the Handlery is an old property. In one or two places, the carpet looks a little bit shabby. However, in all the ways that count, this is a nice comfortable, full-service hotel that may be one of the best values in this very expensive city. Accommodations On my latest trip, I had room 847, spacious and nicely furnished. It was larger than the room I had last year, perhaps because I mentioned that I had reviewed them for Tripadvisor. On the other hand, the bath was not quite as spacious. There was a desk with lamps, desk-top plugs, and a great chair, In addition to the desk, there was a large dining table. Under the large flat-screen TV there was a small refrigerator. I liked the interface on the TV. On the power on screen, there is a scroll that shows the available channels and their numbers. This saved me from having to scroll to find the channel that I wanted. Since I now watch movies on my iPad, I did not notice the movie selection or the prices but I would expect them to be good.. I almost forgot that there was a safe in my room. There was a coffee bar in the room, but since the weather was good, I just went across the street to one of the three Starbucks in the block. (Lest you think that is a lot of Starbucks, there is a spot on Market street from which one can count five Starbucks. There are another two closer than the furthest of the five but which one cannot see.) One of the advantages of an older property was the large walk-in closet. [I hate those tiny presses that pass for closets in "modern" hotels. ] The clock radio had a line-in connector for mobile computers. As an iPhone user, I might have liked an iPhone adapter but this arrangement accommodates my iPad, laptop, and your Android or Windows device. The king-size bed had a very comfortable mattress, plenty of big fluffy pillows and a bolster. There was a room service breakfast menu and order form on the bed. Okay, there was no scale in the bathroom. That is by way of saying that is the only thing I missed. All of the permanent and consumable amenities were there, including my favorite, the curved shower curtain bar that makes the shower seem more roomy. There was a generous supply of generous sized towels and was clothes. The modern plumbing delivered plenty of hot water. Amenities The Handlery offers all the amenities one would hope for, from a knowledgeable, polite, and helpful concierge to shampoo in the bath. There is a very nice pool in a large atrium, a barber-shop, a business center, and an exercise facility. While I did not avail myself of any of these things, they were all pleasant, well-equipped, and popular. While this is not a convention hotel, there is a small number of meeting rooms. Wireless Internet is $9.95 per day or $40- per week (per device). While free would be nice, this is cheaper than most commercial hotels. These think nothing of charging $20 per day on top of much higher room rates. (In the US, economy hotels include free Internet but luxury properties charge extra.) Last year, when I mentioned that I had three computers, they gave me a code.) There is a vending machine and an ice machine across from the elevator on all floors. Unlike most hotels, where one finds the vending machine by the noise, these are silent (Silent!) and out in the open. Dining is in the Daily Grill. For world travelers, the Grill is a very popular pub. You can find the menu on the web. I like it so well that I try to eat there at least once on any trip to San Francisco. Transportation The Handlery is at Union Square, the heart of San Francisco. The garage entrance is two blocks up Cyril Magnin from the Powell Street BART station, 30 minutes and $8.10 from SFO. One can spit from the front entrance to the Powell Street Cable Car. There is always a taxi queue at the door. (I shared a cab to the airport with a colleague; the fare was $66- before tip) San Francisco has world class public transportation and Google and the BART app, make it easy to use. However if you choose to drive, guest parking in the Handlery garage is $34.00 per day, a discount from the daily rate for those who are not guests. Other The Handlery is a no-smoking property and one must agree to a $250- cleaning charge if one violates this policy. Of course, many Americans prefer smoke-free properties. The result is fresh and pleasant atmosphere throughout. (I did notice an ash tray by the pool.) I hope that this review has helped you decide whether the Handlery is for you and that, if you choose it, you will have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in February 2012 and had a fine stay. I was originally put in a room with a view on a construction site, that reeked of bleach. I immediately called down to the front desk and complained about the smell and the kindly and swiftly moved me to another room, slight bleach smell but less strong and the room was South facing and full of sunlight so couldn't be bothered to switch. Pretty clean, relatively spacious, flat screen TVs, I would say perfect for a business trip. I had a very nice lady check me in and a not-so-nice lady (her badge said front desk manager?) take my laundry and answer some questions, so mixed reviews on the staff. Also how is it possible that in 2012 places still require that you pay for WIFI???

Reviews.Title: “Good for a last min trip and near lots of food options.”
Reviews.Author: FoxyLdy6
Reviews.Content: The roosuper very small. But the bathroom is very clean and the in room AC seems to be working great. Fridge in room and large LCD tv as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, great service.”
Reviews.Author: GriffoBristol
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for about a 3.5 star rating (in my opinion). Great location for Union Sq, but a few miles away from Fisherman's Wharf and all the bay area. Though easily accessible by cable car or bus. You will need to get down to this area for Alcatraz ferries. Breakfast was complimentary, and of good quality. Bacon, sausages, eggs and toast with coffee/juice. Nice. Only one bug to bear. There was a staff union demonstration across the road at another hotel, and these guys made a lot of noise twice a day it seemed (with megaphones). They have been making their loud protest apparently for many months now, and it is annoying particularly at 7am when they start their shouting! The hotel actually equipped us with ear defenders on our check in. I kid you not! Besides this, we had a great time, and the hotel was just fine for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kate M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on the way home to the UK after several weeks travelling Australia, New Zealand and Fiji for our honeymoon, and it was definitely one of the best places we stayed at. It was also the only hotel (out of about 20+ hotels) which acknowledged our honeymoon with complimentary goodies - they gave us a bottle of champagne, bag of nibbles, and six breakfast vouchers. Needless to say, the service was fantastic - from reception staff to concierge. We were made to feel welcome and wanted for the duration of our stay, even though the hotel was very busy and full of conference delegates. Our room was great - very comfortable, big bed; lots of space and all very clean. Unfortunately we didn't have a great view, but you can't have everything I guess! The location was perfect for us - Union Square was busy, bustling and full of life. It's easy enough to catch trams nearby, or to walk to Chinatown, North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf if you're fit enough to handle the hills. A great stay, and I wish we'd been here longer than three nights!

Reviews.Title: “Handlery San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: candelariasj
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before and the location is just perfect for whatever you want to do. We, a girls weekend were going to see Beach Blanket Babylon and a little shopping. We did a lot of shopping at the Macy's that is 1 block away so convenient to drop off your packages so you didn't have to carry them around. The weather was so wonderful that we walked to the theater in North Beach, took a 6.00 cab ride back after a wonderful dinner in North Beach. And if you have more things to do after you check out, you can leave your car parked in their garage for just $14.00 for 12 hours. That is a great deal in a town that parking cost more than a great lunch! I love the Handlery!

Reviews.Title: “I would think twice about staying again”
Reviews.Author: Kat09kitty
Reviews.Content: In our room were 3 adults and we got 2 very small double beds....needless to say it was a sleepless night. The concierge wasn't very helpful at all, we asked him to book us an airport transfer but he refused too as he said a cab would cost less.....which in fact was wrong, it only cost us $20 each to airport transfer with all our luggage, in peak hour traffic in San Fran who knows how much a cab would cost. The hotel is in a very central spot, tram stop is just down the road and some great shops are around the hotel...If I was to stay again I would definitely try and stay somewhere near Fisherman's wharf, close to Alcatraz

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for weekend city break”
Reviews.Author: Emlmckenna
Reviews.Content: Ideally located for shopping and transport. Close to tram, bus and Bart. Great bar attached to the hotel with tasty food and great cocktails. Decent sized rooms, bathrooms could do with an upgrade. Concierge is very helpful and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat better than the first time”
Reviews.Author: s1jag
Reviews.Content: I reviewed this hotel in 2009 and once again do not understand the mixed nature of recent reviews. Our room was large, looked newly renovated and had all of the amenities we could want, including free WiFi which was not available in 2009. The location is just about perfect for anything you could wish for to enjoy SF. 1 1/2 blocks to the F Line (Old stree cars, including some from Milan) Two blocks to the Powell cable car turnaround AND BART, which we had taken from the airport, Four easy blocks to Chinatown. Almost literally on Union Square. Probably 40 quality restaurants with a range of prices and fares within a 10 minute walk, and on and on. And the price - Under $200 all inclusive at the height of the tourist season. No shorting on amenities either - in-room coffee, safe, heated pool, informed concierge, friendly staff, large, clean, quite room, fridge and an in-hotel parking garage. I did not talk to one person in the hotel who was not willing to help even to the point of going out of his/her way. You could pay $150 more for the same convenience and not measurably improve on the quality. Unless you are really into ornate lobbies.

Reviews.Title: “Tried hard to help....”
Reviews.Author: Giboos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in Feb. We were greeted by super friendly staff who noticed it was my 30th birthday. They gave us a room upgrade and on arrival in a super spacious room I had a small gift bag waiting full of snack goodies and a card which was so kind and a really nice touch.... However, our attention was then turned to the exhaustingly loud and painful protesting that was occuring across the street. On enquiry the hotel concierge stated that it had been occuring for the last 11 months!!! 2hours in the morning (starting anywhere from 05:30 - 07:30) and then 2 hours in the afternoon from 16:30. That is not my idea of a nice "quiet" birthday celebration. Sleep quality is very important to me when on holiday and luckily we arranged to move rooms that very afternoon which was not a problem to the very friendly staff. The general manager also called after the move to enquire if everything after a move to ensure that everything was ok - which it was! Sleep quality was great and room was smaller but had everything that we needed! :) A big tip from us is stay at the back of the hotel where you do not have to suffer through the protesting.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingHK
Reviews.Content: The location was great, walking distance to art galleries, shopping and BART. The rooms are average and clean, the service was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: crclk14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the holiday weekend and the rates were very reasonable. Rooms were nice and clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. Location is perfect. The hotel is close to everything in downtown Union Square. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and all-around nice experience”
Reviews.Author: CFitzTracyCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time I've stayed here and both times have been pleased with the location, service, and quality of the hotel. It'x centrally located to the theater district, Union Square shopping, and several options for public transportation. I use it for a good 'home base' while in the city visiting my daughter and feel that it was a good choice for the price. Since I was by myself safety is also a concern, and I felt very comfortable there. My only comments would be that their fitness room could use a bit more equipment, and also I went out for a little early morning shopping prior to the noon check-out and when I came back the maids had already started cleaning and tearing apart my room with my suitcase and other items still in the closet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharks2011
Reviews.Content: Great location close to all shopping and china town. Will be back

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: /2 block from Union square; 10 min walk to Moscone Convention Center. The double-bed room I was in was small, but clean with a nice bed. Room service was very good the one time I ordered. not a 5 stars hotel but does the job

Reviews.Title: “Dated but central”
Reviews.Author: ShanePev
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great spot just feet to the Powell st Cable cars and Union Square. 3rd floor rooms have been repainted so they look fresh but the rest of the fiittings are still old. Internet is $9.95 for 24 hours and the rooms are a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Good option in a busy area of the city”
Reviews.Author: TDHLibertyMO
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery only because the city was booked solid for a large convention. The rates were high due to the convention, but I think normal rates are more reasonable. The third floor of the hotel, where I stayed is dated - think old heavily painted woodwork and glass knobbed doors - but clean and the furniture and bed were modern and comfortable. Union Square of course is very busy - access to streetcars, cable cars and other transportation is very good here. Restaurants are touristy here, go to Chinatown, North Beach and other neighborhoods for better food. There are many street performers in the area, but also significant homeless presence and lots of begging. The hotel staff was courteous and helpful. Beware of wifi charges for each device - try to negotiate free wifi when you reserve your room. I'm coming back for a week with my family next month and if the value is better then, this will be a possibility for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: BagmanNZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 22 years ago and when it came to choosing a hotel this time there was only one place for my wife and I. Our stay here was very pleasant. Staff were helpful and informative. Room was brilliant (level 5 on the street frontage) which gave us the sounds of San Francisco to enjoy at night. However, if you don't like a lot of night noise I suggest you ask for a room away from the street. It can get quite loud. We loved it. The hotel is right in the heart of San Francisco and everything is very easy to get to. The only thing that could be better is the bed. It was very very soft for our liking.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price and short trip”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was decent - not great, but not terrible. I didn't want to spend a lot of money for a long weekend and needed it to be pretty centrally located to most bars/restaurants so this hotel satisfied both those requirements. Rooms were small, but decent, and clean. The only real big complaint was the staff was very unfriendly. We just didn't get a good vibe from them at all. It's a good hotel for a short stay, I wouldn't stay longer than 2-3 days max.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Handlery”
Reviews.Author: jackiek1962
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel we have just stayed for 3. Location is great right on union square,the hotel was lovely and clean as was the hotel room. the staff were very helpful and welcoming. Had breakfast each morning food and service were great . could not fault this hotel loved it ..

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasent for a night”
Reviews.Author: H1022
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the hotel in late January this year and was very pleased. From my first contact with the doorman till checkout the hotel staff could not have been nicer. My room was small but very well apointed. My favorite were the sheets- crisp and white. It also has an outdoor pool for the two days a year it is warm enough to swim. The location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great start to our trip”
Reviews.Author: jillmc21
Reviews.Content: We started our 11 week trip west, in San Francisco. The Handlery Hotel was a great choice. Good location minutes from the subway, the tram and buses, moments from Lois Diners, which are excellent, the hotel staff were helpful, the rooms quiet and comfortable, and the local Avis branch handy for picking up a car to take us on our next leg. Highly recommende.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with hidden tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Gusman68
Reviews.Content: We started our holiday here so was very well placed for early morning diners thanks to jet lag. Also great to get the early cable cars to Fishermans wharf. After trudging round San Fran it's great to go for a swim in the quiet pool surrounded by the hotel. Very little noise from the hustle and bustle of the city. From the back of the hotel there is a Starbucks for an early morning brew. Also almost all of the car hire companies are on O'Farrell Street so great for picking up car at end of stay, and not paying parking. Wi-fi is all free as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: F1001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic for me and 2 friends only because of the location. We initially chose it because it reviews had said it had big rooms and the hotel offered to provide rooms for 3 adults (2 queen size beds and one extra bed). In fact they lied and when we arrived there were 2 queen sized beds and no space to add the extra bed for the 3rd adult so we had to have 2 share a bed. We complained but the staff said there had been a mistake and some rooms were larger than others but only able to fit an extra cot for a small child / baby. Nothing they were prepared to do about it so we sucked it up and stayed there anyway. Location was great... right next to Union Square and all the shops. Other than taht nothing special... rooms was decent, bathroom was tiny but service was average-poor. Would only stay there again if they had a promotional offer which made it good value compared to others.

Reviews.Title: “Only thing good about this place is the location!”
Reviews.Author: nstar612
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with wife and kid. The major point for picking this hotel was its proximity to Union Square. I paid $169 (before tax) for Premier King with parking package. Just about the only thing I liked about this hotel is the location. The room itself is average at best. The Premier rooms are pretty big compare to other hotels and you also get free wifi. The service is non-existent. I called housekeeping for more pillows and they never came. I probably will not stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharon G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the first time in December, 2011 for three nights and we loved it! We have been going to San Francisco for over 20 years during the holidays to shop, staying at various hotels near Union Square, but none have the personal feeling that you get at the Handlery. We booked a Park and Stay package, and no one could come close to the price and value. We were so happy with our stay that we booked New Years Eve. Our experience was just as wonderful and this time we stayed in the historic building looking out on Geary Street. What a great room. We also had an amazing dinner at the Daily Grill which is attached to the hotel. This hotel offers everything, with an intimate feeling. It is a family owned hotel, and they make you feel like family! Larry and Sharon Gardiner, Isleton, CA

Reviews.Title: “Very Average”
Reviews.Author: Kate062
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and although the location is great we didn't really like the hotel. The rooms are very large which is a bonus for families but they are old and tired. The staff were not friendly which was disappointing. The hotel is in a really good location right near union square, shopping and tour buses. I would stay here again if my budget was tight.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: Carlos M
Reviews.Content: I had stayed before in another hotel in San Francisco, and it was much more expensive than this hotel, which was also close to union square. So I was kind of scared about how this hotel would be, since it was half the price than the other. To my surprise, it was in an excellent location, the rooms were very spacious, and the staff was very helpful and polite. I had a nice upgrade from a petite to a queen room. A minor issue to many people, but that I didn´t like was that the TV (which was a nice flatscreen) was to the side of the bed, instead of in the front, so that was a little uncomfortable. Anyways, it wouldn´t be a factor that would impede me from staying there again. I hope next time I go the prices are still really competitive. Totally recommendable. Really feet away from Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wanderingmermaid9
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 2 children for 2 nights the week before Christmas. We go into SF every year at Christmastime to see The Christmas Carol and go to the Nutcracker Ballet. We always stay at a hotel in Union Square and I must say that this was one of our most pleasant stays. I booked this hotel after seeing a special on Travel Zoo. The room was in the "old part" of the hotel and, after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I braced myself for a tiny room. I was pleasantly surprised to be given a huge room! It was almost like a two room suite with one queen size bed with it's own TV in one section of the room and another queen size bed with it's own TV and fridge in another section of the room. It was really wonderful. Yes, the heating system was a little loud but it provided the perfect "white noise" to drown out any "SF city life" noise. As mentioned, the hotel is fantastically located just off Union Square and was also in a perfect location for the theater, as we had tickets to Christmas Carol at the ACT. The front desk staff were friendly but nothing spectacular. I did ask for a quiet room and they accommodated that. It was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Yorke M
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for 4 nights. The location of the hotel is close to everything. We dined twice in their Daily Grill and the food was excellent. The room was a bit small for our family of 4 and because our room fronted Geary Street which is the main road it was a bit noisy. Staff were very friendly and helpful. When we checked out and collected a rental car from across the street at another hotel the porter had no hesitation in wheeling our bags across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, location fabulous”
Reviews.Author: DiNeville
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great service, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and decent size. The hotel is a short walk to Union Square, shopping, cable cars and tour buses. The Daily Grill next door has good food but we didn't find the service that great. Some places nearby that we're good are the Pinecrest Diner on the corner of Geary and Mason, great food, great service and real diner experience. John Foleys Irish pub on O'Farrell street, also great food, service and live music.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with extremely helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lydia D
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Handerly for four nights when we travelled around America. Whilst we did stay a little while ago, I am currently planning a trip back to America, and felt compelled to review the hotel. Originally, our travel agent here in Australia booked us into Hotel Union Square around the corner. We were forced to move from the hotel after being there for an hour because the room was filthy. While my mother and I decided what to do about our accomodation problems, we walked down the road and saw the Handerly. The exterior is beautiful; looks like a five star hotel and is extremely welcoming. While we were standing admiring the hotel (and wishing we were there instead of our disgusting hotel!) the concierge came out to us and asked us if we needed help. Even though it was raining and we weren't even in the hotel lobby, he came to help us. After telling him about our terrible hotel, he escorted us to the front desk. From there, the man at the desk helped us find a room. There were only two rooms available with two double beds; one near the pool or one near the lift. We chose to stay near the lift. Apart from the lovely staff helping us find a room, they also went out of their way again that night. We asked the concierge whether he thought a taxi would pick us up from the previous hotel and drive us around the corner with our two huge suitcases and two carry-on cases. We were expecting to either pay for a cab, or have to drag them up the street. While taking two bags around the corner may not sound difficult, by this point it was late at night and raining, and our bags were very heavy. The lovely concierge told us he would bring a trolley to the first hotel, and wheel it back for us to The Handerly. We were shocked by how kind and helpful he was! He told us to meet him in the Hotel Union Square lobby in 15 minutes with our bags packed. We walked back, and 15 minutes later when we stepped out of the lift, he was there with another staff member, who took our bags from us, walked us to the back entrance of The Handerly and took us straight to our room! The room was clean, quiet and had a nice view of the street. The hotel is in an EXCELLENT location, and the restaurant and room service was brilliant. On the day we left, the concierge got us a taxi as soon as we asked and helped us with our bags. Our stay at the hotel was amazing; the staff were fantastic and helped us with anything we needed. The room was great and big, and the prices are reasonable. I am looking forward to staying at the Handerly again when I return to San Fran! The Handerly experience cannot be beat, and you will love your stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Location +”
Reviews.Author: Veronica667
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for accessing the city of San Francisco. It's location is almost perfect, the staff helpful (and nice enough to give us a free upgrade to a premier room!) and the bar/restaurant connected to it is always busy and has some great cocktail mixes and happy hour deals. We booked this place as a secret hotel and were very impressed from the moment we walked in the lobby. We couldn't fault our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: AUSSIEKyneton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our 20th Wedding Anniversary as we had stayed here on our honeymoon. The service was still fantastic and the hotel is very clean. We were in the newly renovated area, rooms are great. Meals at the daily grill are fantastic and prices are reasonable. Great location and would never stay anywehre else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Krusedeb
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for the Kraft Fight Hunger Bowl. The hotel is just down the street from Union Square and just a short walk from the Powell Street station. We had a great rate, the staff was helpful and friendly, and the rooms were clean. The bathroom is a little small without much shelf space for toiletries, but how minor of a problem is that? Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at Union Square.”
Reviews.Author: Diane C
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here December 23-24. The location was great, right next to Union Square, the room was large and clean. The parking garage was very convenient, being in the same building (made it really easy to bring all of our last-minute purchases back )! We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Geoff3009
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 4 day stay at this hotel. Our experience was excellent right from the time we booked our accommodation. The Manger, Jon, communicated before our visit and during. He even arranged to have some wine waiting for us. Thank you Jon. All the staff went out of their way to help and assist us. The Daily Grill was another great place for our meals. Our room was very large with two double beds, clean and tidy. there was no noise at night time and we were located in the older section of the hotel. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. If you want a great stay in San Francisco definately stay here. I will recommend this to all our friends back in Australia and to the travel agent that we booked through. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JLE4044
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Hotel is a great boutique hotel and a great value for the money. The hotel is immaculate and well furnished and comes across as a great 4 star hotel. The bathroom was just standard and a little on the small side but clean and pleasant; there's a small sitting/vanity area that was perfect for my wife to do her make-up while I showered. Location is very nice as well, just a block from Union Square and the trolley to get down to Fisherman's Wharf. Also, there's a Starbucks across the street on the backside of the hotel should you wish something other than hotel coffee. Parking is $38/day, on par with most other locations, but I'd recommend you get the package that includes parking if you can get it. In our case, it cut the parking to only $20 per day. You won't find $20 parking anywhere! If you're flying out and need to print your boarding pass, they have a complimentary computer in the lobby that's designated just for that purpose! The best part of the stay was the staff. Everyone, from the bellman to the kitchen staff member I met in the elevator, was very engaging and friendly. To me, that is a huge plus. We would stay there again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Music to my ears”
Reviews.Author: Eric H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Handlery for an evening on Dec 21. Our experience was simply top notch. From the courtesy of the garage staff to the professionalism of your lobby personnel to the very charming concierge Dale. Even the ladies we encountered from the housekeeping staff were very friendly. We stayed on the 8th floor in a very nicely appointed room overlooking the swimming pool. A hotel room in the middle of a big city can be loud, but these "inner" rooms are very quiet. Our room was spacious. It was furnished with a small couch, a king size bed, flat screen tv and we had a balcony. Being on the top floor we also were treated to a bit of the view of the city. The bathroom and shower were terrific, with a dressing area just outside of it. A coffee machine was provided in the room, but Starbucks was literally right across the street. It's no secret that this hotel has an incredible location in Union Square. It's close to so much, including BART.
