We were attending a concert in Oakland that night, (Bob Seger, who is one of my all-time favorite artists). We left our vehicle at the hotel and walked to the BART station in less than 5 minutes. A great evening in a great city in a wonderful hotel. Wish we could've stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: dogcow99
Reviews.Content: 2nd time here. When we check in, we were informed that Mr. Handlery would like to meet us! And this is no $300 a night hotel and we're not high rollers. Dining, shopping, a 5 min. walk to the BART station. My only advise is to get a non-street side room as there has been a LOUD ongoing strike at the Hotel Frank across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Paddyday”
Reviews.Author: 549Paddyday
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Handlery for either Christmas or Thanksgiving for several years now. It's a lovely, comfortable hotel right on Union Square, a great location for any holiday. We will be taking advantage of their U.S Open golf package in June

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location, nice service”
Reviews.Author: Marvin13
Reviews.Content: We (two adults and one teenager) stayed in the San Francisco suite over Christmas and it was perfect for us. Very spacious, like an apartment, clean, and comfortable in a homely way. Lots of windows including a classic bay window and plenty of natural light. There's one separate bedroom (with king bed) which can be made private with solid wooden internal-sliding doors, and the couch folds out to a fairly comfortable extra bed. The bathroom is big (with bath), there's a separate dressing area and plenty of hanging and storage space, and the little, basic kitchen has a sink, microwave and small fridge (no freezer). This gave us just enough independence with food and drink. The location, at Union Square, is brilliant - everything is accessible and it's so easy to get around. At the doorstep are a range of galleries and shopping galore, from luxury labels to Levis to more modest options and Chinatown - which is extensive - is a short walk away and definitely worth exploring. Our favourite meals were at an Asian fusion restaurant called The House - divine - (about 30 mins walk away) and the seafood restaurant Fog Harbour, down at Pier 39 (Fisherman's Wharf). We didn't order room service much but we enjoyed what we ate in-house, which comes up from The Daily Grill downstairs. Staff at every level were friendly and polite, and housekeeping is excellent. The streets were pretty alive into the night and things started up again quite early; we loved the sense of life and activity that we could feel so close; it added to the sense of excitement around Christmas. At the end of our stay, we were also pleased about the bill; we think the room rate is great value. We would definitely stay again if back in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “a few glitches, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Beth G
Reviews.Content: we were a bit naive in including a swimming pool in our hotel search criteria for a September visit to San Fran, which I think was one of the reasons we chose the handlery, and then never used the pool. mainly because it was a great city and we were always out enjoying it, but also because the weather wasn't too warm, and the pool area didn't look that appealing and wasn't that easy to get to from our location (the hotel is essentially to hotels joined together). had we not been searching for a pool I doubt we'd have chosen this hotel, as for the same money we could have got more luxury. the staff were adequately helpful, but it wasn't a hotel I wanted to spend time indulging in, as the facilities we a dated. a sleek bar, and a bit of a facelift wouldn't go a miss. the room was definitely better than the communal spaces. taking that into account, I'd say this was a 3* hotel. it's a bit shabby in places, and the room was quite small, but, location location location - this place certainly had that. union square, near every shop you could want, walking distance to great restaurants and good transport links. to be honest, after a day or so I warmed to it (we stayed 5 nights) but if I went to San Fran again I'd choose a better grade of hotel in a similar location, for about the same money, without a pool, as I didn't use it. we had a party going on next to us on our final night, and to their credit the front desk closed it down shortly after I called to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; outstanding price!”
Reviews.Author: Donald B
Reviews.Content: Across the street from Union Square and the St. Francis Hotel, in the heart of art gallery row. Excellent access to public transportation. Rooms nicely appointed. Adjoining restaurant pricey, but plenty of competition available in immediate area. Walking distance to ACT and Curran Theaters. I am a former resident of SF, so consider myself more than just a one-time tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable room with very good service and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: FinanceDad
Reviews.Content: I booked the Handlery Hotel in July for our stay from Wednesday, October 5 through Monday October 10 (Columbus Day weekend) for my family of 4. Approximately 5 days prior to our arrival, I received a call from hotel staff that the hotel's computer system had accidentally overbooked the evening of Wednesday, October 5 (the big Oracle conference was in town) and that we could NOT stay at the hotel that Wednesday evening. While I was quite upset that we couldn't stay there, management did two things to accommodate our family's inconvenience. First, and most importantly, they put us up at the St. Regis hotel Wednesday evening. We had a very comfortable sleep after flying all night coming in from the East coast! Second, upon our return to the Handlery Hotel early Thursday evening after a busy day of sightseeing, we found a nice "Thank You for understanding" basket filled with a bottle of wine, crackers, nuts, etc. waiting for us in our room from Jon Handlery, the President of Handlery Hotels, together with a very sincere apology for this inexcusable screw-up. Bottom Line: My wife and I felt they provided outstanding customer service to "right the wrong" that impacted our vacation. We stayed in a room in the new section that overlooked the pool and it was VERY quiet. I pretty much summarized the reviews I had read on TripAdvisor down to two key items: Stay in the new section and get a room overlooking the pool. Our room fulfilled both of those requirements. We had two queen sized beds and a room that, while not large, was spacious enough for a family of four. It was also a very clean room. The only negative, as others have pointed out, was that getting to the room required going up some stairs and then walking down a long hallway. Nonetheless, we didn't find it to be a great inconvenience. Location: This is what we really appreciated about the hotel. It's close to Starbucks, Union Square, a number of amazing restaurants and shops, the theatre district, and it was very close to a great breakfast diner right around the corner (Lori's Diner -- we ate there EVERY day for breakfast and my two kids, wife and I LOVED it!). For a few evenings where we came back late from sightseeing, the Daily Grill, connected to the Handlery Hotel, fit the bill for good overall American Cuisine. Steaks, pasta, hamburgers, seafood -- you name it, they got it. And the overall quality of the food was pretty decent. Bottom Line: I would not hestiate to highly recommend the Handlery Hotel for its service, location, and rooms in the newer section of the hotel. For your money, you are unlikely to find a better value in the Union Square area of San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: djaketime
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect and the style is moder. The room I had was a little bit small, but clean and confortable. May be on higher floor is even better. The Concierge has been very helpful and gave us many nice suggestions in terms of restaurants and place to visit. The city is very nice and if you have the right suggestions you can save many time walking around. I'll stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: walnutcreekmom1958
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I live locally and wanted to spend the night in SF during the holidays to see the sights and do some shopping. I chose The Handlery based on it's reviews and location. We reserved a double double historic room. When we checked in, we were assigned #245. The room was dark and looked out onto some sort of air shaft. I went down to the front desk and requested another room. We were then given #315 on the front of the hotel. Although, the rooms have been renovated very nicely when they say historic they mean it. This hotel is old with winding dark hallways! Both rooms reeked of some sort of disinfectant or Frebreeze. For some strange reason I could not adjust the thermostat to go below 68 degrees. To open the window meant loud street noise, which was fine during the day but not at night. There was a loud band playing in the bar next door until late and then to top it off they were dumping empty bottles in recycling containers right below our room until 2-3 in the morning. I honestly don't know how any guest would get a good night's sleep without earplugs. I'm not sure if the "premier" rooms are any better but I would not recommend staying in the historic rooms. HUGE Disappointment!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaterGuyDeepSouth
Reviews.Content: Super location, friendly staff, very clean rooms. The rooms aren't large, but everything else (plus the price) more than makes up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Average, at best”
Reviews.Author: azminadeem
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week during a business trip. The hotel location is very good. The front desk staff are quite friendly. The downside is that rooms are small and the bathroom is particularly small. There are no drawers for clothes except for a closet to hang them. The hotel does not offer breakfast and one has to eat at the adjoining restaurant. There's no option of adding Internet access to room rate and one has to buy it separately.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Shopping in SF”
Reviews.Author: Terri F
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently took our two 13 year old daughters to the City for a Holiday shopping trip. The Handlery was the best location -- right in Union Square and walking distance to the Westfield Mall. It was super convenient, very reasonably priced, very clean, and we felt 100% safe in this location. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay in SF. The staff was helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: felipej
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Friendly Reception Staff and cleanliness could not be faulted. Grill bar next door very good. Had perhaps the best Kobe Steak i have ever eaten, and my wife a lovely Cobb Salad. Some superb American Reds by the glass and a wonderful Cocktail Menu.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic 2nd Stay here”
Reviews.Author: SuitcaseStan
Reviews.Content: We returned to this hotel for the 2nd year running as it was so great last year. Had the same room (pool facing balcony). Great staff on the desks, nice clean reception, large clean and well equipped room. Received wine on arrival and vouchers for breakfasts next door in the Daily Grill. Excellently placed in safe area close to all transport links. Would stay nowhere else in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “The cell on the second floor-room 210”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: As a former resident of San Francisco, I try to visit every November to see friends and do my Christmas shopping. Since I am not a tourist, my requirements are very specific regarding location, and I prefer to stay close to Union Square and lower Nob Hill because of transportation, ease of walking to my old haunts, and it being well-lit and well-traveled at night if I am alone on foot. The Handlery is in an excellent location, on Geary Street just off of Powell, with access to buses, cabs, and the Powell street cable car line. This is an older hotel, with a new and an old wing. I had stayed here in 2008 (booked through Expedia, as always) and stayed in the old wing. Those rooms are very small (when they say "petite" they mean it!) but had been given an upgrade so the bathroom was quite large. When I booked this trip I did not count on an upgrade due to my length of stay (5 nights) and I expected a small room and a small bathroom. Having read some recent reviews, I knew some recent guests had been surprised at the size of both, but I only stay at boutique hotels in San Francisco so I was prepared. Or so I thought. While the size of the room was in keeping with what I expected, the layout was not. The TV faced the desk, so I guess they expect guests to sit in a straight backed chair with their feet on their dresser to watch TV. ( Or watch with the eyes in the back of their heads while they sit at their desk?) If you want to watch TV in bed, you have to sit with your neck turned as the TV barely turns toward the bed. (Due to a nerve problem with my neck, I ended up with a migraine from this.) And then there is the bathroom. Because the ice machine is directly behind this room, 210, the bathroom is tiny. Oh, it's well lit (although the magnifying mirror on its extending arm was so high and far back on the wall as to do me no good, and I am 5'3") but the shower (no tub) is LESS THAN FULL SIZE. It's not even a full stall shower! It's triangular in shape and the drain is almost at the threshold of the shower. I don't see how a taller or heavier person could have bathed effectively in it and God forbid a gal should try to (gasp!) shave her legs! In order to get under the shower head I was against the curtain (which, incidentally, smelled like a rancid dishrag). I have short hair so my showers are short but they were not relaxing and who needs a shower to be stressful? The staff were pleasant enough (although no bellman offered to help me with my gigantic suitcase and it took me no fewer than four phone calls to get a sharp knife when I wanted to slice some cheese one evening when I was eating cheese and crackers in my room) and other than the stinky shower curtain the room was clean. I did not ask to move rooms because their business center costs $5.00 per 20 minutes and I was not going to waste my time and money researching their website to see if 3/4 baths are mentioned anywhere. (They ARE NOT.) Even if they were, this hardly qualified as that shower was not even a full sized stall shower. I know--I have lived with several! If you consider this hotel, the absolute pluses are: location, cleanliness and the pleasant staff. But be prepared for TINY TINY TINY rooms and if you can, avoid room 210 unless you are there for a very short stay. I, for one, will not be back unless I can be assured that I will never have that small a bathroom again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: jpaq68
Reviews.Content: A few years ago, while looking for a hotel in San Francisco, I chose the Handlery for the simple reason that it was near my favorite nightspot and I haven't wanted to stay anywhere else ever since. The Handlery has a great location, helpful and friendly staff and the rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location.”
Reviews.Author: mrpackethead
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here.. Location was awesome.. Out the door and you are in union square and shopping galore.. My wife loved it! Hotel is a restored one.. so its a little bit quirky in places.. The room we got was very nice.. Bed was good.. Included Breakfast was alright.. Not somewhere i can get hugely excited about, but i'd stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked and under staffed”
Reviews.Author: Deb C
Reviews.Content: The service is awful and very understaffed. Took more than 30 min to check back to bell for hold and longer to get it out of hold. Poor communication within the hotel organization. The bell nor the concierge to get the valet to pull the car out. When inquiring for a late check out in late night/ early AM, were told to check in the "Morning". It's inexpensive and there is a reason for it. You get what you paid for. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: waterview51
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here four times and will continue to make it my destination. The people that work here are helpful and at the same time seem to enjoy working for the hotel. Location is great and rooms are a good value. Yes, they even have a swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: NIkkiRG
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful staff. Was upgraded to premium room at no charge because they found out it was our honeymoon. All staff were kind and friendly. Beautiful rooms. Very clean. Extremely close to union square. We walked through north beach and to fishermans wharf from the hotel. Taxi rank around the corner with the cable cars also very close. Surrounded by retail stores. Location great!!! Would definitely recommend to friends and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, good value, fantastic concierge”
Reviews.Author: Kate V
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights with a family of two adults and four small children. The family suite had a queen, 2 singles and a sofa bed. It is an older hotel but well maintained. The only negative would be the room is a little small and has only one bathroom. The hotel's best asset was John the concierge who spent a lot of time ensuring our tours were sorted and was so friendly and welcoming. The Daily grill adjoining was also perfect for meals.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Vacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night mid November. Booked this hotel through Hotwire so probably wouldn't have stayed here otherwise due to normal rack rate prices. Having said that we enjoyed our stay here. The location is perfect for Union Square and nearby locations. The room we had seemed to be two separate rooms that had been made into one (327 if I recall correctly) so was extremely spacious with 2 double beds, two tv's, 2 clothes cupboards, 1 bathroom albeit small, user controlled air con, a work desk and 2 windows that looked out onto other room windows. Comfortable bed and adequate shower although the water saving nozzle didn't allow a great deal of water to pass through. Furnishings were in good condition and decor was modern and up to date. Had to pay $10 for wi-fi internet which was a bit over the top. Requested late check out but hotel couldn't oblige due to full bookings. We were able to leave luggage at the hotel after check out as we had a late evening flight out of SFO and spent the day sight-seeing. Concierge arranged shuttle bus to airport for $16 which was good value, although the shuttle did a few other pick ups from other hotels before heading out to the airport. Front desk staff were efficient and dare I say somewhat aloof as was the Concierge - maybe we checked in at a busy time. Overall a pleasant stay and would stay here again if we could get a good rate. Location is perfect for Union Square, cable car, BART, ferries etc.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located & Friendlies Staff in CA!”
Reviews.Author: luvhotelss
Reviews.Content: Every time we travel to San Fran we always stay at the Handlery Union Square. Its centrally located and a short walk from the subway which is best way to get from the International Airport to town. From the time you walk in - staff are all smiles and the place is buzzing with life. We stayed in in June 2010 with our 2 yo who was loving the queen bed she was able to sleep in. Concierge were helpful at all times and ensured we saw all that is to see in a short stay. Front Desk always had a smile on their face even at hectic check in and out times which was refreshing to see. Thanks to John and the Team for making our stay, yet again, a pleasure. Hope to see you in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigeastleighfan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August. We had a very small family room to accomodate myself, my husband and our 15 year old daughter. We found it a little difficult the room being so small as we had a case each which we couldn't unpack and stow away given that we were on a road trip and were only there for two nights, this made the room extremely short on space. It was never the less perfectly functional, and clean. A nice touch was that we received vouchers for breakfast in the restaurant each day, which was very nice indeed. All in all, we were very happy with the hotel part of this was becuase of it is very well situated short cab ride to pier 39, walking distance to chna town, cable car and tram a stones throw away and Union Sqaure a few meters out of the door to the right. I wouldn't want to be there for to long but it was perfect for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location right next to Union Square and all the other amenities that surround it, taxi's park outside so it's easy to get to the Piers! The room itself was quite dated and had a corridor running either side of it which was quite noisy. Now for the downside, my wife's jewellery "disappeared" while staying at the hotel and had been kept in the room safe, as we didn't discover this until 15mins after we had checked out (she thought I had removed it from the safe and I assumed she had removed it from the safe) the Hotel didn't want to know. 2 months later and after filling out a report with the San Francisco police department we are still trying to claim back from our insurance!! The hotel is in a great location, but please be really careful with your belongings while you stay there; it ruined what was a fantastic trip to California.

Reviews.Title: “The View, the Service and the Character”
Reviews.Author: brenagain
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Handlery after sleeping on my friend's couch for two nights in order to attend a conference. On the third day, I booked a room and invited my friend. We only stayed one night but the experience was the best. When I booked, I asked for the conference rate because the official hotel was Handlery. I was given the conference rate without a problem for two doubles. I arrived and was initially given a handicapped accessible room with two twin beds. I had originally booked two doubles. I changed the room because the accessible bathroom had a big room to shower in with no shower curtain and a hand held shower head, the windows faced an outdoor hole in the hotel and I felt like I was in a closet with no air flow, and I am tall and can't sleep on a tiny twin bed. I simply asked to be changed. The front desk was calm and nice and had no problem with a switch. I was switched to a very small room with one double bed and had to switch again because of the mistake in needing two beds. No big deal. I went down stairs and waited in line again and was helped at the front desk. I had asked for just the courtesy of a window facing the street because I wanted air and to see the street, any street. The front desk clerk, Matthew, was looking in his black binder to find me a room with a street view and two beds. He has looked on several floors when I asked "do suites have two beds." Matthew replied "yes." He quickly booked me into a family suite for one night. When I got to the room, I was so happy. We had windows! Moreover, I was actually touched at the quality of the service. I went to the windows to catch a glimpse of the street and found that I had a corner room with a view of Union Square's Ice Skating Rink!!!! I also ended up with two rooms so I gave my friend, who put me up at her house for two nights, her own room. We opened the windows and had a great cross breeze and a fantastic view. This room was an entirely different experience. The other two rooms I had to get out of were both like closets. They actually gave me a feeling of being closed into a space that I was trapped in. I could not have stayed in either room. On the other hand, the room I ended up in (family suite) was the best because it had that open feel, the character of the older hotel and the best view I couldn't have dreamed up in my wish list. Each room had a flat screen TV, there was one walk in closet, a fridge and a coffee maker. The beds were great. The pillows varied and I slept fine until the protest at 7am on Sunday morning. There were protesters at the Frank Hotel that woke the entire block up with sirens and mega phone chanting and I resent that because we had been up early every day for the conference and Sunday was our only day to sleep. The noise wasn't too bad for being above the street and I slept fine until the protesters woke me. I don't sympathize with the protesters because of their wake up service. The window with the best view had a broken blind and it was some work to tie it up to really get that uninterrupted view while having company later on the night of our stay. I would choose the family suite again but not the regular rooms. The service was the best of any hotel and they worked with me every step of the way. Some rooms are VERY SMALL. Make Sure you know your limits. If you need air and a street view, ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: christi_10
Reviews.Content: awesome location very close to powell street bart station so our commute from the airport was easy. other public transportation (cable and street cars) were easily accessible as well. the hotel was close to starbucks and walgreens as well as lots of shopping and restaurants. was pleasantly surprised to find mouthwash and q-tips in our bathroom. nice touch! enjoyed the balcony and the large premier king room very much. yes, there were protesters at the hotel across the street. san franciscans will protest ANYTHING. we couldn't hear them once inside. the only noise we heard was the guys next door coming in on saturday night at 2 am.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price but hotel a little tired”
Reviews.Author: kiwigonzo
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Union Square Hotel is ideally located for visitors looking to see the sights as well as conference attendees at the nearby Moscone West Conference Center. The staff are pleasant and obliging. The rooms (in the older section) are adequate, but the decor is tired and they could do with double glazing. Yes, that noisy picket line at a neighbouring hotel was a regular, but unnecessary alarm clock. The price was very good with a net rate of 149 per night. Very competitive for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice updated room near the pool”
Reviews.Author: Januarybride01
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the location of the hotel given the price we paid per night. We checked in and as we walked back to our room, we thought. . .oh no, this looks like an old motor lodge! Then we walked into our room and couldn't believe how nice and updated and big and clean it was. I would surely stay there again, but would request a poolside room. We had a friend who stayed in a small room in the older tower side and he said that his room was much smaller and looked old and outdated, so I guess the key is to request a poolside room. Again, SUPER convenient, only 1 block from Union Square and from the trolley car. About 30 minutes from the airport in morning traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: Mommystyle
Reviews.Content: I always tell people that I love this hotel. We stayed last month and we had our best ever stay. The reasons are to follow: **Everyone on the staff is very nice. They understand that guests are on vacation, and they give their best consistently. The concierge staff went above and beyond for us when we had a box that we sent via Fedex returned (after our departure). The bell staff, Front Desk, everyone was so nice and helpful.....every time you come in contact with them! **Daily Grill is a great restaurant with a great bar. Ken (our favorite bartender there) remembered what my husband likes to drink even though it has been 3 year since our last visit! He is a class-act who gave us great tips on places to visit in Sausalito. Food is really good (try the spinach mashed potatoes). **Rooms are nice, great beds, bedding, pillows. We had a room with a balcony that overlooked Geary Street. Wi-fi is free. **Location is great. It's near so many restaurants, bars, stores. Transportation is easy from there because it's in Union Square. We will definitely be back! Kudos!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: yami810
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Handlery Union Square was very pleasant. We stayed in the historic side of the hotel, which had lots of character. The rooms were a good size taking into account that it's in Union Square. I am very picky with cleanliness and our room exceeded expectations in this regard. The price we paid through the hotel website was better than any offered through other travel sites. THe best thing about staying at the Handlery was its location. Steps from the corner of Geary and Powell, there were many places to shop, eat and people-watch right outside the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good. Still room for Improvement.”
Reviews.Author: Mikeman222
Reviews.Content: The Handerley is a very good hotel.... but there is always room for Improvement. Location was Perfect.... love the Fact that there is Macys Men and Macy's Women close by. we at the cheesecake factory one night ( which is located at the very top floor of Macy's Women ). Did some shopping in the Giants Dugout. We also got lots of Christmas Shopping done as well... ( Mostly done at Macy's by the way ). The one thing i would Question tho... is the Size of the Bathtub in the room.All of us had trouble fittting in it to have a bath. Thats the one Part that Improvemt Can be made.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown San Francisco Location - close to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: LoyalPacker
Reviews.Content: This hotel has 2 sections - a newer side and an older side (we stayed in the older/historic side). This side has more character, nice furnishings, but the rooms are smaller. And unfortunately, the weekend we were there, the hotel across the street had picketers marching outside every morning starting at 7 am with bullhorns - not condusive to sleeping - at all. Really an unfortunate amenity. The other thing about staying so close to downtown - sirens allllllllll night long. We live in the country and are not used to city noises - so that was kind of annoying. It was nice being close to mass transit - which we used all 4 days we were in town. We were apart of a large family gathering and made our reservations 3 months in advance - but when we arrived, everything was all messed up and it took about 3 hours to straighten up 8 rooms. They did make it right and gave us a couple upgrades - so we were taken care of eventually.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarlowIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the start of November,,,What a great location... They gave us vouchers for breakfast in the Daily Grill, it was great.. We had our own kettle which broke in transit and they even provided another one for our stay, there was a coffee maker in the room but my friends sre tea drinkers.. We were in the old building but the rooms were nicely furnished and beds very comfortable. Couldnt believe we were so central to everything.... Very pleasant staff,and good house-keeping.... What more can i say, we had dinner one night in the Daily Grill, excellent, service, price and very friendly waiting staff. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel, We have travelled all over the world and have often paid a lot more for a much inferior hotel... Hope to be back some day.. Marion Lowry....Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sooze_68
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally 50 metres from Union Square and access to the cable cars. We had a newer room around the pool at the rear of the property. It was very quiet. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed. Free wi fi in room was great. I would recommend this hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem, absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Vicki P
Reviews.Content: I really cannot speak highly enough of this hotel; we stayed here for 3 nights in September on the 3rd leg of our honeymoon. Upon check in we were given a complimentary upgrade to the new part of the hotel overlooking the pool area with a nice balcony and there was a bottle of champagne waiting for us when we entered the room, it was such a lovely touch seeing as nowhere else on our trip had acknowledged that it was our honeymoon. The little added extras you get with this hotel are just fantastic, they absolutely go above and beyond the call of duty, from little toothbrushes, toothpaste and bottles of mouthwash to “snack packs” filled with bottled water, crisps, fruit and oat bars. They put a daily paper under your door during the night so it’s waiting for you as soon as you wake up. You are given free breakfast vouchers every day where you can choose from a selection of 3, and the breakfasts are really good (tip: get down early as it gets very very busy and you may end up having a long wait). The rooms are really lovely, very spacious and clean, with all the mod cons you could need; fridge, large flat screen TV, huge comfy beds, lounge area, coffee & tea making facilities, iron, separate vanity area with mirrors galore, fluffy gowns and slippers. The staff is so friendly and went out of their way to help us – the street outside the hotel was closed off due to a potential gas leak just as we were waiting for our transfer to the airport to arrive but they couldn’t get to us. The manager of the hotel arranged for us to be taken through the main hotel and out through the back so that we could access another street, they then organised a taxi for us so that we could make our flight. They were just great. There is just one small negative that I can mention and that is that you have to carry your suitcases up a flight of stairs to get to the new part of the building, this was a bit of a pain as we had a lot of luggage, but in the grand scheme of things not a problem. The location is good, just off union square. Thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 4foreigners
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Handlery in the Historic section. The room was perfect for us (three) with two double beds. We had a corner type room with no windows that faced the busy streets, Our stay of 4 nights was quiet, relaxing and because of the location it was extremely convenient to the Cable Car, Shopping, Union Square, China Town... well pretty much everything. I think my only complaint would be that the shower lacked water as it had a water saver shower head which didn't work well with the lack of water pressure... no big deal though. The front desk staff and concierge was very helpful and accommodating... we would definitely stay here again. For those that complained about the outdated things... it's the Historic section! maybe try the newer premier section of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: martinaHly
Reviews.Content: stayed here with a group of friends, thought it was a fantastic hotel, really clean, reasonable and you could not get more central. would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: 27emzy57
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights, it was a lovely hotel with friendly staff. The location is perfect if you want to shop and eat out and has nice bars around it but is a little far out if you want to visit fishermans at night although the cables cars can easily bring you back. we were pleased with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Think twice...”
Reviews.Author: Bryan W
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many nice hotels around Union Square over the last 7 years - this is not one of them. Staff is not helpful and borders on being rude. Room was very small and bathroom is outdated. Bed was confortable but unfortunately in front of a window that rattles in the wind and covered with a blind that does not block the morning sun. I typically stay at a Personality Hotel, not sure why I strayed. Live and learn (and beware of Teena at the front desk!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: WhoFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the historic section. The room was nice and good size but not huge. Parking was fairly easy in their garage (enter on O'Farrell St.). The attached "Daily Grill" is very good. I have seen many mixed reviews on this Hotel. I can only say our stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Geoham69
Reviews.Content: Only yards from Union Square this excellent boutique hotel is a good place to stay whilst in San Francisco. We stayed 3 nights on our way to Honolulu, the hotel is of a very good standard, staff very helpful and efficent. Our 4th floor room was perfect for our needs and could not be faulted. The attached restaurant was also of a good quality and again the staff were attentive at all times. It was worth booking for evening meal as the restaurant is open to non residents and can get very busy. The situation of the hotel is such that you can easily walk to other restaurants and if you are relatively fit, walk to the financial district, chinatown, little Italy and Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dougiet33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and found it to be very comfortable and it's in a very good location. Room was clean and tidy and bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Central to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: EJGnpa
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this boutique hotel in the afternoon and found the front desk to be very helpful. Went to the room, unpacked and suddenly there were loud noises from the street. The hotel across the road apparently had issues with past staff and they could demonstrate on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays for about one and a half hours in the afternoon and then Saturday morning at seven am. This had been going on for months. The Handlery is great but they should have told us about this noise. Fortunately we wanted to get up early on Saturday ... we did not have to use the hotel wake up system. The conceirge was very helpful and the location was great for restaurants, shopping and cable cars stops. We ate at the Daily Grill a few times and stopped in the bar as well. Interestingly we felt an earthquake one night while in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Cab827
Reviews.Content: It was our honeymoon and our first time visiting San Francisco. After hours of research reading reviews on various hotels, various booking sites, and various neighborhoods to stay in, I contacted this hotel directly to ask a few questions. The staff was friendly, very informative and we ended up with a really nice room for a reasonable rate. The room was clean (very important), quiet (we were on the 5th floor with a private balcony facing the pool) & the bed was very comfortable. We did not keep our rental car with us while staying here but opted to experience the various forms of public transportation available - the location of this hotel ended up being very convenient for that. We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it for anyone wanting to stay in the downtown areas.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding trip”
Reviews.Author: lv2trvl42
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a great area, walking distance to lots of shopping. Remember when staying in San Francisco and taking your own car parking is expensive everywhere. Try to get a package deal with parking if possible. My husband and I felt the staff were very nice and the rooms nice and clean. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Close to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: ninama3
Reviews.Content: The best thing this hotel has to offer is proximity to Union Square. Other than that, not fabulous, but not horrible either. The staff is friendly and accommodating. I stayed for a week on business and everyone recognized me by the end of the week and said hello. The rooms are small and VERY basic, but passable. A bit on the noisy side, but that's the trade in for being so close to the city centre. Daily Grill is the restaurant attached to the hotel - they also do room service so the grub is better than expected for an average rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: Jack775
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to San Francisco with three teenagers to attend a concert and we all thoroughly enjoyed the stay. The hotel was close to restaurants, shopping, our concert venue, and Union Square (of course!). The weather at the end of September was wonderful and there was plenty to do in the evening after the concert. We all felt very safe in this area and were able to walk to the concert. The staff at the Handlery was very accommodating. I would suggest you chose to include the parking fee in the price you pay for the room as parking is very expensive. I would recommend this hotel to families with teenage children.

Reviews.Title: “Centre of Town”
Reviews.Author: Remmers
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location and we had a very nice room facing Geary Street so there was noise and action all night but nothing that worried us too much as we soon got used to it. Rental car agencies are around the corner 50 metres from the hotel and for shopping and restaurants, cable cars etc it is just so easy to walk to them all in a couple of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel that's not too pricey”
Reviews.Author: DomfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Just off Union Square was a very helpful location, but right on the edge of "where the soup kitchens start". We had a great suite, supposed to be historic, which really meant not that up to date, but clean, smart and stylish and plenty of room for a family of 4. Massive cupboards, shared bathroom (within the suite) all good. friendly and helpful staff. Didnt use the pool, did use the car park - bit of a trek from there to the front desk reception. great place to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Our visit to The Handlery 26th-29th September 2011”
Reviews.Author: franandhow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at The Handlery for 3 nights from 26th September this year, after a long flight from London we arrived at the hotel. Hotel is an a fantastic position to Union Square. We stayed on 5th floor and the room was right by the elevator and next to the ice machine, but surprisingly we heard no noise or disturbance from either. We stayed in an Historic Queen, which was in the main building, the room was an ok size with a large bathroom. Room was very clean, apart from a 'make do' closet which was a little scruffy. Bed and pillows were too soft for us, but that is just my opinion. We visited the pool every day, but the trouble was there was no sun that time of year until just after 4, and it was boiling hot weather when we visited about 90 each day! There are lots of beggars as I was warned, but they were no problem to us. We purchased a 3 day Muni pass for $21 each, which worked out good value as the trams were $6 each way. We jumped in a taxi from the airport to the hotel, it worked out $55 each way with tip. Way TTTTOO many restaurants ALL great food, Cheesecake factory 2 mins from the hotel at the top of Macys, always good. Visited North Beach area one night, just jumped on a tram, off at North Beach, great choice for lovely pasta. Back to the hotel, front desk staff were ok, not overly friendly but ok, doorman was great, so friendly All in all a good clean 3 star hotel in a fantastic city. We loved San Fran, we will return. Thanks Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - OK place”
Reviews.Author: tnt-la
Reviews.Content: Stayed during the first week of August, 2011. The location is excellent - across the street from a cable car stop and walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Our room was in the second / back side of the hotel with a view of rooftops and other buildings. Room was comfortable, but a little hard to get to because of the various stairways we had to navigate. The concierge was terrible. I called ahead of time to get restaurant recommendations so I could make reservations - no one returned my calls. After checking in we went to the concierge desk to ask about restaurant recommendations and were told "I don't know what you like so how can I give you a recommendation" - nice. We ended up asking the gentleman at the front entrance and were given two wonderful places and the best way to ge there. Other than the concierge, the rest of the staff were nice and helpful, but we probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Tasi
Reviews.Content: We arrived late, the flight had been delayed, the San Francisco immigration computer system had crashed - we were exhausted. Our room - in the newer part of the complex - was large, clean and very nice and the bottle of red wine and complimentary goodies waiting for us was a lovely touch. Small gripe about having to lug our bags up that small stair case but everything else was great. Staff were very good and the room had everything and more than we required.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Greeby
Reviews.Content: Driving along geary street, the outside of the handery hotel strikes you as being old, in the fashion of many other san francisco buidlings. However, the moment you step into the lobby, a gentleman is there to stop you where you are to ensure that you don't have to pick up a single bag. The staff and very helpful and friendly. Our room was on the second side of the hotel and it is beautiful. It was a premier queen and I highly recomend it. There is a modern bathroom and seperate powder room complete with seat and fancy mirrors. There is also a nice wardrobe with the usual safe, bathrobes and ironing equipment. The main area of the room consists of two large and very comfortable queen beds, a modern study desk, flat screen TV and tea and coffee facilitys. However, the best part of these rooms is the view! there are floor to ceiling windows with views of O'Farrel street or Geary and I enjoyed just watching the hustle and bustle of San francisco from my room. Location is amazing, right in th middle of union square and right next door to macys. We visited fishermans wharf on the cable car and it is a very close walk. There is also a lovely pool, however, we did not use it due to the wheather being too cool. I highly recommend this hotel to both families and couples, this is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: keevs84
Reviews.Content: was very pleasantly surprised with this hotel, wasn't expecting very much but it really is lovely. Our room seem like one of the newer ones and it was nice, the windows and the like are a bit dated but it never bothered us, we were there to sightsee. Pleasently surprised that we got breakfast vouchers, we hadn't been expecting them and the breakfast next door really set u up for the day. Any of the staff we encountered where lovely and very helpful, housekeeping went out of their way to get us a travel plug and where in r room in minutes, I was expecting them to take their time, she even came in and helped me get the iron going, so hats off to her. Very central location for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely welcome”
Reviews.Author: deftlydefiant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of our honeymoon. Lovely welcome of fizz and snacks in our room on arrival and a follow up phone call from Mr Handlery after we had arrived - nice touch! We stayed in a premiere King on the 6th floor. With the patio doors open it was pretty noisy but with them shut you'd have never have known you were in the middle of the city! The room was lovely and large, kept super clean - the amenities such as hair dryer etc could do with a little updating but apart from that couldn't fault it. The staff were very efficient (quick check in/ out) but to be honest other than staying there didn't have too much contact with the hotel. The hotel is centrally located, near Union Sq and the cable car line which we used quite a bit. Would def recommend and if we come back to San Fran will stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: nikki_shannon
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here on our road trip down the PCH. Room - was quiet, clean and comfortable. Staff - so helpful. They helped us arrange last minute tickets to see the Giants game and picked up our tickets. Location - Union Square is full of nice shops and restaurants, and a great base for exploring SF if you are staying longer than we did!

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: londoner031
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the handlery so we obviously like it!! Staff are extremely pleasant & helpful at all times. The hotel is so central that it's easy to get around on the Muni transport or cable car.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: spencer51
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is in a great location being just a 10 min walk from the Powell St BART station. Yeah, its an uphill walk but this IS San Francisco. Once settled in you are close to the main cable car stop and other public transport options and the tourist info centre in Market St. ( As well as the big Westfield shopping mall ) The rooms we had ( two couples from Australia ) we fairly small but quite adequate and clean. Great breakfast in The Daily Grill adjacent to the hotel . Our flight was not 'til 11pm on the day of checkout but we were able to store our luggage in a secure area so that we could do the bike ride across the Golden Gate Bridge , a definite must - do. Staff were freindly and helpful. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good location in city centre”
Reviews.Author: judith14
Reviews.Content: San francisco is a magnificent and friendly city and the handlery a good place to stay at! There is a swimming pool, quiet rooms and in san francisco it is really an obligation to cycle the golden gate bridge :-)!

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AML67
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic! We found a great deal and enjoyed a nice get-away weekend over Labor Day 2011. Too bad the Giants lost the game we went to but the next day's walk to and through China Town was perfect. Union Square is full of art and music and character. We had 3 kids with us and would stay there again---if we find another great rate ($128/night!). We had dessert in the Daily Grill...delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, reasonable price, fading interior”
Reviews.Author: Donald C
Reviews.Content: I almost gave the Handlery 4 stars - the check-in staff and concierge were pleasant; I had a good online booking experience [including email follow-up]; there were some reasonable facilities (fitness room and pool); and our rooms were clean and kept well. However, the fading quality of the interior really made me plump for 3 stars. There is a pervasive atmosphere of an aging interior decor - from the musty corridors, brown brown beige brown colour schemes, one of the lifts being almost permanently out of service, and the lovely 1980s yellow marble in the lobby! Yum. We didn't sample any of the hotel's catering - when you are slap bang in the middle of SF there is little need! The WiFi throughout the public areas and the rooms was good in terms of signal strength, coverage, speed and contention. In-room entertainment was limited to some package of US cable / satellite channels (no HBO, BBC, movies etc) Still - for a good $30-$30 per night below nearby hotels with more modern refits and similar locations the Handlery prices itself appropriately. The fact that it was entirely full when we were there is also an indication that they aren't doing much wrong (although the fact that it was Fleet Week should be noted)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but good location”
Reviews.Author: Baystate2
Reviews.Content: As with all the downtown hotels, the Handlery really sticks it to guests during "Oracle Openworld" week. Minimum nights stays and overspriced rooms. When not during a convention, the Handlery is moderately priced and is in a great location. The bar / restaurant is also a rip-off with their drink (wine) prces and limited menu. If you stay anytime there's no Moscone event and eat at any of the great restaurants nearby you'll be quite pleased with the location, rooms and staff. Just avoid the place during Oracle Openworld. I really wish they would move Openworld to Las Vagas or Orlando so more people could afford to attend.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST”
Reviews.Author: LMF51
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Handlery on a few occasions now and always enjoy our time there - the staff (particularly Hermie) are always helpful and welcoming and we enjoy seeing them again. We had a lovely large and quiet room with a separate sitting area - this was in the historic part of the hotel - and Mr Handlery had arranged for a bottle of wine and a bag of snacks to be left for us - a very nice surprise. We would hope to visit again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable but no double glazing !”
Reviews.Author: Steph T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week. The hotel was full of character and the staff could not be more helpful expecially John Wood the helpful concierge. The breakfasts were good but as the hotel was full we had to wait up to 25 minutes to be seated at a table. Our room was at the front of the hotel and was very noisy. Not the hotel's fault that there is an impromtu drummer (who has no sense of rythmn just down the street - who kept going until after 12:50 am the other morning). As it was Fleet week there was a protest march outside to wake you first thing on the Sunday. So, if you're a light sleeper ask for a back room as it is not the most quiet of hotels. The room was always kept beautifully clean, and was in a great location. Handy for the cable cars, buses and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quigley61
Reviews.Content: The Handlery was a wonderful, smaller, boutique hotel. From the reception desk, the room, and location, it met every need. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine34684
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Handlery Union Square. We had a large room, very clean and nicely furnished overlooking the pool. We were in the newer section of the hotel and there was no noise at night. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The room had robes and was very well stocked with amenities. We stayed for 3 nights celebrating our 30th Anniversary and received a chilled bottle of champagne, a bag of snacks and a note from Mr. Handlery. Very nice touch. Customer service was number one. They know how to set themselves apart from the others and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Handlery!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Handlery yesterday. Our room was very good, a premier king with robes and a surprise gift bag and champage for our 25th anniversary. That was a lovely touch and we thanked Mr. Handlery himself. He was genuinely kind and glad to hear that we enjoyed the hotel. We had delicious breakfasts every morning. Just make a reservation the night before and there will be no wait whatsoever. We never had to wait once. The healthy breakfast is very good, as are the waffles and the full American breakfast. No complaints at all. The hotel is positioned in the heart of where we wanted to be - union square! I highly recommend the Alcatraz tour with the audio. You hear actual former inmates and guards speak. Very creepy and interesting all at the same time. We had one fancy dinner out at the Grand Cafe on Geary. It's a beautiful restaurant and the food was fantastic. I had the salmon and shared the chocolate pot de la creme. Delicious!!!!!! That was probably my favorite food during the entire trip. It was an amazing trip and I'd go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Union Square hotel”
Reviews.Author: 7acrossthestates
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right in the thick of Union Square and not too far to get to Fisherman's Wharf and all the attractions down at the pier. Didn't offer connecting rooms and for us being a large family this was abit of a pain but the rooms were lovely and clean, very well presented although they were the smallest rooms we encountered in our whole trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: fandangoMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 4th floor and paid $159 per night. Good value for a hotel right on Union Square and we'd paid up to $219 on the way to San Francisco for 3 star hotels so I guess it was good value however our room was a "historic" room which we found out meant "unrenovated". The room was fine, bed was very comfortable, our room faced the street and was a little noisy but manageable. The room was clean and comfortable which were the main considerations however other options right across the street or round the corner are Hotel Frank, Francis Drake or Villa Florence however that hotel is right on the trolley car route. The only thing that spoilt it was the 2 concierges we met who were determined to be aloof and provide the minimum of help, made us feel quite uncomfortable about asking anything at all with their world-weary eye-rolling. I hope their attitude improves.

Reviews.Title: “Very good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliemac1012
Reviews.Content: Large room, dressing gowns, even slippers on request. This was excellent accommodation right near Union Square, with very good breakfast included in the price, although a bit mean in not offering coffee and orange juice - it's one or the other and you pay extra for the more expensive juice. Very helpful staff, quiet room and small pool for the warmer months (if you get those in San Fran.) Would heartily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in SF, convenient for shops & restaurants”
Reviews.Author: sposa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Handlery for a girls night out of shopping and a birthday dinner. I asked for a room away from Geary Street and the reservationist at the front desk was very courteous and professional and I did indeed get a room away from the busy street. Great room, immaculate, comfy bed, and room service was prompt and friendly. There are 2 hotels and are connected by a walk way which was a bit confusing, but got the hang of it. I parked my car in their garage and that worked out very well, great service there also. I would definately stay there again. I booked my room through bookit.com and got a terrific price, much lower than my friends who did not use the inet for a booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rack64
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in San Francisco. After traveling cross country we arrived at the Handlery tired and a little cranky. Quickly our car was parked and our luggage delivered to our room by friendly staff. We went to the front desk and were pleased to find we had been upgraded! Fantastic room with plenty of space and all the amenities overlooking the charming courtyard pool! Great location! I was on a cable car riding down the hill to the wharf within minutes of arrival! I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Handlery many times. Rooms are always very clean and the entire staff helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: K Q
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at the Handlery for over 40 years.......... and my husband and I the last 20 years. This year we went up for our 35th anniversary and we not disappointed at all. We stayed in the San Francisco Suite and it was great. So many amenities. We were greated by a very gracious gift package sent by Jon Handlery, the owner, upon arrival........flowers, champagne, wine and other goodies. Special treatment for a special occasion. Very appreciated and such a classy touch. The staff was always helpful with a smile. Our room was clean and very comfortable!! We had a great stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: smash413
Reviews.Content: the hotel has recently been refurbished and we were in the 'new part' which means a bit of a walk but our room was lovely. there is a pool which looked clean however we were too busy to use it!! location is amazing, I agree with the below comment about the concierge, he was 'short' with us as well, and the wait for the hotel restaurant was a little long, for breakfast i understand but we specifically booked a table for 9.45pm when we came back from Alcatraz as we knew we'd be starving but still weren't seated until 10pm as they needed to prepare the table (I thought the point of booking was that you bypassed this!) Overall i would definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again, it felt upmarket, and our 'niggles' are comparatively small.

Reviews.Title: “Great place close to the 'hub' of things”
Reviews.Author: BryanBoerne
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference is San Francisco and couldn't see spending $600+/night for a room at the hotel where the conference was located. I did a bit of online research and found this hotel about 3 blocks away for about 1/3 the cost. It fit the bill perfectly. The check in was very smooth. We arrived early in the day and asked they store our luggage until a room was ready. I requested safekeeping for my laptop, and although they did not offer any, we decided what the heck. If it's missing, it's missing. The hotel is almost directly across from Union Square, which is a central meeting spot for the double decker bus tours. It's a relaxing way to see San Francisco with 'on and off' capabilities. Upon getting back to the hotel from this tour, our luggage was promptly retrieved and we were given a room key. We were in the historic section with a queen-sized bed. The room was kind of small, but I've come to believe that may be a 'norm' in historic hotels. The room was nicely appointed, comfortable bed, large flat-screen TV, coffee maker, etc. We never could seem to get the room to cool down, so we simply kept the windows open after the first night. Housekeeping service was very good too. The hotel is about three blocks from Market Street, perhaps five or six blocks to Chinatown. There are plenty of dining opportunitues all around, but we prefered the liesurely stroll to Chinatwon most evenings for some great cuisine. The trolly line is within a block and the Powell Station BART is only three blocks away (the best way to travel to and from the airport without a doubt...no traffic). The F line to Pier 33 (Alcatraz) and Fisherman's Warf was about four blocks away on Market Street if you wanted to take an F line trolley ($2 good for all day). High-end shopping was all within a block or two. It could not have been more central. I was in conferences all day, but the central location made it easy for my wife to enjoy liesurely strolls in the Union Square/Financial District/Chinatown areas. We went to the pool to see it, but never got in. The pool felt as though it was heated. It was outdoors and in a nice courtyard setting in the newer portion of the hotel. We also heard good things about the attached restaurant from some locals, but never tried it. It was too easy to simply walk around and find something. Our only complaint was the concierge seemed a little abrupt when we did seek advice. It may have simply been perception, but he didn't seem happy to help. We both noticed it on seperate occasions. But the front desk was just the opposite. Friendly and courteous at every opportunity. It was a great stay and given our research, seemed a reasonable price given other hotels in close proximity. Had the room and bathroom been bigger, I would have rated it excellent instead of very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sherry W
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Near Union Square, trolley's, shopping, etc. The rooms are very nice and clean. This is an older hotel that has been refurbished very nicely. The help was exceptionally nice and helpful. A special thank you to Hermie who took great care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Quite satisfied with a couple of buts”
Reviews.Author: Silversox
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this Hotel but......there is no room service past 11pm (which is sometimes a problem when flexibility required), no ability to select some movies and the room was on Geary Street which is very noisy and the glass in the windows is single pane. In the middle of the night I sometimes felt like I was living the street buskers dream (or nightmare!!). On balance you couldn't ask for a better location. The only other thing my husband really wanted to say is the shower for him was like needles being thrown at him!!! Oh btw the concierge probably needs a holiday - a little short for me.

Reviews.Title: “location location”
Reviews.Author: saltwaterTN
Reviews.Content: Get anywhere you need very safe in union square. first timers great hotel. Staff was very helpful can not say one bad thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a perfect honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: fsb2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Handlery for 4 nights from 1st September, our first port of call on our 3 week honeymoon in the U.S. My parents had emailed the hotel to let them know that we were arriving and were on our honeymoon. When we arrived the man behind the desk was so welcoming and polite and congratulated us before we went off to our room, to find that they had upgraded our 'regular historic room' up to what can only be explained as a 'Suite'! Huge for a city hotel! We were welcomed to a bottle of sparkling wine on ice and a bag of snacks and water...perfect after our 11 hour flight! Later on, getting back to our room after a day out, we found a message on the answerphone from the owner of the hotel, welcoming and congratulating us, and apologising that he wasn't available to welcome us when we arrived! Little things like this - that we really didn't expect, or need - made us really feel special and set our honeymoon apart from any other holiday. The room, staff & The Daily Grill - All perfect, a brilliant start to our honeymoon! We hope to visit San Francisco again in the future, and would definitely consider staying at the Handlery again. The location of this hotel is great!

Reviews.Title: “loved the bar”
Reviews.Author: alastair4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel on a trip around the USA. Having been to San Francisco once before we new we wanted to stay near Union Square and this hotel was perfect in this respect.The room we stayed in was quite old and small as was the bathroom and we looked out our window onto a brick wall. Apart from the location the real highlight of this hotel was the bar and restaurant connected to the hotel. I think we sat at this bar most nights, the service from the bar attendants was superb and very entertaining. We ate at the bar one night and I had the best burger I can remember. Breakfast was included in our rate and while the wait was a little long for a table in the weekend, which i guess is understandable, it was simple but enjoyable. If we come back we might look at other hotel options but would certainly come back to have a drink in the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great base camp for San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Gusman68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated perfectly to get around San Fran. It was clean and the restaurant was of a very high standard

Reviews.Title: “Good location, rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: daz66
Reviews.Content: Good location at union sq and the food at the daily grill is very nice and worth trying. We were on honeymoon and they knew this, even though we were there just for a few days I expected a better room, we had no view what so ever and the bathroom was in need of updating, it all seemed so dark and gloomy. I had no idea until we stumbled it that it had a pool! And the rooms around the pool looked so much better, strange that they didn't offer any of these, as I said we wanted a nice room. Other than that the hotel is ok for a quick stop over. We visited the intercontinental and that was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “functional and convenient”
Reviews.Author: vic19662010
Reviews.Content: The hotel's in a great part of town. We chose the "stay and park" option and didn't regret it. It's great just to leave your car with them and use it when you want. Our Premium King Room looking over the pool was huge. The pool was great. We didn't need much help with reception, etc but the little we had was efficient and charming. For this sort of hotel, in this part of town, it didn't seem too expensive. All perfect for the first four nights of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but it can get noisy.......”
Reviews.Author: AllanY60713
Reviews.Content: Checked in by friendly and efficient staff, concierge was very helpful. Having just come from MGM Grand in Vegas, the room size and bathroom was a little dissappointing but a good standard. Main issue with this hotel is the noise from outside. From around 7pm until 10pm we were 'treated' to a steel band which was very annoying. It is located on one of the main traffic streets and as such suffers from constant beeping, emergency vehicle sirens etc we were on the 7th floor out of 8 as well. Also the area can be a bit unsettling at night due to the number of homeless people around. Air conditioning in our room was also not that great and the windows had to be opened to let cooler air in. Bathroom only had a shower, was a bit small. On the other hand, it is centrally located for Union Square and the shopping district. Sightseeing buses within a 2minute walk which will take you to the main city attractions including Alcatraz (we couldn't get tickets for Alcatraz whilst we were here so make sure and book before you come!) and we got a complementary breakfast for each day we were there which was a welcome bonus. Choice of a cooked breakfast, cereal and fruit or waffles. The breakfast is served quickly by friendly staff. Dinner at the restaurant was also very nice and reasonably priced. 5 minute walk from the BART station, so easily get to it to go to the airport, was only $8.10 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but Quirky”
Reviews.Author: Philygirl4ever
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is right in the middle of Union Square right near all the greatest shopping. The hotel is a bit quirky as there are two parts to it with stairs separating them (making it very difficult to get your luggage up and down.) Be sure to ask the front desk if you will need to use the stairs (by the outside pool). You might need help with your bags. Clean and beautiful rooms. comfortable beds. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: CEUS69
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Francisco having picked up my partner from SFO, we decided to stay at the Handlery Union Square...listed as a boutique hotel near Union Square we were intrigued since we typically stay at more upscale facilities such as the Sir Francis Drake and the International... Not knowing what to expect, I was pleased to find it within easy walking distance from my Amtrak bus shuttle (I took the Capital Corridor Amtrak to Emeryville, which then has a choice of three bus shuttle destinations: Ferry Bldg, Shopping Ctr. on Market, and Financial District). Thanks to Google maps, I found the "Shopping Center" destination to be the closest!). I just walked up Powell, took and left on Geary, and there was the big "H" sign for Handlery...easy! The check in was fast and efficient; I asked for an inside corridor room (I needed quiet from the street noise since my partner was flying back from Hong Kong and needed to rest) which the reception desk courteously accommodated and even upgraded the room! Although the room was characteristically "compact", (given its vintage era) it was efficient and updated with a large flat screen TV, marble bathroom, large closet with an in room safe (with a "key", imagine that?!) We were surprised by the heated pool that was located inside the hotel, but outdoors...loved it! It is open 8am to 8pm daily... Since my partner was bringing back our car from SFO skypark, she parked at the on-site valet hotel parking that is located around the block, also landmarked with a big "H"; please note, parking for hotel guests is $38/24 hrs, plus San Francisco's infamous "parking tax" of an additional $3.35...however, this price allowed us unlimited in/out privileges and the porters do pick-up and off-load your luggage to and from your car... Seriously, if you can avoid taking a car, I would recommend it since public transportation is fairly good, the problem only exists for you real "nightowls" who might find themselves stranded in the hood... There were lots of Australian visitors at the Handlery, they shared that the exchange rate is great (in their favor), and there are direct flights from Sidney....hmmmmmmm! Our room was quiet, very comfortable bed and the linen upscale; only downside, no refrigerator in our room...that's okay...plenty to drink within walking distance.... Overall, we very much liked our stay and would recommend it to our friends...

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what we got”
Reviews.Author: Dutchdrifter
Reviews.Content: A friend and myself visited San Fran and needed a decent place to stay with good public transport options. The Handlery was perfectly located within easy walking distance of Amtrack, Bart, and cablecar with a very friendly staff. So far so good... BUT; we just booked the first room that popped up on Hotels.com, (Petite) and for $163 we were put in the tinest of rooms imaginable, with only a dbl bed and so little room that the TV was at right angles to the bed. How are you supposed to watch? We are two single, energetic guys, and being stuck in a tiny room completely piled with our belongings wasn't very cool. So to the front desk we go. Very polite, but the pool and excercise room both close at 10pm. What is a guy supposed to do??? On the positive side, very clean facilities, great staff and perfect location. Only take my advice and buy a queen room at minimum and get in your excercise early. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “A great base”
Reviews.Author: Shelley C
Reviews.Content: An excellent base as just a block away from all transport and obviously the Shops !!! bars and restaurants all around. There is a safe in the room which is always a bonus. The room was spacious and beds comfortable. Ignore the reviews about it being noisy - we had a room over looking the picketers over the transport system and didn't notice anything. It was a bit noisy to start with but being that a) we were in bed by 11 due to having a 7 year old and secondly compared to NY / London etc - the noise died down by midnight. The pool area was lovely and pool was warm even though outside wasn't so warm. Staff were all excellent. The only thing that really needs changing were the lifts (elevators) and Showers were a little but dated. other than that great value for money and great location !

Reviews.Title: “Under-promises and over-delivers”
Reviews.Author: Rosie1504
Reviews.Content: We came to San Francisco from Australia to celebrate our 25th Wedding anniversary and chose the Handlery based on a newspaper review. We were not disappointed. The Handlery under-promises and over-delivers, which we have found to be very rare in the hotel business. We arrived at our room to a find a bottle of French Champagne on ice and the flowers our daughters had sent us were placed in a lovely vase on a small side table. We also appreciated that the mini-bar was not stuffed with over-priced alcohol - we could actually keep our milk cool. Our room was near the central thoroughfare and pool which we found to be quite noisy, but when we requested a room change, it was done without us lifting a finger. We would like to make special mention of Tony (guest gervices) who seemed to be always on duty, and for whom nothing was too much trouble. He contributed enormously to our positive view of the Handlery and fabulous San Francisco. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: RollOnOctober
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for four nights at the end of August '11 at the beginning of our holiday travelling on the Pacific Coast Highway between San Francisco and Los Angeles. Overall, we were very pleased with the Handlery. The rooms were clean and ours was quiet (we had booked a Premium room around the swimming pool and were very glad we did - I can imagine the rooms overlooking Union Square do get a lot of noise!). Our only 'gripe' was that we were expecting to overlook the pool, but actually we had a dismal view of a dreary apartment building next door! Breakfast vouchers were an unexpected bonus, and the breakfasts were actually some of the best we had during the whole holiday. Front of house staff were friendly and helpful - especially the concierge, one of whom recommended a good Italian restaurant and Scomers seafood restaurant (amazing dinner!!) and another who spent a lot of time explaining how to get the best out of public transport in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustLangwarrin
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in San Francisco. Our room was exactly what we had asked for. Thank you Handlery Union Square. Fantastic location right near Union Square and close to everything. Our room was a King Premier room overlooking the pool and would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Shoppers paradise”
Reviews.Author: JoanE_chinook
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery in 1996 and had very fond memories of the trip, so when we were planning a quick visit to San Francisco, we decided to return. The hotel is clean and the rooms slightly above average size. Front desk staff was pleasant and helpful (we changed rooms after the first night - we were right next to the elevator) and we didn't notice excessive noise in a full hotel (even the first night right next to the elevator) and I am a light sleeper. I really don't like paying for wifi but unfortunately, it seems most of the nicer hotels charge for it and the Handlery is no different. The cost of parking was truly out of line (almost $40 a day) and at the union square location, there are few other options. As for union square - it is centrally located and a great spot if you like shopping. Also a good taking off point for drives as it's not difficult to get to 101. It wasn't a great neighborhood for walking around, especially in the evening. We had a hard time finding a moderately priced restaurant within a 6 block walk. There was an above average diner around the corner. The biggest issue we had was with very aggressive pan handlers who quite literally followed us down the street hounding us and yelling at us in one case. We are not folks who dress extravagantly or otherwise draw attention to ourselves so I'm guessing it's just currently an issue in the Union Square area because of all the high end shopping.
