Reviews.Author: POLLYANNA57
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at the Handlery and chose it because of TA critiques. Stayed in SFO 10 years ago and nearly chose previous hotel. The Handlery was a much better hotel in the same area. All the hotel's staff are the friendliest, obliging people we have encountered anywhere after many years of travel. After the unavoidable and horrible long flights over from Australia, after which we always feel like we have crawled out of a dumpster, and probably look like we have too unfortunately, at a very early morning check-in, to our great joy and relief we were assigned a room immediately. Bliss. I observed all the Reception staff trying to assign all guests at check-in a room immediately. This is a very commendable practice and shows a hotel with not only well trained staff but a very tight and regimented house-keeping system. How intelligent. And rare! Well done folks. We had an 8th floor room on right side building facing the pool and it had a room like balcony, perfect. The rooms are very spacious and fitouts quite luxurious. The hotel is deceptively large, in a spread out way causing the occasional oddity with lift access up one level to one wing. The staff are abundant and more than obliging helping guests with luggage at all times. However the hotel does cater to guests requiring Handicapped facilities and special access or rooms. Location is perfect. Right in the Retail Centre and Union Square area and an easy walk up or down to the BART station at a cost of only $US 8.10 per person to/from airport. Effortless. Recommend buying the 2 day tickets for the Hop on Hop off Buses and definitely as many rides on the thrilling cable car/trams across as many routes as possible. San Francisco is a vibrant city and great for walking around. Our only negative experience. Ten years ago there was evidence of a drug problem in SFO. This time from the minute we arrived in the CBD we were constantly approached by homeless/beggars. I calculate we (very carefully) handed out what amounted to $US 50.00 in small change across the course of the 3 days. Great care needs to be taken in any public place, Hot Dog stands, the BART ticket machines, similar. They pounce. Usually it is just a request for the change but can be overwhelming. We saw a very young man going thru a rubbish bin at Union Square and carefully sorting the contents and happily going off with what food he deemed still edible by himself.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother, there are better hotels”
Reviews.Author: minxymoo66
Reviews.Content: Staff weren't that friendly - weird, we thought this was the country where customer service was exceptional, which it has been for our entire stay in the US. This was our last stop on a 3 city trip. The bar closed at 10 and the barman that served us was positively surly. We had breakfast vouchers which only allowed you one drink (either tea, OR coffee, OR orange juice). First morning we realised the water they bring you for the tea is enough for 3 cups, so I brought a teabag from the room (same as the ones on the restaurant table) and just asked for a cup, thinking we could share the OJ and the tea. The waiter said we were only allowed one choice and wouldn't bring me a cup until I said I had brought my own teabag, and then with a huffy attitude??? Rooms small even though we had booked a superior room and and the bathroom is REALLY tiny and the loo roll holder fell to bits on the first use! Waiters were ok, but not up to the standard we had come to expect in america. Road noise wasn't as loud as the air con unit which we couldn't turn off or even change the settings! Definitely in need of an upgrade! Cleaning staff were good and were respectful of your schedule. Wifi cost us (per computer) $9.95 for 24 hours (Hotel Frank across the road had free wifi, only needed a password from reception). It is pretty far from everywhere except Union Square, but the public transport is pretty good in San Francisco, and if you have the stamina for the hills, you can walk from the waterfront up Mason, but it will take about an hour plus. All in all, an average hotel which I will not be hurrying back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a very convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: jonnyboy11354
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Memorial Day weekend. The hotel was great as it was convenient near the BART station and Muni station. Also, there were many bus stops around to get us to other parts of the city. There were plenty of sights to see around and a lot of the neighborhoods are in walking distance. The cost of the hotel room was also great when compared to the other 4 star hotel chains. The room was really clean and with new furniture. Please be sure to try to book a premiere king room on the new wing of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want to do the Tourist thing!”
Reviews.Author: AndrewN259
Reviews.Content: We just had a fantastic 3 week trip around Los Angeles, San Francisco and Las Vegas and am sorry to report that this was the lowlight of the trip. A few things that we found unsatisfactory was the street noise in the rooms. We asked to moved after the second night as we just was not getting any sleep, and to their credit they did move us, but the second room was not a great deal better. The owner of the hotel was good enough to come out and meet us as we were know to him through a business contact, but unfortunately the rest of the staff were very stand offish. The bell captain made money out of calling particular cab drivers, even though it meant we waited 20 minutes for his cabbie friend to arrive and the two different gentlement on the tour desk found it very hard to crack a smile or put any effort into our requests for help. The rooms are very small and it looks like they have been made small over the years to make room for bathrooms, as I believe at one stage, the guests used to share bathrooms on each floor. Overall I guess this was ok for a 3.5 star hotel, but it's distance from all things that are touristy in SF is a problem. Almost every activity we did, or tour we took left or was in Fishermans Wharf with the exception of Union Square. My recommendation would be to stay at Fishhermans Wharf if you are there oon holidays, and make one trip into Union Square and save yourself a lot of travelling time and the cost of getting to Fishermans Wharf and back everyday! Feel free to drop me a line if you would like any further info

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - 2nd visit in 2 years.....”
Reviews.Author: Yonkers_au
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It's my 2nd visit in 2 years and will be my preferred hotel in San Francisco. I arrived a day late due to my international flight being cancelled. When I checked in, my booking was still available and the check-in staff were more than helpful. I was in the historic wing in a small room which was more than suitable and comfortable enough for a solo traveler. A few of the staff remembered me from my stay last year and it felt like a big family was running the hotel. The hotel is a two minute walk to Union Square and is central to all shopping areas. This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in in a long time and I'll be definitely staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Globaltrading
Reviews.Content: We arrived early at the hotel but they let us checked in. The room was clean and the bed was so comfy but the room was a bit small but it's normal in SF. There was leakage in the zinc in our room and they can't fix it at that time. They changed our room the next day. All the staff were kind and helpful, specially one night manager (I forgot his name) that was always kind enough to greet us whenever we met. The location was very near to Union Square. We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. Tips: across the hotel there is a japanese ramen restaurant. Try it. It's worth the queue.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well staffed and great location.”
Reviews.Author: MechGalway
Reviews.Content: Great location! Walk to many GOOD restaurants and easy access to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: Norcalmommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a getaway weekend. The valet parking is behind the hotel and they do not offer an elevator. You have to walk up and down the stairs to get to the front desk. The staff are rude and do not care about customer satisfaction. We paid over $200 a night and the room was smaller than my closet. It was old, smelly and our room looked out onto the main street which was very noisy. In the morning, there were picketers outside across the street, which woke us at 6:50am. When we called the front desk, they apologized but did nothing. When we checked out, we were not asked how our stay was or thanked for our business. I wouldn't stay here again if it was free. Do not stay here...buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Smelled like old people”
Reviews.Author: Shawn215
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what you want for a short stay in the Union Square area. The building itself was very disjointed, so going from the parking garage to your room was a process. The central location made me forget about the room smell, and the bathroom was pretty big. The price was very reasonable, especially if you are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean/Great location”
Reviews.Author: NMIC
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights celebrating 30th anniversary. Champagne and goodies waiting in room for us. Nice little spotlessly clean king room overlooking streets of S F. Yes, we had some street noise..no biggie, it's S F! Our last morning there when we were going to sleep in..The Frank Hotel directly across the street from our room, employees began the loudest protest that I have ever heard at 7am sharp! No sleeping in for anyone! They ruined our last day! It would have been nice if the front desk personnel would have apologized or at least mentioned it, after all I just spent almost $700 with them.. Oh well! The concierge was very helpful and a true sweetheart. Front desk staff just average, typical get you in and get you out. Overall great location, clean, comfy rooms for average of $200 a night. Seems outrageous for this Texan but reasonable for the area!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in SFO Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: love2eat75
Reviews.Content: The exterior of the building was well kept and free of debris around the sidewalk and street. Bell hops (though we didn't need them) were on the ready outside the hotel. The lobby was in pristine condition and everyone greeted us with a smile upon entry. The check in process was a little troublesome but it was my bad. They let me use the business center to get the problem cleared up, went back to the desk and within 2 minutes the clerk handed me the key cards. That was the smoothest check-in I have ever encountered. When we first entered the room it was immaculate. Fresh clean linen, clean floor, clean bathroom, and brochures on the desk. There was also a 46 inch TV to boot (which we hardly used except for the morning news). The room was just large enough to keep my wife and I comfortable, but it's not like we were there 24 hours a day. Why vacation in SFO if your going to spend 18 hours a day locked up in the room. We pretty much woke up at 6 am, watched the news, left the hotel at 7 and didn't come back until 9 or 10 pm, so no complaints about room size for us. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept in for a hotel. It was neither too hard nor too soft. I fell asleep as soon as my head hit the pillow. Either I was extremely comfortable or extremely tired from roaming the streets for 15 hours; either way I had 4 excellent nights sleep. I swear, so many people like to nit-pick, but this hotel is the best I have ever stayed. I had room 702 which over-looked Geary and it was a little noisy but the noise ceased at around 10 or 11 pm. There was no bathtub, but the shower suited us just fine. It was just enough to fit my 6'4" 340 lbs frame. In other words, it got the job done. I hardly take tub baths anyway so it was all good with me. Everyday housekeeping made the room look just as it did when we checked in. Fresh bed linen everyday, new towels everyday, they did a fantastic job. I already had a trip itinerary prepared so I didn't need the concierge too much, but when we did need him, he was extremely informative and had great knowledge of SFO's public transportation system. That was very helpful because we didn't quite adhere to our schedule. The hotel was the perfect location for us. Half a block from Union Square, across the street from a MUNI bus stop, 3 blocks from Powell Street BART/MUNI station and the light rail stop. It's within walking distance of Chinatown also, but we chose to take the Powell/Mason cable car to get there. That stop was a 1 minute walk right out of the hotel. There are all kinds of breakfast spots within a block of the hotel, so there is never a shortage of new places to eat for breakfast. It is not even a 2 minute walk to Pinecrest Diner which serves up the fluffiest pancakes in SFO. Check-out was a breeze and we received our deposit with-in 48 hours of check-out. I guess if there was one complaint I can muster up would be the slow elevators, and there are only two elevators in the front lobby which are very tiny (they only hold 6 people). But that's not enough to knock a point off my rating. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is convenient to everything, very comfortable, affordable, and it's historic. Stay here if you travel to SFO. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for location and spacious, attractive accomodations”
Reviews.Author: redborn51
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an excellent value with a reduced overnight parking rate. The room had great amenities and was very large and comfortable. Nice new decor with comfy bedding and renovated bathroom with traditional fixtures such as marble and a dressing table area. Robes - yay!! The view from my room was a small courtyard and nice to have a pool although I did not use it. The only weird thing was trying to find the room....there seem to be two elevators accessing the rooms leading to two different sections of the hotel that were not connected. But once I got the hang of it, it was no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “All about Union Sq”
Reviews.Author: mWrite
Reviews.Content: The entrance to hotel was nice, bell boy greeting and wiling to grab luggage (thanks, as a European I handle them myself) entered reception area. Everything went smoothly. Later I noticed that elevators were slow, so I ended up running up to 5th floor. It keeps you fit. Room was on so called Historic site and was very good. Of course it is also very different from 2 year old hotel room at Hiltons were I stayed previous night. Historic room has its own style, even though TV set is new flat screen and other materials too. For San Francisco, I wanted more suitable feeling, touching city's history, not faceless standardized room. Noise from street can be heard clearly, but this was 5th floor historic room. I totally share opinions that bathrooms are small, I have had wardrobes bigger than this bathroom in my room or Lufthansa A380 First Class bathroom was bigger w/o shower (thanks LH for upgrade). I would like to though point out, bathroom was suitable, clean, with amenities and perfect for its functions, shaving, showering etc. At the end we are talking about bathroom, not a ballroom. Staff was good in normal interactions (check-in/out), except one bell boy, but I think I contribute that more to language or Europe vs America. Concierge gave good service and helped with Shuttle to airport. (ended up lot of shopping) What I like in this hotel also as European, it is reachable with Bart (not Simpson) from SFO Intl. airport to Powell St (30min ride) and even with luggage another 7 min walk from station to hotel. USD8.10. I always prefer tracks vs taxi(cab) as it can get expensive if you get stuck in traffic jam. Quite often taxi drivers tend to give you bit sight seeing. Hotel has an Excellent location, just few meters from Union Square. And by the way, San Francisco is bloody freezing city. If you think that you packed enough clothes, pack additional sweater.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for shoppers”
Reviews.Author: sdsuindian
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to SF on business. I'm not sure how people do there rating, but compared to other hotels I have been to this is at best a 3 star. Definitely not the most modern hotel. I liked that there was a fridge in the room and the staff was great. There is a lot of shopping nearI suggest using the stairs, the elevator is old and slow. I had one meal at the restaurant which was expensive and not that good. I ordered a hamburger with french fries. The fries were WAY too salty and the bun was hard. The bathroom had a shower and the sink was outside of the bathroom in the front hall in a way too small area (ok for me, but if I were there with my GF not even close to enough room). Ive stayed in worse and Ive stayed in nicer in SF, but this was a good deal for what i payed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, central location for exploring San francisco”
Reviews.Author: anleigh
Reviews.Content: Good sized rooms for city centre stayed in premier room worth the little extra, balcony with table and 2 chairs. Excellent location to union square and Market street etc. Pool is a lovely addition to unwind after busy day! Friendly staff. Clean rooms. Would defiantly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Torunto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights for a conference. The location is fantastic, 1/2 block from Union Square and 5 blocks from Convention Center. My room was lovely and spacious for San Francisco. The fan made noise and I called the front desk to have it fixed while I was out. When I returned there was a note on the bed saying they could not fix it and please call the front desk. The front desk told me that I could move to another room and when I opened the door - it was a suite!! What a great stay that made it, more room than I could have ever imagined. Also, I lost a makeup jar in the first room, nothing important but I asked the front desk clerk to look for it anyway. Again, when I returned to my room (suite!) there was a letter from the clerk on the desk, saying that he was sorry but he was unsuccesful in locating my item and to call housekeeping with any questions I may have. This was a very impressive.touch. Finally, the concierges, Ed, John, Bill were all amazing and so helpful with everything. When I returned at the end of each day, the front desk always greeted me with "Welcome back." I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in S.F. for its excellent location, comfort and above all service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CancunCrew
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel in a very good location. Street noise is somewhat of a problem, but I think most hotels in the city have that problem. The rooms were on the small side but had what you needed (fridge, coffee pot, TV and safe) and ours had a King Bed. Hotel staff was nice and polite. The parking garage attendent wasn't very polite when we entered the garage, when I asked to retrieve eye glasses later in the day and when we left. His actions cost him about $20 in tips.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: vnb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery for about a week and found it to be the perfect spot for us. It's conveniently located (less than a block from Union Square and a cable car stop). Our room (in the premier section) was comfortable and spacious. The only two negatives [(1) getting to the premier section of the hotel is a bit convoluted (via stairs or herky-jerky wheelchair lift) and (2) the concierge was marginally helpful] would not dissuade me from returning to the hotel. The Daily Grill is attached to the hotel and made for a convenient tasty breakfast (included) before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for touring the city!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian69
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. We asked for quiet room - we were assigned a corner room on 6th floor of old historic section of hotel that didn't directly face noisy Geary St. We found it adequate and clean. Fairly quiet on Mon & Tues evenings but street noise and sirens seemed to pick up by Wed & Thurs p.m. going all night. Woke up frequently as a result. Bring soft foam ear plugs! If we stay at this hotel again, we'll ask for room in new section of hotel facing courtyard pool - probably quieter as it's not facing street. We bought package with breakfast included each morning in the Daily Grill. Very pleased with breakfast selection and waiter service. Concierge was pleasant enough when we required information or directions for getting around the city. If you are in SF for short period as tourist - I highly recommend the following 3 tours: Alcatraz tour (but buy your tickets ahead online before your trip or you will face long lineups at the pier); the San Francisco Movie Tours (3-hour tour on small comfortable shuttle around the city, very enjoyable and you'll see so much of the city in that one tour alone -- sanfranciscomovietours.com). Young professional actor "Wylie" was our terrific and knowledgeable tour guide; and the Great Pacific Coast Tour (10-hour full day tour on small comfortable shuttle bus along coast to Monterey and Carmel by the Sea, with fantastic lunch at Casanova in Carmel). The day flies by, you'll be awestruck by the coastal scenery and the stops along the way. Our driver Peter (retired senior) was a terrific tour guide and his driving skills were first rate. We learned quickly that in San Francisco tipping is expected with all those who provide good service - so have lots of dollar bills handy for your stay - for waiters, for concierge, for tour drivers and guides. The BART train was handy way to get from SF Airport to Powell St. @ $8 each. And it was just a few blocks walk up to the Handlery Hotel in Union Square. Much cheaper than taking airport shuttles and cabs. Just be prepared to see a bit of the gritty side of SF - street people, pan handlers, all sorts of characters. Very much like Times Square in New York. But we found it safe to walk around the city during the day - but avoid doing so at nights. Certain streets are a bit rough and should be avoided - parts of Market St. and the Tenderloin district. We took the BART up to Berkeley downtown one afternoon and toured the lovely surroundings of "U of California at Berkeley "campus. Happened upon commencement activities - saw the students gowned up for their grad ceremonies. We will stay at the Handlery again if we return to SF one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a central location .”
Reviews.Author: katiepops64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Handlery for 2 days and we found the hotel to be perfect for what we needed . Breakfast at the daily grill was fantastic .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HAeBA
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here for only two days on our Californian vacation. We booked petit room but got upgraded to bigger one. Room was fine, thou bed was quite small, and we are not big people. Room was clean but it smelled a bit weird and that was only down side to it. Staff was very friendly and location was GREAT. Our room was facing other rooms but we didn't care and it was quiet which was the benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: pglaefke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I with our two boys 5 and 7 spent a weekend in San Francisco and stayed at the Handerley. There was a little mix up with our room (they were putting doubled pane windows in the room we wanted) They found us a room that we ended up being even Happier with. The staff was wounderful and went out there way to make sure we were happy even though they were busy at the front desk. Anything we needed and asked for not only did the staff help us but wanted to help us! Thank you to the front desk, valets, room service at the pool and the maids they all were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: KATFresno
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the attention to service. The room was very clean and the whole 3 day stay was enjoyable. Major plus is the location to Union Square. It worked great for our business stay and shopping in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery Union Square SanFran - Best Value out there!”
Reviews.Author: pbedenver
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the SanFran Handlery before, and specifically returned to this hotel. The reasons are Fantastic location, and most definitely the Best Value in the area. Staff was absolutely wonderful. Front desk and concierge were immensely engaging and helpful. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Sarah8384
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery for four nights in April and found it to be a very pleasant experience. We had no problem with the bell boys who helped us with our luggage without being asked. Checkin staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. Room was lovely, very spacious and the bed was very comfy - the only thing is the aircon is a little noisy but I sleep through anything so it didn't bother me at all. There is a lovely little pool and pool area. Although we did not use the pool it was night to sit out there to get away from the hussle bussle of the city. The location was excellent and the concierge was very helpful with how to get around the city. All in all if you get a good rate for this hotel it is completely perfect and probably would stay again if ever in San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “A great and safe place to stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Lindsayroy
Reviews.Content: What can one say... Outstanding comes to mind...we upgraded to the king premier room adjoining with friends whom we travelled with... Staff were awesome... Room was awesome... Food in the daily Grill room was awesome.... Close to all transport and tour buses... Close to restaurants and Starbuck cafe's.... Would I stay there again...you bet I would and will!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 6 nights - just okay, would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: cupid1127
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week long business trip. The bellman watched as I struggled to get myself and my luggage through the 2 glass doors. The location was suberb-close to union square (1 inute) and the cable cars. The room was okay, nothing special. Beds were comfy. The carpet and just the overall room needed an upgrade. Walls were kind of thin, the room next door was very loud so i couldnt sleep last night. Kind of a pain to get to the room because of the layout. Te chambermaid was excellent- very detailed with cleaning the room. Bottom line- just "okay" hotel in an excellent location- I will probably go with something else next time just because there were so many other options that maybe have a better atmosphere. Free wifi in room, but have to pay at the business center Sushi boat next to hotel is really good

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravcl
Reviews.Content: this hotel is expensive so try to book early and get a deal...its clean but small..but thats SF so you should be happy that atleast its nicely equipped, very clean and has a super location..we got the room right away which was great ..no waitg......i dont mind going back there again....has great eateries nearby and you have macys.....that makes ur stay more enjoyable and also you always feel surrounded by people an lively atmosphere so that a good feelg if you are there for the first time.......always look at google map and see what other hotels,eateries,malls are close by so u knw how good that area is....

Reviews.Title: “A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Orville104
Reviews.Content: The Handlery offers a great location (one block off Union Square), with clean and modern rooms. However, our A/C was not working properly which did adversely affect our sleep. Otherwise, we found the hotel to be quite good.I completed an online survey upon our return home, noted the poor condition of the A/C and within two days I received a personal email from Mr. Handlery that the problem had been fixed. (The note was a nice gesture but it would have been better if he had offered a discount of some kind upon our next visit as we are frequent visitors to "the City.") Regardless, the hotel staff was courteous, and the breakfast, which was part of our package, at the adjoining grill was also very good. The wait staff at the grill was unusually courteous! We will try this hotel once more, in spite of our A/C difficulties on our next trip to SF as we feel that the value is a good one for San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: charmedsisters
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 14th-18th April 2011 and found the hotel perfect for our stay. The location was excelent a 1 min walk to union square where Macey's and other well known stores are located, the tram turntable was a 5 min walk away. Also the open top city sightseeing bus leaves directly oppersite Macey's. We had a nice large room overlooking the pool which was very quiet and comfy(we stayed in the premier side of the hotel not the historic). We also had breakfast included in the price which made it good value for money (I can recomend the waffle and maple syrup) The staff were friendly and helpful. Plenty of places to eat in the area if you fancy a walk out of an evening.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: aussietraveller1997
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is old, tired and in real need of a refurbishment. The rooms are not what you see in the photo's, the bathroom was so tiny it was impossible for even two people to be in there at the same time and the shower so small that half of you was actually pushing through the old and grubby curtain when you were showering. And this was in a room that caters for 4 people. The carpets were dirty and the furniture was delapidated and we were told we were in one of their better rooms?? Do not expect any help with your luggage as the Bell Boys and Door Man are never to be found. Concierge looks down their noses at you when you ask for a restaurant that is better than their normal tourist traps they recommend on Union Square. The pillows are so hard that they feel like they have rocks in them and when you ask if there is anything softer you are told - that is all we have you will have to put up with it. Steer well clear of this hotel - there are far more in the same price bracket in the same area that do not trick up their photo's to get you in.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and very accommodating staffi”
Reviews.Author: Lelonline
Reviews.Content: The downtown location just along the street from Union Square is fantastic and the hotel represents great value in this area. We had a double queen bed room and requested the newer part of the hotel (even though it doesn't have the same charm) as this is quieter and affords a better nights sleep. We actually requested a change of room after checking in, as the one we'd been given was right next to very noisy elevators and people coming and going. Our second room was fine and noise was no problem. Staff were very helpful and pleasant about us making this move. Our new room was clean, and the bathroom well appointed with top of the line toiletries. Those considering the Handlery should be aware that the interior of the rooms is getting a bit dated and the hotel is showing its age. That said, it did not bother us as it was clean, warm and the staff, particularly the doorman Herve, were so pleasant. For a hotel in this price range and in this great location, you'd be hard pushed to find better.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for the Premium Suites - No Need for Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: AmyLee06
Reviews.Content: Yes to get a feel of the real night life of San Francisco, then spend a night or two in the Family suite on the Geary Street side of the Handlery. Its an experience everyone needs to hear (hay its San Fran after all). Then after your second night of falling asleep to drums performed by the local street performer, ask for an upgrade to the Premium Suites overlooking the swimming pool. The lovely Catherine (Front desk manager) was very helpful with moving my family into the Premium suites (not a problem at all), O'Farrell Street. We spent our last three nights of our one week stay, here in the Premium suite at the Handlery, and it is absolutely beautiful. Free wifi as well. Thankyou Catherine, and Thankyou as the room here is roomy, bathroom is great and the bed is sooo comfortable. Thumbs up from me and my three kids. And much quieter on the this side.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs”
Reviews.Author: cprr143
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with clean rooms. VERY loud city noise-bring some ear plugs and it will help. The hotel is situated in a great place with some good views if you don't mind hearing the horns beeping and sirens blaring during the night

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2121
Reviews.Content: After an 11 hour flight from London, we were very glad to arrive at The Handlery. We booked a premier king room, which was very large, beautifully decorated and very quiet overlooking the pool. We were on holiday celebrating our engagement. It was a very pleasant surprise to find Champagne on ice, lots of nibbles and a card waiting on our arrival. The gesture was most welcome and truely appreciated. All the staff were very polite and helpful. When we returned early evening after a hard days sightseeing, Jonathan would greet us with a smile and ask how our day went and offer advice and tips on where to visit next. We felt we were really being looked after. We ate in the Daily Grill several times. The food was very good, and reasonably priced. We had to wait for a table as they were so busy, but definately worth the wait. Its very lively and has a good atmosphere. The location couldn't be better just off Union Square. Really easy for the trams and many attractions within walking distance. This hotel is a real gem., and I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “EXcellent service, comfy bed, good food - what more do you want?”
Reviews.Author: Susan612500
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with a high standard of service. The reception staff and conceirge were quick, efficient and soon helped us work out the transport system, where to go and what to do in SF. The location in Union Square, is good for shops, trams, etc. Our room was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean, with a very comfortable bed - no view, but it was quiet, so peaceful and the champagne and nibbles in our room when we arrived (our 40th wedding anniversary) was a lovely surprise. No bath, but large bathroom with shower and dressing table. We ate in the Daily Grill, attached to the Hotel, which had a good choice – in fact, really good food and service - and a different selection to others - I liked the spicy meat loaf – portions were big though! Overall, we thought the Hotel was excellent and would definitely want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!! Went out of their way to make our stay memorable!”
Reviews.Author: 25thannivtrip
Reviews.Content: Had a bottle of champagne, bag of snacks & card for our 25th anniversary!! Nice rooms & very helpful. Flight was late getting in, so didn't have as much time to explore. They suggested an easy walk to Chinatown and Union Square. Location is great and safe. Just a block away from all the car rental places. After renting a car for a week we came back to SF for 3 more nights. Stayed at a different hotel and every time we walked by the Handlery, we kept wishing we were staying there instead!! We had a king room and was very nice and spacious!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: Bethlib
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to San Francisco from March 26th-April 2nd and stayed at the Handlery Hotel. It is in a busy downtown location in the Union Square area. We purchased a package through Travelocity and upgraded the room to a premier king. We were so glad that we did because we had a large room with a sitting area and a good sized bathroom with an extra make-up area and mirror. Our room was on the second floor facing the pool area. We truly appreciated the location of our room and the ability to spread out a little. While in San Francisco, we rode the cable car to the Hyde Street Pier, sailed out to Alcatraz for a day tour, explored a bit of Chinatown, went to the Mission Dolores, walked on Haight Street to Golden Gate Park, saw a bit of the de Young Museum, and took a boat trip to see the Golden Gate bridge. We were also fortunate that my husband's friend came and stayed a couple of days in San Francisco (also at the Handlery!) and drove us to Monteray in his vehicle to view the 17 mile drive in Pebble Beach. We enjoyed our time in San Francisco and I appreciate the kindness of the staff at the Handlery. They brought up extra pillows for my husband and took our luggage up to our room when we arrived at about 12:00 midnight. I would highly recommend anyone to stay at the Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service, Room at a Resonable Price”
Reviews.Author: Cleveland_Peter
Reviews.Content: We spent eight days with no specific plans and had a wonderful time. You are very close to Union Square without the very high price. Rooms are nicely decorated and clean but a little on the small size. The front desk and concierge were very knowlegable and helpful on every request. Theaters and rental cars close buy. Many choices of great neighborhood restaurants and of course the shopping was top notch. Suggest walking in the residential areas if you have the time and energy, Union Street, Fillmore Area, Palace of Fine Arts, Ferry to Sausalito, people watching at Union Square, Curran Theater and Golden Gate Park. It was amazingly easy and inexpensive to rent a car and head south for a day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Met expectations; good location”
Reviews.Author: SusNana2005
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Handlery based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. Hotel is in the heart of San Francisco and close to transportation. Noise from adjoining room was loud one night, but I brought earplugs. Staff were accommodating and friendly. Mr. Handlery left a welcome note and gift bag in our room upon arrival. Nice touch. The Grill next door was more than adequate for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: corgi47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery in March 2011. It is a nice hotel, right in the middle of where you should be in S.F. Union Square across the road. Macy’s just a bit further. An Irish pub 2 doors up. After coming from 3 different hotels that had huge rooms with huge beds, it was a bit of shock to the system to open our door on the 7th floor and realise how small the room is. And the beds were tiny! Not even Queen size. I reckon they were king singles. No view at all. Our safe didn’t work either. And the bathroom was tiny. Again, this could all be due to the previous huge rooms leaving an impression on us. Our 1st night was marred by the fire alarm screaming at 4am. No one’s fault, but standing in the cold S.F. rain at 4am seems to influence your opinions. Perhaps the most shocking thing is the $38.00 a night car parking fee. i dont know if this is a S.F. thing, or a common practise in inner city hotels, but i thought it was a ridiculous amount. I decided to hand my hire car in 2 days early instead of being slugged. Luckily, Hertz is right around the corner. The staff at the Handlery are perfect. Super friendly and helpful. The place itself is very clean and classy. Would I stay here again on my next trip to S.F.? Maybe. If I found somewhere in a similar good location, with maybe a bigger room and at about the same rate, I might stay elsewhere. But if I were to return, I would do so with no qualms. Just maybe, i’d stay here first – then go to the bigger rooms elsewhere in America.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: TheBrowneCouple
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Handerly and we loved it. The location was fabulous and the rooms were very nice and clean. We had a great view from our window of Geary Street and loved having the window open to hear the sounds of the city. We were able to walk to the shops on Union Square and also to the Curran Theatre that night. We went next door to the Daily Grill and had wonderful appetizers before the show and was very pleased. It was a fantastic stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: papurpura
Reviews.Content: The perfect location one block from Union Square and 2 blocks from BART and Westfield Mall Shopping. Hotel was clean and maid service was outstanding. However our room was extremely noisy (non-insulating windows) from street noise. Room decor was attractive, but did not have drawers to place clothes (had to live out of our suit cases for 7 days). Room was also dark -- needed more lighting. But we did love the vanity area and all the mirrors.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: parisparisparis
Reviews.Content: We have travelled all over the world, and have never met such arrogant concierges. Isn't it their job to be helpful to weary travellers? The hotel is just okay: rooms cozy, but small; very loud street noise which makes sleeping rather difficult; good location to Union Square. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happy_in_San_Fran
Reviews.Content: My room was very cozy and nice. However, I had a hard time getting the temp right. The hotel is located in a prime spot, with easy access to shopping, restaurants and public transportation. The majority of the service was excellent with the exception of the conseiger. He was quite rude and unhelpful. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NatsyLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband in Oct 2010. Our room, in the older part of the hotel, was nice. Yes, it was definitely smaller than the average hotel room one finds in the States. It was more like European sized room. The room had been given a make over but some things were a bit old. I guess they kept them for character. One complaint was that they did not have a gym. I thought it would have been ready but it wasn't. You can use a nearby gym but you have to pay. Another gripe was the noise of the rain. Our window opened up to an atrium which meant that we didn't hear city noise even though you're so central. But their was a window sill outside on to which the rain made a very irritating tapping noise. This really got to me as I was struggling with jet lag. But, as I said, no street noise. Our room was average - I'd give it 3 out of 5. The location is great though. It's so central and convenient. Everything is right downstairs. This brings up my rating to 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Treblecle
Reviews.Content: Excellent location however the twin room was fairly small but clean and comfortable. There also doesn't seem to be much sound proofing between rooms and doors were banging in corridors so if a light sleeper bring earplugs. The fire alarm was also set off maliciously one morning very early, very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: clarke3011
Reviews.Content: The Handlery is a great hotel! Centrally located - near BART, cable car, and Union Square - it couldn't have been better. The staff was extremely helpful and willing to assist in any way possible. The king room with the city view and balcony was large and a great deal compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & great value compared to other similar hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Crouchinho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights midway through out honeymoon and found this hotel to be excellent. Parking is pricey at $38 per night but this is comparable with all other central hotels in San Francisco and we got a good deal on bookit.com with half price parking. The room itself was very nice and modern, although the bathroom could do with some updating. In terms of location this hotel is literally 1 minute walk from Union Square and it only took us 20 mins to walk down to Fishermans Wharf which was great. Plenty of restaurants close by, you can easily walk to Chinatown / Little Italy for your evening meal. Shopping is also on your doorstep. A special thanks to the front desk staff who sent us a complimentary bottle of champagne which I assume was because I put a note on our booking that we were on our honeymoon - very much appreciated! Overall this hotel is hard to fault bearing in mind the price and reduced parking cost.

Reviews.Title: “We had an EXCELLENT stay at the Handlery Union Square Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2leashes
Reviews.Content: This was a combination business/leisure trip for one night. My husband was timing a 5k for a group of conventioneers early in the A.M on Thursday. So, we arrived at 4 P.M. on Wednesday, in time to have dinner at the Cheesecake Factory. :) Our room was on the newer side "Premier" over the garage. Perfect location overlooking O'Farrell St. We had a spacious, King Premier balcony room. I just LOVED the location and it was on the 3rd floor, just as I requested. And, I really looked forward to the balcony! We were not disappointed! I just LOVE to watch the hustle and bustle of the city streets below. I had contacted Jon Handlery a few days before letting him now how impressed I am that he replies to everyone here on Trip Advisor. I also told him that my husband and I were spending one night at the Handlery for business and to celebrate our anniversay a month late. Next thing you know, he wrote me back even though he was out of the country, it turns out! And, he had his assistant contact me asking what we preferred--white or red wine, or champagne. So, when we walked into our room we were pleasantly greeted with a chilled bottle of bubbly and a bag of snacks and bottled water. And, a nice note. What a WONDERFUL gesture!! Thank you so much, Mr. Handlery! I loved the size of the room. It was perfect having a small couch and easy chair, as well as the desk. My husband needed to access the internet for business. It worked great! I notice the couch opens up as a bed, so there would have been room for our daughter! I really was impressed with the amenities in our room. Also, it really wasn't loud at night, even though we were facing the busy street. It wasn't a problem at all! I realize it wasn't a weekend. But, I love the city, so it wouldn't have bothered me. I loved the lighted make-up mirror and the little powder room, complete with cushioned, rolling stool. A very nice touch. The next morning there was a complimentary SF Chronicle newspaper at our door. And, after my husband got back from the 5k race, we both had a cup of coffee in the room. I would have preferred those little liquid half and half containers over the powdered creamer, however. :) But, the coffee was just fine, otherwise. Strong enough, too! The parking garage was a cinch. After initially working our way through the maze of stairs and hallways to arrive at the lobby, we never had to go over that way again. :) Since we stayed above the garage, it was easy just to take the elevator down and exit out on O'Farrell or pick up the car if needed. Very convenient. The ONLY thing I would change in our room is the MATTRESS and pillows. And, I mean the ONLY thing! :) I have to admit, I wasn't comfortable, although my husband slept like a baby. I'm used to my own feather pillow, as well as the less-poofy pillows I use against my back and between my knees. I also have THE most comfortable mattress in the world at home. Unfortunately, the mattress at the hotel seemed to dip toward the middle so I stayed more toward the edge. Again, I'm so used to my own bed, it's just hard to compare! The best hotel bed I ever slept in was a Heavenly Bed in Seattle a few years back. Oh my! I felt cradled in a firm, but gentle cloud. :) Handlery's bed-issue did NOT cause me to give it any less than 5 stars, though! Everything else about our stay was beyond perfect! That balcony was the selling point for ME! I will GLADLY book the same room or one close by at the Handlery Union Square again! Your family has really done an exceptional job with this hotel. I'm so glad that it's STAYING in the family, too! Thanks once again for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Value in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LazyAcresNorth
Reviews.Content: My colleague warned me about the size of the room before my arrival for a trade show. However the size of the room for the age and style of the hotel was as expected. Good thing it was only me. The room was comfortable and clean. Bathroom was updated. The bed was great. My room was quiet. Staff was welcoming and courteous throughout the stay. The location is right on Union square surrounded my shopping. Some of the hottest spots of the city are short cab rides away.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: vegasmommy60
Reviews.Content: Not only is it a lovely old Hotel the location can't be beat. Tons of Diners, Cafes, Restaurants and Bars all in walking distance. Lots of Galleries right out the front door. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: whmurray
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great value. Friendly and accommodating staff. Older property, nicely restored. All the modern and expected amenities and conveniences. Wireless Internet, fairly priced. ( Actually, it assumed one device while I had three. When I asked about it, they volunteered a passcode as a remedy. Lots of power outlets. The restaurant, The Daily Grill, is excellent and also a great value. Moved here from a Marriott that was not as well located and was twice the price. Marriott staff had nothing on the Handlery staff

Reviews.Title: “great location if you love shopping”
Reviews.Author: meljw98
Reviews.Content: There is a BART stop from the train station to near the hotel. It is just on the corner of Union Square. This is where all the shops are located. There are also some nice restaurants/diners nearby as well as bars with live music and roof top bars in other hotels. Definitely shop in Macys and get the 10% tourist discount card (from the top floor customer services). Public transport is very good - there is the $5 tram or $2 trams/busses. Easy to get to Fishermans Wharf, the tourist area. I would not recommend the tour bus as a means of transport as its expensive, restrictive in hours and only goes one direction in the city. But do use it if you would like a spoken or pre-recorded guide of the city and making a day or half day of it. There are a couple of choices of routes but one ticket only covers the one route. Longer routes make journys more long winded. Consider the direction of the bus route before commiting to buying a day ticket, which is around $30. The bike route is recommended and caters for all abilities - you can do the entire route or just cycle part of it in one direction and take it on the ferry back to the hire shop. The room is basic but clean with nice bay windows overlooking the street. There is noise though as it is located in a busy area. There is no free wifi in this hotel but overall the hotel is good value.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for luxury in SF!”
Reviews.Author: wjamesjonas
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a dream. Responsive staff and excellent rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, clean rooms, and I felt very safe in the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to say if you are looking to stay in San Francisco, and you are looking at the Union Square area this is a great option. I have no major complaints about this hotel. I gave cleanliness a five but I have a few complaints the elevator lobby at the parking garage is dirty and has been since my last visit, in fairness it is most likely impossible to keep clean but some new carpet and chairs would go a long way. The paint in the room was fine but it looked like a five year old cut in the corners (now that we all have access to the DIY channel we are all experts). I would have appreciated it if the clerk at the front counter let me know when checking in there was no view or no bath tub. By no view I mean no view, these old buildings sometimes have windows that open up into a opening that Is an air vent, and no tub fine but had the counter clear told me about the air shaft view and no tub I would have gladly paid more for a different room. I checked in Monday night and the place did not look full so I know there were different rooms available. I gave a four on value because I felt the price I payed was a little high for the room I received, I stay 1-2 nights in SF about 7 times a year and I day trip about once a month and I have a good idea what rooms should go for. I have a tip for first time visitors to San Francisco stay in the union square area, you can take public transportation to other parts of the city for your excursions. If you get a good room you can open your window and see and hear the cable cars going by. I will give you a warning there are some bad neighborhoods not far from union square. There is also a very bad homeless problem, just ignore them and they will leave you alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Fish7_2-3
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I celebrated our birthdays with a stay at the Handlery Union Square Hotel. Our room was quite nice...beautifully decorated, spacious and clean. The staff we encountered were pleasant and helpful. The location was great as we were able to walk to the Curran Theater and great shopping. We enjoyed eating at the restaurant in the hotel, and the Irish pub across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: rexcab
Reviews.Content: This stay was a mix of a business trip which I extended as a leisure trip over the weekend. I knew it was in a great location near Union Square, so I didn't hesitate to book a room here after getting a good room rate. When I checked in and went to my room, I was at first somewhat disappointed. It was in the older section of the hotel, 2nd floor, next to the elevators and the ice machine. After I entered the room, my mood brightened a bit, because it looked nice, had a small fridge, and a surprisingly bigger bathroom than I was expecting. Then I opened the window blinds to check out the view...disappointment again. No view of the city...only the roof of what I think was the Daily Grill restaurant and other rooms of the hotel. I was afraid to tell my wife about this room, as she was flying in to meet me here for the weekend. As I laid down to sleep I began to realize that I am not hearing any of the street noises that are present in this area. I began to see a big benefit to the location of this room Throughout the 5 night stay, I hardly heard the elevator or ice machine as well. This room is a gem! When I come back, I'm going to see if I can get this room again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SurreyGirl007
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed at this hotel for a 3 day break and found it to be a great find. The hotel is located just off Union Square, a great location with easy access to the cable car, all the major shops, including the Westfield Shopping Centre. It's a great location if you just want to amble as we managed to walk all the way through Chinatown, North Beach and down to the Wharf. We had a room with 2 queen beds which was great. The room was spacious, it may as well have been 2 separate rooms. It was very well equipped, with coffee machine, fridge, 2 televisions. The only downside was that the bathroom was a bit small, and the shower was not the most powerful. The staff were very helpful with all that we asked them, check-in and check-out were quick and painless. There is an outdoor swimming pool at the hotel, however we did not use this in our stay as the weather was not great. We never ate at the hotel so unable to comment on the food, however the room service menu certainly looked to have a lot of choice. All in all, I would quite happily come back and stay at the Handlery Union Square Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for short stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: SuSu49022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights there after several days in the wine country. We liked the location and friendly staff (except for one guy). It is a great location for tourists - easy to get to the key spots. Less than 1 blk from Powell St cable car. Right at Union Sq. Only 2-3 blks to Market to catch street cars and other public transp. We had not expected the adjoining restaurant to be so good. My husband thought it was the best meal we had all week. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: RugbyBoyBC
Reviews.Content: Our two day stay was reasonably good. Hotel location is great for tourists. Rooms away from the street are quiet but those overlooking the street can be quite noisy all night. Staff were friendly and attentive. Value for dollars spent was also good except for the expensive parking. Our only complaint were that the hotel needed some TLC. Both toilet and bathroom sink didn't work properly. The room and hallway also needed some attention. Overall, we were fine with our stay but would look around next time to see if there were better options within the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Location cannot be beat”
Reviews.Author: adrianmeli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is downtown in union square so the location could not be better in my opinion. You are close to everything and the area is a lot of fun. The hotel is a great value for the area without a doubt and the people there are very nice but you should be aware the interior of the rooms is old and the hotel shows it age. It didn't bother me, but it is not a new construction by any means. I barely spent any time there so I just liked being close to everything and at the price i found it online I could not have been happier. - Adrian Meli

Reviews.Title: “weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: ceceya
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel. everyone was very accomadating to our questions, The visit was very personable, and it was also nice to be in the middle of the action of the city life. We plan to visit again soon!!! Cecelia

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Would definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: lgtraveler42
Reviews.Content: I was booking a weekend trip for a friend's birthday and wanted to find something close to Union Square. I came across a great deal for the Handlery and after reading many positive reviews, decided to book a stay for Saturday night...very happy with the decision! The location of the hotel is AMAZING. We actually stayed in Fisherman's Wharf on Friday and were able to take a trolley practically to the front door of the Handlery the next morning. The hotel is surrounded by little galleries and restaurants, as well as department stores such as Macy's. A few blocks away is the Bart station, which was a very convenient, inexpensive way to return to the airport on Sunday. We had wanted to stay in something other than a chain, and the Handlery has the character of an older hotel but is still very clean and comfortable. The beds were great and the room a good size (especially given the number of reviews seen on other hotels about the small rooms in San Francisco). Amenity wise, they had computers available with Internet access ($5 for a 20 minute card) and a printer, and the Daily Grill is attached for those who don't want to leave for Breakfast. We also loved that there was a heated pool (a nice surprise in January!) What really set the hotel apart though was our interaction with the President, Jon Handlery. I had written to Mr. Handlery explaining that this was a special weekend...not only did he call me that afternoon, but came down to welcome us personally at check-in and later had something sent up to the room. It definitely left an impression and made our stay that much more special. We look forward to staying there again next time we're in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, central location”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMegan
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights Jan 3-Jan 6 2011. There seemed to be a lot of Australian tourists like us using the hotel, most of us had booked through Australian travel agents. It's centrally located right near Union Square which is centre of city. Lots of shopping and restaurants close by. The hotel is old, however, clean and maintained. The air conditioning in our room was very noisy (could not sleep with it on) and took some time to heat – cold outside, so getting the room warm seemed to take a while (30-45mins). The bathroom is small and clean. Glass shelves over basin – wow, watch your head – easy to hit your head on the shelf if you want to lean into the basin. The bed was comfortable, though housekeeping seemed to never tuck the sheets in correctly on the bed! At the base of the bed the sheets were always coming out. We also had a few itches and a number of other visitors mentioned same issue – bites on their body. So not sure if we had some unwanted guests in the bed with us. The staff/team at the Handlery are very polite and helpful. Nothing ever a problem, any issues or questions quickly offer solution or answer. Well presented. We were given complimentary breakfast vouchers each morning, which was a nice surprise as we did not realise these were in our room cost. Three choices of three set meals and tea or coffee. All food OK (eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, waffles, cereal, yoghurt) though meals and coffee was not at hot, (lukewarm) on the first two mornings. Third morning was a lot better. My vote : this is an OK place to stay. The Handlery are close to having a great little spot to stay, and if the hotel could improve on the above mentioned items they could turn this into a much more appealing experience for their visitors.

Reviews.Title: “awesome location”
Reviews.Author: PalesaM81
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 days with my sister and while the hotel is pretty good - the location is what totally sells it. right next to macys and along a good shopping row. great places to eat around the hotel and easy access to the hop-on-off bus tours. hotel layout was strange though.

Reviews.Title: “Third instalment of our honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: newcastlebloke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery as part of our honeymoon. The location is good, being close to the BART and of course Union Sq. When we checked in we told the receptionist it was our honeymoon so he upgraded us to a huge lovely room with a decent view. The staff are very friendly and helpful and didn't hesitate to help out with anything we needed. We would love to come back and would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Staff, Super location.”
Reviews.Author: crashmandave
Reviews.Content: We wanted to try one of the other hotels in the area rather than the usual “Big” chain hotels and I’m convinced we hit the jackpot.. This is a great older hotel with all the amenities and upgrades. It’s by no means a small place and can hold there own toe to toe with the big boys. The staff were friendly, helpful and a pleasure to work with. The Handlery had everything you could need in a hotel. It was steps from Union square, a great wine shop, Kutetos restaurant and many, many cafés. Of course if you want there were two starbucks less than one minute from the frond door. We were on the fifth floor with a street view room. I loved that the windows opened up all the way and gave us a great little breeze, very refreshing. The elevators were fine and went from the lobby to the fifth floor with out any issues, so I don’t know what else you would need from a hotel. They have a restaurant attached (The Daily Grill) so you don’t have to go anywhere if your not in the mood.. All of the hotel chains charge for wifi service so that shouldn’t be a surprise to frequent travelers that’s why I have an air card. If you absolutely need internet service when traveling maybe you should look into an air card so you don’t have to rely on spotty or no service. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone going to the Union Square area. I will be back for sure…

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: djockcally
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel we was told it was a 3 star hotel but was very close to Union Square. Well close was an understatement, out the doors, turn right and 20 yards down was the square. Just round the corner was the main Tram stop, which takes you straight down to Fishermans Wharf, or any where else you fancy. The bedrooms were very nice with extremely large comfortable beds.Only real criticism was the price of a breakfast at the hotel, very expensive. I would definately eat outside of the hotel. Overall we would definately book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location.........”
Reviews.Author: TNtraveler1998
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and have no complants. 1/2 block to Union Station, Cable Car stop, and excellent food. Eat at Lefty O'Douls next door, great food. Shop Union Square, China Town, and ride the elevator at St Francis. Rooms were not huge but we only sleep here so not an issue. The beds could use an update, but were were so tired it didn't matter. Still no complaints. We did the park and stay option and it worked well. Excellent vallet staff that were promt and courtious. We did not move the car much and used the MUNI pass for 3 days. Worked great. Rode Cable cars, buses, and electric trolleys, lots of fun. Handlery is very authinic and historic, classic San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant New Years Eve stay”
Reviews.Author: Amber92056
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights including New Years. We found a good deal on priceline and had a pleasant stay. The room was nice and clean, no complaints there. The only thing was that our fridge didn't work but that wasn't too big a deal and when we contacted the front desk they sent somebody up to take a look right away. I was surprised at some of the negative reviews below. Sure there's city noise but you're in the middle of a city, what do you expect? I actually thought it was relatively quiet. The location couldn't be any better; a short walk, cab or BART ride to wherever we wanted to go. They also beefed it up for New Years and had security at the door and a "no noise after 12:30 policy" Lastly I left behind a dress in the room and when I contacted them this morning they had it and will be shipping it back to me. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel expierence I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: lorieandjason
Reviews.Content: I took my son here for his birthday on December 20 and 21st and we had a wonderful trip. The hotel was beautiful and all the employees we had contact with were exceptional and very helpful. The Handlery Hotel really made our trip special and made both my son and I feel like we were part of their family. I would definately recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back myself. The location was great, we felt very safe and all the stores were an easy walk from the Hotel. We had dinner at the Daily Grill and the food was outstanding - I had the fish special (Hazelnut crusted Mahi Mahi that was out of this world and my son chose the marinated skirt steak that he absolutely loved).

Reviews.Title: “Thank God I only stayed for one night”
Reviews.Author: Dina0626
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this hotel during a trip to San Fransisco. Good Points - The location is great - The historic feel of the hotel is pretty neat - The staff is very nice Downsides - The room we stayed in smelled of must - The bathroom was extremely outdated - Our sheets where visibly dirty, we requested new sheets, they were dirtier that the first set. The third set of sheets were at least visibly clean. I also would not recommend the restaurant in the hotel, although the staff was nice, the food was very bland. There are plenty of better places to grab a bite nearby.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it”
Reviews.Author: Pasha_irvine
Reviews.Content: I'm not a tough reviewer but i can't say i loved everything about this hotel. The location is awesome, reception people are adorably polite and the service was fast. The only problem is the noise you here from the street, which could be resolved by changing the window frames! It was really close to Union square and a lot of good restaurants around it. The mini bar was empty !!!! Or i may say, there was no mini bar in my room which is quite ODD!! TV was nice and i easily found my fave shows on it. Room service was good, I loved the Arabian coffee they put in rooms ! Internet is really low that you can't watch any netflix movies online! ( I used my iphone to check my emails - it was way, way way faster ) I can say if you are staying there for fanciness don't do it, go to Hilton which is only 20 dollars more a night and is right in front of the street ( though Hilton is bottom of a hotel ! ) but if you are staying here for business it is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: laz007
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Handlery on a recent trip to San Francisco. The location was fantastic. It was close to shops and great Restaurants. The cable car was at the end of the street and 15min from Fisherman's Wharf. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. We even met the owner Jon Handlery who greeted us personally. I would definitely to return to the Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: msgtp
Reviews.Content: Travel extensively for business and pleasure, and the Handlery at Union Square is the worst hotel at which I've ever stayed. First "patti" from the hotel confused our dual reservation - 1 night personal, 5 nights business so that we nearly had to pay twice for 1 night. Second - was made aware of free wi-fi 3 days into our stay Third - extremely loud party scheduled directly below our room on a Tuesday night Fourth - no help with bags Fifth - colleagues offered complimentary coffee, papers, etc. But not offered to me until I asked forecfully Sixth - completely uncaring staff - examples Ed (an intern) attempted to put off my complaint about lack of equal comps for our company travel until I forced the issue by standing there until something was done I've got two night left here and don't see any improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bigdaddi0
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Handlery on the day the Giants won the World Series, so it was a lot of fun for the three nights we were there. You could not be more centrally located if you want to be on Union Squre, it is just a minutes walk from the hotel. Our room was very spacious and as we were husband, wife and adult daughter we needed a good size room. The only issue we had was the free wireless internet - it hardly ever worked, constantly dropping out. In the end I had to take my laptop down to the foyer to pick up the connection - not really a satisfactory situation. Other than that, everything else at the Handlery was fantastic. Just as an aside, we have stayed a few times in Union Square and have always used a shuttle or taxi to get ourselves to and from the airport, at quite a cost too. This time we caught the airport train and I must say this is definitely the way to go. It is only 30 minutes to the airport and costs just $8, and the station is right next to the cablecar turnaround at Powell St. No changing trains so not much chance of missing your stop. In future we'll always use the train.

Reviews.Title: “Very unhappy”
Reviews.Author: Louise30889
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Handlery 3 times and this last time was a poor service experience. We will not stay there again. The first two times it was through the Tony Bruno special and we had a great time and felt like "family" as John Handlery's video. I made a reservation for the Garden suite for November 19th as it was my partner's 50th birthday. I ordered champagne when we arrive (pre-ordered) first off I had to call the front desk to find out when it would arrive as no one relayed that to me. Second, when I went to draw a bath there were 2 different types of hair stuck to the bath tubs side. I opted out of making a big deal to keep the mood nice for my mate. Third and most disturbing was the fire alarm went off in the suite, we went out-side in the rain and the front desk called to say a maintance man would come up to check the alarm. He came, and said he thought it was dusty and then asked us if we were smoking in the room or had we showered and set off the alarm. I then decided to call the front dest to express my concerns of the alarm going off again and wanted to be assured it was functioning properly. I was treated like I was a thorne in her side and transfered to a mananger who said he's look into it and call me back. I never got a call back. I spent $405.00 for one night of poor service. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Ambiance plus Location”
Reviews.Author: NYGOIL
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent a couple of days after Thanksgiving at this quaint hotel. First, it's a 1/2 block from Union Square Shopping. We could actually see Union Square from our hotel room windows. The old world ambiance (we stayed in the older part of the hotel) was great. Our room overlooked Geary Street and although we were given a choice of a quieter room, we chose a room overlooking the street. Believe me, aside from a few late night revelers our sleep was not disturbed. The beds were so comfortable we slept like babies! It's also attached to a restaurant called the "Daily Grill." A San Francisco institution and a review I will write about on another forum. Great time in a great hotel. We'll definetly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Recently renovated however nothing to rave about - beggars on the streets”
Reviews.Author: gdaypat
Reviews.Content: This is a standard hotel, nothing special. We ate breakfast in the cafe first morning but felt we were an inconvenience to the watered day. We were due t spend 5 nights in San Fran however left after three, the beggars are everywhere and follow you. We counted 10 while walking one block. We just didn't want to be there after seeing the tourist attractions. This hotel was ok but San Fran, wouldn't go back. We were advised to ignore the beggars however with them in your face and walking with you does not make a holiday. Back to the hotel wireless Internet is available in your room via an outside service provider, it kept dropping out. No refund as it is a direct debit to your card. I spent 2 hours trying to fix the issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean & Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: ThunderMtnKid
Reviews.Content: Would recommend to anyone. It's not too dear of a price and it's clean. Would stay again. Thundermtnkid.

Reviews.Title: “EXPENSIVE!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyTurk21
Reviews.Content: Hi guys, do not visit this hotel because it is crazy expensive, with a lot hidden costs and prices.The only mistake when you visit san fran! the staff in the hotel was not polite and the parking charges were very expensive!just get another hotel because u can`t relax here. i wish you a better hotel in san fran! see u!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, clean, good staff, moderate price, good sleep NO free internet, NO major luxuries, Noise from street”
Reviews.Author: wanderingyahud
Reviews.Content: I was first upset the hotel suggested I take the Super Shuttle from the airport (they do not have a courtesy van). It did not take 20 min as they said but an hour and a bit. Shuttle costs 18 bucks cab can cost 40. The hotel is close to a very posh area when exiting to the right of the hotel (Tiffany's and all those stores) but do not wander to the left. The area is full of homeless people and drugged up weirdos. You are close to the streetcars (take the Hyde one going up the hill to the tourist areas...they cost 5 bucks per ride) The rooms are clean, but a bit old. The TV is top of the line, bed is big and comfy, pillow-top Serta with cushy pillows and nice sheets. There is a decent room and a good desk to work at. The price was reasonable compared to other hotels but dont expect major luxuries. Room service was good. I had a filet mignon that was tasty and well presented. Internet is NOT free in the room or in the business centre. The room rate for internet is far more reasonable 10 bucks per day than the business centre which runs like a cab fare on those PC's and is minimum 5 bucks.......flies up to ten bucks in minutes. Lots of noise from thecrazy homeless people on the street at night. I wouldn't venture far (particularly do not walk left from the hotel). In the daytime everything is safe. Staff was generally friendly and helped with everything I requested. They did screw up a wake up call but apologized after. It wasn't a big deal that day but could have been a huge deal otherwise. Go to the hotel across the street and ride the glass elevators to the top for the cheapest tour of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: Marishnosh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nites in early october and absolutely loved it! We had a premiere king room, with balcony overlooking pool! Great to have to somewhere quiet to sit out and have a beer in the evening right in the middle of the city! The bed was awesome, seperate area with couch and chairs and a big TV and fridge. The only slight drawback was the room was quite a long walk from the street and there is some stairs to drag your case up, but I wouldnt let this put you off! You couldn't get a better location right on the square, The daily grill next door is great but very expensive for breakfast ( $8 for a bowl of cornflakes????!!) There's a nice diner on the corner 1 block up, or lefty's two doors down is cool too! My Second time at the handlery and hopefully not my last....higly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “It's a ok place”
Reviews.Author: Mikeman222
Reviews.Content: It's a ok place to stay at. When we first got there... We found a mustard stain on the floor... The beds were quite comfy and we all had good sleeps. The bathroom was a little small and the toilet was a little crooked. Very good location with very good resteraunts nearby.all in all.... It was a good hotel. Diffently has some room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: myseablue
Reviews.Content: The Handlery again met all expectations. The Hotel allowed us to park our vehicle early in the day so we could get started with our sightseeing. This was a first time staying in the newer section. Although we enjoyed the additional space, we truly missed the coziness and quaintness of the Historic section. We also missed the wonderful city views enjoyed in previous years. We've decided to return to the Historic section when we stay here again--which we undoubtedly will.
