The lively city noises are almost welcome--it's such a big part of the San Francisco experience. There's only one thing that was unpleasant. Our room (460) was right next to the elevator so we heard it operating non-stop. And it's somewhat noisy. But that did not deter us. The comfy beds and dreamy pillows quickly replaced the noise. Overall, our stay was super and we thank the Handlery staff for all the attention.

Reviews.Title: “What We Expected, and More”
Reviews.Author: JaycesGrandma
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip to celebrate our 50th Wedding Anniversary. Because this was such a special occasion, we were upgraded to a Junior Suite. It was very spacious and lovely. There was a snack bag in our room with a note from the owner. The location of the hotel is perfect - you can walk to so many things to do and see. I especially like the very short walk to major shopping around Union Square. At times, it was slightly noisy outside at night, but that's San Francisco, and not the fault of the hotel. I can't think of a reason not to stay here. If we could, we'd visit once a month!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingCowman
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of san francisco! Rooms we stayed in were clean and equipped with all amennities. Shirley of the reception was great and even gave us a room at 8am!!! Internet connection should be better if charged

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: zeacie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in October. We arrived earlier than expected but were pleasantly surprised to find our room ready. The Front Desk Manager was very helpful in checking us in to our rooms. He also filled in as concierge and bell hop for us because they were quite busy so it was very personalised service. Bought a 3 day muni pass which was valid for all public transport. Hotel right near Union Square, Macy's, Westfields. Cable car and electric bus stops are just down the block. Lots of restaurants nearby, ate lunch and dinner at the Daily Grill, food was great, service a little slow but overall fine. No Free WiFi which was a little dissapointing as 95% of the hotels on our 5 week trip had it, so a hotel of this standard I thought would have provided it. Our room was away from the street so it was very quiet but had no view (looked out onto other rooms). I would stay here again and recommend to other travellers for its location.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved the Handlery San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jgrissomscott
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week at the Handlery in san francisco. the location is fabulous (right at union square), the staff is helpful & friendly, the rooms are clean and nice (great sheets!) and it's a very good value. it's quiet, especially considering the location. we were there on a family vacation, but i wouldn't hesitate staying there on business, too. we couldn't have been happier with our stay and look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Hoony
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at the Handlery in a family room with a friend. Good hotel in an excellent location in San Francisco to explore this great city. Rooms were clean, staff friendly, modern interiors, public areas could do with a facelift, parking onsite (for a fee) too!. Room service retrieval leaves a little to be desired and a little noisy at night due to closeness of Union Square (buts that why you stay there!), but overall positive experience and would stay again. Would recommend a car to get out and explore, SF has some great neighbourhoods

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice rooms, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: malliew2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was packed the weekend of the Nike Women's Marathon. The staff were totally overworked that weekend but were fantastic, responsive, helpful, and patient all weeekend. I would definitely stay there again. Great staff. Nice clean rooms (a little on the small side in the older section - two queen beds), comfortable beds, and nice decor. Good location, right off Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location and View”
Reviews.Author: Janstar42
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful birthday weekend, while staying at the Handlery. The view of the cable cars going by, Union Square and the best shops. The room was charming with a huge flat screen. Tiny bathroom, but it was built a long time ago. The staff was friendly. The location was perfect for visiting the city. Two blocks from the beginning of the cable car location. We took the cable car to dinner near the wharf, for only $5. Way better than driving. We paid about 160 with free valet parking. A great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Joy255115
Reviews.Content: We statyed at the Handlery for 6 nights with 3 children. We are from NZ and had been on a holiday around California. Would say this was the best hotel for location, rooms and the suprise of getting 12 vouchers for breakfast. Location is perfect for catching the trams, shopping and the Bart station down the road. The family suite we had was a lot larger than we expected and was comfortable for a family of 5. We will stay here again on our next trip to visit family in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: mdchuck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Handlery while attending a conference. The location is just steps away from the heart of Union Square. The conference rates were very good, considering you are in San Francisco. Even the regular rate is good for a world-class city like SF, provided you want to stay in the older portion of the hotel. I really wanted to like this hotel, but after having an unwanted occupant crawl across the nightstand in my room, my opinion quickly changed. At that point, I didn't want to stay in the hotel, but with the only option for pay $150 more to stay in a hotel across the street, I opted to accept the offer for an upgraded room for the rest of my stay. The hotel website gave me much higher expectations of the accomodations than what I experienced. I would possibly recommend this hotel only after some thought and providing a truer expectation. Some standard rooms are larger than others. Pluses: Location, price, friendly front desk staff; room was clean (except for issue noted above and did smell like I was staying in an old building). Newer section (premier level) was better. Minuses: Noisy if you stay in rooms facing the street; most rooms have poor views or are views of other rooms or of a dirty alley; A/C doesn't work well in rooms of older portion of hotel; many standard rooms are small.

Reviews.Title: “what a fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: baby2512
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here from 5-9.10.10. From the minute of arrival we were treated as though we were the only ones in the hotel! The staff were so friendly and helpful. The room itself was right beside the pool, and was absolutely fantastic - clean tidy and quiet - just what the doctor ordered!!! The only down side of having a room beside the pool was although we had patio doors leading to it, smoking guests were allowed to sit here and smoke, and being non-smokers found this a little odd. Wouldn't really be able to have patio doors open. Breakfast in the mornings was second to none, and again the service was first class. The location of the hotel is spot on as well - right in the middle of all the shopping you can dream of, and not far from Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39, Crab shacks, China Town - everything. Although word of warning, we did find the price of food quite high even for the simplest of things. Alcatraz is a must see, as is the open top bus tour of the city - well worth it. Oh yes, do remember to take a jacket for the evenings, it did get rather chilly to say the least!! We really did enjoy our stay here and would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun location”
Reviews.Author: SedonaAz_Mee
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the hotel. Our room was conveniently located in the Union square shopping area. The beds were comfortable, soaps/lotions were VERY nice, We would definitely stay there again. The staff working the parking garage were always courteous with us, especially considering how many times we took our truck in and out of the garage during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable central stop over”
Reviews.Author: Nowandthentraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in October in 2 king deluxe rooms travelling with my husband and another couple. We are all in our 30's. I loved this hotel. It was a great central location if you don't have a car. Heaps of great fashion shops and great places to eat all at our door step. The rooms were large and nicely furnished. The beds were so comfortable which was great as I am pretty fussy about that. We had a huge flat screen tv and a 2 seater couch in our room. Probably ask for a room not facing the street if you are staying on the weekend. We stayed on the street side during the week and it was fine as we weren't back in our rooms until about 10.30pm each night, but there was some street noise mainly during peak hour and I noticed the glass doors leading to the balcony weren't sound proof. The rooms also had a make up room and the bathrooms were a good size with showers that had great water pressure. We purchased an open red bus tour as well which is valid for 2 days for $28 which left from union square (less than 100 metres away) which got us every where e.g. China town, fishermans wharf, alcatraz cruise, pink ladies, haight, acadamy of sciences,etc. Our flight didn't leave San Fran until 11pm, but the hotel happily held our luggage from check out in the morning until we left the city at 8pm. I think the room worked out to be $200 per night including tax. There was also free wi fi but I had trouble getting on sometimes. Air con was good and you could control the temp yourself. There was a pool but it was too cold to go in. All in all great stay and I would definitely stay again if back in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Great Location- However caution room location- Noise”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Union Square. Very reasonable rates, nice large room ( the new tower) However, the room location (#664) overloked the street which is extremely noisy all day and night. I would return with a room not overlooking the street. Very Loud! Other than this caution I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff, Loveliest Rooms - A top experience”
Reviews.Author: hangingoutwithkids
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. We stayed in the newer section of the hotel at the back of the hotel. It was a little noisy - but what a great location - and we came to San Francisco for the hustle and bustle. The staff were outstanding. My young son left a soft toy in his bed on our last night and the housekeeping staff found it and posted it on to us in Florida. We were so impressed. The rooms were outstanding clean and big for this wonderfully central location. We were very happy here. And will certainly return. The location is excellent too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for San Francisco Trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: lrmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Handlery in October, would def recommend to people visiting the city. Overall best thing about the hotel is the location, right off Union Square, next to good bars/restaurants/coffee shops and all the major department stores. We had a lovely room at the back of the hotel, very modern, big flat screen TV, coffee maker, lovely bed. Check in and out very quick and easy. I would suggest requesting a room at the back as I think it could be quite noisy on street facing side.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service and in need of a good renovation. Stay away.”
Reviews.Author: jmissy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights for our honeymoon and seriously wished we'd gone else where. The front of desk service was terrible with lack of manners and not a care in the world that we were paying customers. There was a dirt towel in our room, air con that didn't work and the room was located next to the ice machine and lift so we asked to be moved. Due to it being 'busy' we only had the choice of upgrading at our cost. We are glad we did the room was alot bigger but needed updated and no curtains just flimsy wooden blinds. I really would recommend going else where if not I've warned you.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better than Anticipated”
Reviews.Author: villalabella
Reviews.Content: After much research, we were excited to get a room at the Handlery Hotel, a family owned and operated historical hotel right at Union Square- literally right there! The Daily Grill has great food right downstairs, Lefty O'Doul's is right next door as well, and a convenience store right on the corner. We were not going to go hungry even if we didn't want to walk to another block. We were impressed with the service even before we arrived. Since we had a late flight, I emailed to make sure a late check in wouldn't be a problem. I received a prompt response letting me know it was not. Not only was it not a problem, but arrangements had been made to ensure a quick, smooth check in and a beautiful room was ready and waiting. The room was absolutely perfect, and the view amazing! We had a room with a balcony, which was our favorite place to relax and people watch. The room had everything we could possibly want starting with the most comfortable bed. It was so incredibly comfortable we hated to get out, but because it was, we were well rested and excited to adventure around the city. The room had everything we needed for a comfortable, relaxing stay: mini fridge, TV, AC, make up mirror with ample dressing space, toiletries, great lighting and ambience, as well as thoughtful details to ensure our comfort upon arrival right up until our departure. Our only disappointment was that we couldn't stay longer. Jon Handlery has done an amazing job and is truly creating great experiences. The staff is helpful, available and knowledgeable about the city, and we even heard several comment about what a pleasure it is to have such a great boss. We can hardly wait to get back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good value!”
Reviews.Author: umtmo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery Inn for 3 nights at the end of August 2010. We had a standard double room, with 2 double beds and it was quite a spacious room with coffee making facilites and hair dryer. The bathroom was clean and the shower was great. We did not have a view, but did not mind as we were sight seeing all day. We did not have the noise from the street either, so it was very quite at night time. Although we were supposed to be room only, we got complimentary breakfast for the 3 days. This was a choice of hot American breakfast with toast, Waffle or granola and fruit and a selction of tea or coffee. This was a pleasant surprise and very generally service at breakfast was excellent, although was often very busy. The hotel was centrally located and just a few minutes walk from the centre of Union Square, the Powell & Mason Cable Car and numerous shops and large department stores. We would recommend staying here rather than Fishermans Warf and Pier 33, as you can travel don to these areas during the day. For us there were several highlights of San Fransisco. Alcatraz was excellent (book online in advance through Alcatraz Cruises, approx $26 each for early bird tour - alot less people at this time). It was great to see the Golden Gate Bridge (although very foggy the first day we were there), eat in the Cliff House Restaurant, visit Golden Gate Park,take in a ball game only a few stops away),Pier 33 and all the usual tourist spots. If travelling on the Cable Car (return journey is approx $10 each) you still need to queue after you have bought the tickets. Even though the homeless guy in the orange vest is shouting that you don't need to! Do be careful as lots of homeless people about and do not walk to the left (away from Union Square) when you me out of the hotel. Generally though, San Fransisco seems fairly safe, just be careful of wallets etc as in any large city. We only wish we had longer in SF as 3 nights was not enough to see all the attractions. Next time we would like to do the Alcatraz night time tour and the movie tour. Be sure to bring a few layers as the weather is very changable, but it is such a great city to see!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Truls58
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good service and in the middle of what ever you want from SF.

Reviews.Title: “The service was spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: paoco
Reviews.Content: The front desk was as friendly as if they'd known us for years. I was traveling with friends I'd known since I was 2 and we were celebrating our birthdays. The hotel gave us a wonderful surprise for this celebration. The bell boy took care of us as if we were his sisters new to a big city. The room was lovely, clean, and comfortable. When I return to San Francisco, this will be the only hotel I will ever stay at, and I will recommend it to all of my friends! Thank you to the Handlery for such a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, lovely accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: divoicer
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff just couldn't be any better. Courteous and prompt - personable and friendly! It's an older structure but you can tell they took pains with what appears to be a recent remodel. We stayed in a 6th floor room with a balcony overlooking the street and although the front desk staff said we may hear some street noise and if so they'd move us - we had no problems. It was lovely sitting out there and when the glass doors were closed the wasn't any significant noise that bothered us. We would absolutely stay here again and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but not ideal for those needing stroller or wheelchair access”
Reviews.Author: lilsarah21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Handlery Hotel for 4 nights during the beginning of October as a conference I was attending had secured a block of rooms there for a very reasonable rate. We primary selected this hotel as compared to some of the large chain hotels because of 1) more affordable daily parking rate, 2) complimentary refrigerator in the room, 3) location and 4) daily room rate. My husband, myself and our 2 1/2 year old son and 3 week old daughter shared the room. This hotel is in an ideal location right in the heart of Union Square and near several eateries like Cheesecake Factory, Chipotle, Burger Bar and several fast food places and convenience stores. Honestly, the location couldn't have been better. We arrived around 7pm on a Friday night and were upstairs and in our room by 8pm. We met a few challenges on our first night which were concerning to myself as both a mother and a pediatric ER doctor. Parking is located on the ground level and is valet-only. Because of the way parking is set up, you need to get everything out of your car quickly so that the next person can move in to unload as well. This was extremely difficulty while traveling with children when you have a stroller and a ton of luggage and "kids things". We generally like to be self-sufficient in an attempt to save some money (ie: I don't like to have a bell man carry my luggage for a fee when I'm perfectly capable of doing it myself for free). After unloading however, we were informed that there was no way to access the lobby from the garage with a stroller as there is an obligatory flight of stairs between two portions of the lobby. They offered a bell-man to take us back a "secret elevator" to the lobby which I was not thrilled about knowing that we were now being forced to use the service because of lack of handicapped access. I asked if there would be a charge for the bell service (never having been to San Fran before, I wasn't sure, as there was a fee for parking etc). and Lawrence (bell-man) responded with "A tip will do". Wow. Tacky. And....embarrassing for us as we did not have any cash on us. I'm a firm believer that an establishment should pay its employees a fair wage being that tipping is not mandatory instead of relying on its customers to pay them in tips, and if service is above average, I'll tip. I guess I just don't see why I should give them extra money for doing their job. So basically if you have a stroller or a wheelchair you will be using the bell service and tips are expected so bring cash. There are two sides to the hotel (historic and new). The new side is not connected to the lobby completely by one set of elevators and you need to go up either a very historic looking wheelchair lift for one flight and then transfer to the main elevators or carry your stroller / wheelchair up a flight of stairs so there are obvious safety concerns there. Had we known about this, we probably would have booked elsewhere as it made every adventure outside very difficult with the stroller. The room was very nice however on the first night our room faced O'Farrell street, home to an Irish pub. Extremely loud music was blasted until 1 am or so and the noise from the street was extremely loud, so much that our family pretty much didn't sleep all night.. If you're going out on the town at night and want to have city views this is probably fine. However for a family with two small children on business, this was not ideal. We asked for a room switch which was granted the next day to a room facing the pool, on the interior of the hotel and had a wonderful two nights of sleep there. The manager that switched us was very friendly going out of his way to help with storage of our items during the room switch and the other manager we encountered, Catherine, was wonderful and helpful as well. The Daily Grill inside the hotel is small but very good. The refrigerator worked well for breast-milk storage which was a major concern of mine while traveling with such a young baby. Again, this hotel is probably great for couples without children or needing wheelchair / stroller access but proved to be a bit difficult for us. Overall, we had a great time once our room was switched.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for first usa trip and perfect for san fran”
Reviews.Author: SuitcaseStan
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to the states and this hotel was perfect. Best location for transport to everywhere, restaurants everywhere too. 1 min walk to union square, 5 mins to market to catch any bus/muni/bart. cinema and theatre only 1 block and great music hall 6 blocks or so along the road. Had fab room, pool view balcony room, was fantastic. Jon was lovely when he came to meet us, (sorry we must have looked a bit worse for wear after 10 horris flight from uk!) Staff very helpful. Am now looking to book to come back and will def stay with you again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Introduction to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Myden
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on the recommendation of a relative. Suited us perfectly - close to transport, interesting restaurants, theatres, good shopping. Our room was spacious, clean and airy - it looked over the swimming pool which was well patronised. Nothing to complain about - will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “JUST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: uaflier
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here over the last 15 years several times. This family run hotel is really like a home away from home. I must highlight that It is always a pleasure to deal with Leslie the execuitve assistant. Such a professional!!! The hotel has recently been upgraded and it is even better, thought this was impossible, I can not wait to go back!!! Love the Handlery...You are IN THE MIDDLE of this great city next to the best shopping that SFO can offer,,Do yourself a favour and stay here, no ifs or buts. Promise!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: travelfan1808
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days here and as our travel company had informed the hotel that it was our wedding anniversary the hotel kindly upgraded us. It was a lovely surprise to find chilled champagne and goodies waiting for us when we got to the room. The only down was that we had requested a twin bedded room and we got a king. Thank goodness the sofa opened out as a second bed. No view to speak of except a brick wall so we kept blinds drawn. The doorman was very helpful offering advise on directions for getting around. We ate at Leftie Odouls just 2 doors away. Fantastic food!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MandMAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 4 nights at the Handlery Hotel in San Fan. The room was quite large and very comfortable and had all the necessary amenities (tea/coffee making facilities, safe, fridge). The location in Union Square is ideal with easy access to the major shops, as well as the cable car and many restaurants located close by. Concierge were always helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon (Maid Killer)”
Reviews.Author: murphstar
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Handlery Hotel for the last part our honeymoon and had a great time in San Fran and a nice stay in the Handlery the only thing i'd have to complain about is the maid........on our first morning the maid came in at 8.20am to clean the room (i did forget to put the sign out but who comes at 8.20am when people are on holidays, also i shouted for her not to come in but she was coming in anyhow. Also on the second morning she was coming in at 8.30am this time even tho i'd left the sign out this time, then after we left for the day she didn't even come to clean the room this time........... Finally on the third morning (this was the morning we were checking out) the maid was going to come in and make the room up before we had even checked out!! Think the manager might need to have a word with her!! Other than that, Handlery is a lovely hotel in a good spot in San Fran, my wife and I both loved San Fran and would def good back. Maybe tho to a different hotel where the maids come back at normal times.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Ge0ff63
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this great city centre location just off Union Square and right by the cable car route. Attitude and service from staff was excellent. Standard room was well equipped (tea & coffee, iron, safe) but small and with nil view. Could barely see daylight from our first room on 2nd floor so moved to 4th floor, marginally better but still no view of anything at all. I suspect you need to be assertive about what yu want from your room when you check in or pay extra for a premium room. The bar and restaurant were excellent and well patronised in their own right. We had dinner there on our last night. But the hotel did not have a lounge. Garaging charges were steep, the highest we experienced in our 3 week tour of California. . Maybe par for hotels in this location but I noticed cheaper independent alternatives not far away. WiFi service is charged at $10 per 24 hours but the service was so poor the hotel promised to refund our charge - still waiting for that refund to appear on my cc account!. I suspect there are other city centre hotels offering better value for money. Pros location staff attitude and service restaurant Cons room size and outlook garaging charges wifi charge and service

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay......”
Reviews.Author: Lichty
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights - great value - we were upgraded to a King bed from a Queen - room faced the back but they did offer us a room facing the front but warned us that it could get noisy - we opt for the back. Room was large and very clean, nice comfy bed and pillows - only down fall was the window faced a brick wall - but we didn't mind, we were only sleeping there. Our room was on the second floor - my other half noticed the second day that one of the windows was open a crack - don't know if the cleaner did it or if it was left open the day before - we locked it, checked our belongs, nothing was missing. Hotel is in a great location, very happy with it - didn't rent a car took the Bart from the Airport - real easy and the Bart drop off is only 2 blocks away. We didn't eat at the Handlery as it was too busy but we did eat next door to Lefty's - good breakfast at a good price. We also had dinner across from the Handlery on the corner called "Max's", it was our best meal, all home cooked and reasonable price. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An older hotel, but excellent location, reasonable price, great room.”
Reviews.Author: Baystate2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Premier Section. It was an older building, a bit dated, (elevators carpeting) but the room was well decorated, roomy and we had a small balcony with a view of the pool. The staff was friendly, GREAT location in the heart of SF. We had a "convention rate" of $215 but with Tax and Tourism Assessment of $34, $1,000 for 4 nights is expensive. This was a business/leisure trip so half came out of my pocket. I get the impression that all the SF hotels jack up their rates for Oracle OpenWorld and the CISCO conventions. SF is getting like Chicago and sticking it to the visitors. I hope they move the Convention to a more price friendly city next year.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for a wonderful stay.”
Reviews.Author: Cndnangel2
Reviews.Content: My friends and I loved our stay at this very cool hotel. We stayed in the historic section and it was a treat. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we were pleasantly surprised to discover we would be getting free breakfast (and a very nice one at that) at the adjoining restaurant during our stay. It was a lot hotter than we were expecting it to be and we were also very happy to be able to hit the outdoor swimming pool during our stay. The only thing I would say is if your room is facing the front of the building it can be rather loud so if you want quieter you might want to stay in the newer section of the hotel but for us it just added to the experience. The rooms were larger than I was expecting from reading other reviews and considering there were three of us in a double room that is a good thing in my opinion. All in all a wonderful place to stay and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Handlery has it all- Location, Style, Comfort, Fabulous Amentities and professional, courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: tembrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the Handlery. The Hotel location is central to shopping, tourist sites and various modes of transportation. Check-in was efficient, and he directed us to hotel parking right around the back of the Hotel. The porter handled our bags and took us directly up to the room. He informed us of both Hotel amenities, locations and offered some ideas of things to see and do in the area. The room was a King room, w/ balcony. Furnishings were updated/modern, tasteful and sparkling. The Hotel offers internet, and there was a flat screen TV. The Concierge also helped us with directions for sightseeing and provided a walking map which proved very helpful. Our stay at Handlery was wonderful and we will definitely stay there again whenever we are in San Francisco. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a decent price”
Reviews.Author: doctorevie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for our purposes, which was sightseeing and meeting with some friends. We are maybe 2 blocks from main pick up point for the trolley (LONG lines to get on, so we walked wherever we wanted to go) and all the great shopping, in the heart of Union Square. The lobby is quite small, but service was good at the front desk. There are computers in the lobby with internet access, but we didn't use them. We brought our netbook and used the free WiFi in our room, which was very handy. Our room on the 8th floor was nicer and larger than I thought it would be, though the bathroom and closet area seemed kind of dated but was clean and organized. The beds were really comfy. The only thing that I didn't like was the walk from the lobby in the front of the building to the elevator in the back to get to our room. You have to go up some stairs, pass the pool...It was labyrinthian! Not a big deal, but for someone with lots of luggage without a car, I could see how this could be a problem. We had a car, so we parked it in the parking lot as part of a hotel/parking package. It maybe have been a little more expensive to park here, but it was more convenient for us. We exited our room and took the nearest elevators down to exit the hotel through the garage in back. Some tips: Check out the japanese restaurant across the street in back of the hotel. Very good. Also, my friend took us to check out the Castro area, which was lots of fun! She also took us to a restaurant called Andalu, which serves tapas sized plates to share. Delicious and fun for a group of friends. Also in the back of the hotel, to your right as your walking out, there's a sports-themed restaurant where we had breakfast. Very inexpensive and interesting to check out for all those sports fans out there. Another great place to eat is North Beach, a fantastic, Italian restaurante in the North Beach area, which is, I believe their Little Italy. Very good eats there! We walked down...actually, up some steep hills...to get to Fisherman's warf, and that was a really nice, long walk if you want to burn off some calories and check out some of the neighborhoods. The Warf is very touristy, but there's a "penny arcade" museum that's free and kinda fun to walk through.

Reviews.Title: “The Chancellor Hotel it is far from..”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Roz
Reviews.Content: But, we could not get a room at the Chancellor, as we normally do, so we thought we would get an equivalent to it since both are similarly rated and in close proximity to each other. Not even close. We sort of resented being offered a room next to an elevator and then right by the flight of steps after advising the clerk that we drove six hours to get there and were going to drive another six the next morning, so we really needed to rest. The walls at this place are paper thin and we could clearly hear the people next door. The rooms are o.k., nicely decorated with newer furniture, in-room coffee, and reasonably clean. Nothing extraordinary or particularly commendable. No free Internet either in the room or in the lobby. The concierge silently handed out a piece of paper with typewritten directions toward Muir Woods when asked for directions to the 101 North. I would expect him to be a little more helpful but maybe this is just me..

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFlyer082
Reviews.Content: The hotel was is Union Square. Perfect for sight seeing, shopping, trams. We loved it...Loved San Fran!!! San Fran was cold so rug up!! Staff at this place were very friendly. Internet though was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: malalarv
Reviews.Content: I really appreciate how honest is Handlery's staff, I forgot my suitecase opened with some values inside and everything was there when I came back and not once but twice. The room was very clean, a little bit noise since we were at the front. There was a coffee machine so it was very usefull a allowed us to save some bucks. We enjoyed a lot our stay at Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, good for 3 adults”
Reviews.Author: mpb0344
Reviews.Content: Large comfortable room, 2 queen beds, very well located. The concierge took his time helping with destinations and explaining the Muni. Practically right in Union Sq, so there's lots nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It's Average, Good Location, but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: TriipWatch101
Reviews.Content: I've lived and worked in SF in years past and drove by this hotel a lot, and never paid it too much attention. I agree that the staff is great, helpful and friendly. Normally we wouldn't stay here but got a great rate at bookit.com. Based on the reviews we requested an inside room facing the pool, we didn't get it, and it was noisy until about 3 am then at 6am the hustle and bustle of the street stated again. If you want a city view stay at a hotel that is more than 8 floors, unless looking down at tourists and homeless people is appealing to you. We did get a room facing the pool the next night and it is quiet when you have an interior room. Unfortunate for us there was a drunk birthday party crowd across the hall until 4am. We did call security, but damage and sleep deprivation were already done. Also, the rooms are nicely appointed. Overall there are postives to this hotel, but I would need another great room rate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and safe”
Reviews.Author: drKSG
Reviews.Content: Our last minute booking for $150 final tab. Friendly reception by trainee Laura and room was ready at noon when we checked in. The hotel is centrally located to launch our visits to the Museum of Morden Arts, Chinatown, Union Square, plus lots of great restaurants and shops. Eat and shopped till we dropped. We were given till 1 p.m. to check-out for more eating and shopping. Hotel felt safe, clean, small but cozy. We would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & nice size room!”
Reviews.Author: uncgal
Reviews.Content: Our family of four recently spent a week visiting Yosemite, Monterey & San Francisco. While in SF, we spent three nights at the Handlery Hotel. The registration staff was very helpful at check-in and the overall appearance of the hotel was clean & charming. Our room was on the back side of the hotel in the section that had been renovated at some time in the recent past. It was a very large room with two queen beds, a nice vanity area, an entertainment center with a refrigerator & room enough for a rollaway twin size bed. We had plenty of room to spread out & not be on top of one another. The hotel was in a great location in regards to accessing public transportation. There were also plenty of restaurants & shopping venues to choose from within just a short walk away. We were very pleased with our stay & if ever in San Francisco again, I will definitely return to the Handlery!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel-great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: happyshopper
Reviews.Content: Our first time to San Fran and we loved the Handlery! When we made the reservation I mentioned that it was our anniversary. The president, John Handlery, greeted us and then sent us a wonderful bottle of wine to enjoy! Our room was a decent size for a big city, nice comfy king bed, fluffy pillows. We wanted a street side room despite the reviews of noise. We wanted to be able to look out and see the city. We had a big bay window with a great view and it was a bit noisy, but it didn't stay noisy throughout the night. There was a great street band outside our window that ended by 10 pm. We heard some garbage trucks but we were so tired after walking up and down the hilly streets there, we slept pretty well. Service was great, everyone was so friendly and efficient. The Daily Grill attached to the hotel was excellent also! Macy's, great restaurants, and tons of shopping were on the same street, so so close (too close,lol) Perfect location! We loved the Handlery and will stay there again on our next visit to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with great charm & great service!”
Reviews.Author: Robi0304
Reviews.Content: We were in San Francisco on the tail end of a vacation to celebrate a big birthday. My wife had informed the hotel front desk ahead of time and we were greeted with some of the most helpful staff and a basket of goodies in our room. The president of the hotel had left a note to welcome us and had planned on meeting us on check-in, but apparently he was out of the office at the time. Never-the-less, the other staff from the bell hops to the housekeeping, to the concierge were all extremely friendly & generally quite helpful. The location is incredible - just one block from Union Square - and the area around the hotel is filled with restaurants, shopping of all sorts, and various other gems. The one issue that I did have about the hotel was with temperature control of our room. It was about 60-65 outside, but we could not cool our room down to save our lives. We set the thermostat at the lowest & opened windows later in the afternoon. Our intent was not to have windows open during the night (for noise & privacy), but since we couldn't combat the temp we finally ended up opening windows in the middle of the night. This did help some, but we were in an inward facing room and there wasn't much air movement outside our window. If I were to stay in San Fran again, I would certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and a great place to stay when you are in SFO”
Reviews.Author: InsaneNirvana
Reviews.Content: I made a last minute booking at Handlery during my trip to San Francisco last month. This heritage property is very close to Union Square and close to all the actions in San Francisco. Rooms were comfortable and clean. Beds were good and since I had the room that was inside (not by the street), there was hardly any noise. Otherwise sirens of ambulances and cop cars could be an issue. There is no free internet like most of the hotels in the city, but the paid service is very patchy. Location is the biggest plus for this hotel. Service is just average and given that this place runs full; almost all the time, its understandable. i would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: purplepea_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and the staff went out of their way to be helpful when the car picking us up for the airport failed to arrive. Good choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Inexpensive, Charming”
Reviews.Author: In-my-experience
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night while in town for our friends wedding, and it worked out perfectly. Although the room was small, it was tasteful and very comfortable. Fantastic location, great value. And love their self-deprecating video posted on their site showing how they make guests feel at home. Would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: worn2000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Handlery in August for 4 nights. I knew it was a great location coz it's next to Union Square. We arrived early from a long flight from Sydney and our room was ready. The room is adequately sized. It was next to the lift, so I thought it would be noisy, but it wasn't. Bed is very comfy. Bathroom is small but nice & clean. The room had a fridge, but no mini-bar (which is fine for us). There's no free wi-fi which is a little annoying, but you can go to any Starbucks or the Westfield shopping mall and they have free wi-fi! The hotel is close to Powell Street where you can catch a cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. It's very close to all the shops and public transportation. Concierge is very helpful too! Would definitely stay at the Handlery the next time I'm San Francisco!!

Reviews.Title: “Average - had hight expectations for this one!”
Reviews.Author: matt303939
Reviews.Content: I felt the website built it up to be something really great. The location was tip-top and the heating swimming pool was really nice. But the rooms were really small and the bathrooms were no more than a closet, they were nicely furnished and clean though. The check-in staff were slow, often there was a queue and the concierge was snooty, judged you before you spoke! Not a good look! I would recommend this hotel just for its location alone though, it cant be faulted, with a really nice Greek restaurant next door and an Irish bar over the road for a great night out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MrsMonkee_36
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at The Handlery on a Saturday night in August. The hotel was very nice. The staff was friendly and they had our room available for early check in so we could drop our luggage and get to the business of shopping. Our room was large and we had a nice view. The beds and bedding were comfortable, clean and nice. The hotel was very quiet (we thought we might be the only guests!) and the location was wonderful. We plan to stay at the Handlery again in January.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great concierge.”
Reviews.Author: Greenrabbit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located for shops and tourist attractions. Concierge service, by Dale, was excellent. Rooms clean and well appointed but our was tiny and had a window that gave us a view of another room (and their's our ours, I expect). Otherwise excellent spot. Valet paking onsite offered but it is available cheaper locally. Large carpark next left parking for 24hr period $29. Would highly recommend for a cheap stay in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Travellady2003
Reviews.Content: We spent just one night is the historic part of the hotel, room 640. We thought it was very charming. It is small but, very clean, and had everything you would need. Very comfortable king bed, large flat screen T.V., small refrigerator, coffeemaker, ironing board, safe and decorated beautifully. The location is perfect, close to union square.

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Reason88
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, small homey warm feel to it. This hotel is right in the heart of Union Square San Francisco. Everything was clean and nice. Our room came with free breakfast in the morning that was VERY NICE, no sloppy buffet here. Room was right on Geary street, yes it does get loud but that's part of the experience I guess. Our room was nice, bed was comfy and no issues. It was small though, no doubt about that. Smallest bathroom I've seen. Concierge in the front is very helpful if you need any advice. Overall, no issues and I would absolutely recommend to a traveler in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: travelingal
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, had very nice amenities, clean room and a great price. I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “iT REALLY WAS LIKE A WARM AND HOSPITABLE HOME IN A BIG CITY”
Reviews.Author: delilah66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed the location and even the city view room. It was a bit noisy on the weekend but I wanted the total experience . Actually they were even accomadating enough to move us, after I had originally selected pool side. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was spacious and clean. The bed was so very comfortable. I only wish I had had more time in the room. But after very busy sightseeing days, it was a perfect place to come home to. Pool was also a nice place to lounge. No complaints( and my husband says that's saying alot)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to come back to!”
Reviews.Author: dydelite
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for 6 nights and I only have high praise for the Handlery. I chose the Handlery as I had stayed there in 1996 before it was renovated and it was great then. We have stayed in many hotels across the states and Europe over the years and this one is right at the top in every aspect. We had a room overlooking the pool and as the weather was quite cool, this was an excellent choice as it was very quiet. We ate out at a variety of eating places, but especially enjoyed the Handlery's own restaurant. The location was brilliant too.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous - cant recommend it enough.”
Reviews.Author: IanNewarkUK
Reviews.Content: We had 6 nights in one of the superior rooms overlooking the pool. This meant there was very little noise and as the pool was not extensively used we really did not notice it was there. The location is excellent for Union Square and the main shops. The reception on arrival was busy but proficient and we quickly got sorted. Bit of a treck to the lifts at the back to access our room but once we were rid of the bags it was fine. Room was enormous, spotless and very comfy. Wifi was free although sometimes both it and the mobile signal were week. Ipod radio was a nice surprise. We asked for a couple of items when we went through reception enroute to get a drink and by the time we were back in the room they had been done. We had breakfast in the Daily Grill each day and drinks & nibbles in the evening and again have nothing but compliments. Service was prompt and the waiters explained quite patiently how everything worked on menu's, charging to room etc. We really cant praise the hotel enough - we had a super time and would happily return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: yogilo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in the renovated King Premier room facing the pool. Staff are polite, room was clean. Internet reliable. The valet brings the car to us pretty quick. If you are parking to check in with your heavy luggage, use the disabled elevator to go down to the lobby. Either that or the stairs. I saw lots of other guests with luggages who weren't sure if they could use that elevator and then lugged their luggages up or down the stairs. After checking in, we had to carry our luggages up that stairs again to go to the other elevator to our floor in the premier section. That's the only quirk in our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: 54Nancy54
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several hotels in the Union Square area and the Handlery is by far my favorite. We arrived mid-morning and the courteous desk clerk allowed us to check in early. Wonderful. We had a newly refurbished room that was sleek and comfortable. On the day of our departure we were able to check out bags with the bellman as we enjoyed another day in San Francisco before picking up our rental car late afternoon. Weeks later I completed and mailed their customer survery. Today I received a thank you letter from Jon Handlery. It was a positive experience all around. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, historic, terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: casayoga
Reviews.Content: What a find! The Handelry treated us like human beings! Customer service was superior to any I've found in the US. The hotel itself was clean, historic and very comfortable. Catherine at the front desk accomodated our family to perfection. What a special place. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great service”
Reviews.Author: kiet2010
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great, in walking distance from all the good stuff. The staff were also very helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: hotshowbag
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute booking through tripadvisor and as usual not a problem. Great location , close to the cable car and trams to fishermans wharf , plenty of shopping and restaurants. The Concierge was fantastic with his knowlege and advice , one of the best I have met . Nice rooms as well . Great value for a city hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel - Ecxellent Location”
Reviews.Author: tmj64
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, very comfy beds, and the staff were all very helpgul and friendly. We chose the balcony room on the pool side for less noise. It was quiet and we slept soundly every night! Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NOISY ALL NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: luvchardonnay
Reviews.Content: After hearing about the Handlery on KGO radio we were excited for our visit. Our room was small but clean. We had a tiny balcony that overlooked Geary Street. We were told at the front desk that this was an upgraded room. We were very disappointed, because the noise from the street kept us awake all night and into the early morning! The sliding glass door leading to the deck was old and did not help keep out the noise!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved the Handlery Union Square Hotel San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: canadiangalsEdmonton
Reviews.Content: As first time visitors to San Francisco, we were unsure of where to stay. Our travel agent recommended the Handlery Hotel and we are so glad that she did. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It is situated right in the heart of Union Square, so it is very easy to access tours, dining,and shopping activities. We can not praise the staff at the hotel enough, especially the concierge and the bell man service, they helped us arrange transportation and tours that we needed. The hotel restaurant (Daily Grill) is exceptional, and the evening dinner staff is superb. We loved having breakfast in the restaurant most days, very healthy choices were available. We will definitely be back to San Francisco and will also definitely be back at the Handlery when back in town! Great place with reasonable prices for the service and location!!

Reviews.Title: “3 stars is a joke”
Reviews.Author: caitlinbowles
Reviews.Content: This has to be THE best hotel I have ever stayed at no joke when I walked in i thought I'd walked into the wrong hotel this was easily 5 star standard but one of the things that made this hotel so great wasnt all the beauty (though it was incredibly modern and nice) but was the friendlyness of the staff! Any of your need are met asap the rooms are cleaned everyday as is expected also with a family there is a connecting door through rooms which can be locked if there are not more than 2 off you. Also within walking distance of pier/ town and also if your a shopoholic like myself some off the best shops in the world jsut round the corner - macys gucci louis vuitton abercrombie and fitch etc etc Only negative point is that it is quite expensive for meals in hotel however there is a cheapish diner 2 doors down called leftys which i would reccomend once again very friendly Anyways Iv rambled on enough about this great hotel you should seriously go there if your looking for a great good value hotel oh and a handy thing is the staff will get you a taxi if you request it :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful employees”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_TexasMomtotwo
Reviews.Content: I spent weeks pouring over reviews to find just the right hotel for my family. We could not have been happier with the Handlery. The staff is wonderful. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. The front desk manager even had a cork screw to loan us after we brought a bottle of wine home form the corner store. The rooms are small, but I think that is very common in a large city. The beds were comfortable and our room was very quiet. We stayed in a historic double. The bathroom is clean, but old fashioned. It was fine for our purposes. The location is great and we felt safe in the neighborhood. The reaturant attched to the hotel is wonderful. The food is great and probably some of the best food we ate while we were there. My only complaint would be the concierge. He was not friendly or offered us any information. This is a tourist destination and he should make certain that his guests are comfortable getting around the city. We asked him where to buy MUNI tickets and his answer was "At the station." We didn't feel comfortable asking him where the station was. Luckily, I saw a stack of maps on the desk and took one. Everything else about this hotel is great. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: charlene1873
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Handlery for our honeymoon last year... it was a nice hotel, with friendly staff and a nice clean room. My only problem would have been the noise outside as we had a street facing room, I complained to the manager and they offered us another room but it was smaller ( we'd been upgraded for our honeymoon) and they didn't have anything else available so we decided to stay put in the bigger room. I had to sleep with earplugs in as the street noise was extremely loud and that would be my only problem with the hotel. It was a great location right on Union Square and the travel links were excellent. A good hotel if you want to be at the centre of things.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms despite outside appearance”
Reviews.Author: KAinReno
Reviews.Content: The room (premier) was a pleasant suprise. Great location. Really no complaints. The balcony and outdoor space near the pool was very nice, but, of course, people were using it for their smoking area which turned us off - so we didn't get to enjoy it. Can they really smoke that close to rooms? Thought the hotel should post no smoking signs so the smoke doesn't also permeate the balconies. We approached hotel from the back street dead end which runs right into the rear of the building which is parking. It doesn't appear too nice from that view.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Handlery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: girlfromHawaii
Reviews.Content: The rooms, staff, and location can't be beat. The rooms are spacious, and they have mini refrigerators that are great for storing drinks and items bought at the farmer's market. I've stayed at the Hyatt at the Embarcadero, Renaissance Parc 55, the Huntington Hotel, and the Hilton while traveling for business and leisure, and the Handlery is the best place for service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay at the Handlery”
Reviews.Author: TerrySingapore
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 6 nights. This was our third holiday together to SF, and each time we have stayed at the Handlery. We really like its covenient location to everything, particularly the shopping around Union Square. The staff are extremely helpful, too. When we checked in, we received a nice welcome note from Jon Handlery. This personal touch helped make us feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - could not not fault it at all”
Reviews.Author: lesleyharrison
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel for 3 nights at the start of a two week road trip around the west coast. The service we received was impecable. As it was my 30th the hotel arranged for a complimentary room upgrade which was a wonderful suprise. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. the room was large and clean. one significant benefit was a fridge in the room, which all the other hotels we stopped in did not have. the location is excellent - right on union square. with a 15-20 walk to fisherman's wharf. we will definately be back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chefmikeMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Had a great time! the staff was outstanding and our room was very clean! Great location! The next time we are in town we will stay there! we were always greated with a warm smile!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely welcome, clean rooms - would return"”
Reviews.Author: Boo1000
Reviews.Content: We had a two night stay at the Handlery Union Square. It was the first stop after a long flight from London and ahead of a multi-stop tour of California booked through Virgin Holidays. We had never visited San Francisco (or any part of California) before and it was a pleasure to arrive at The Handlery where we were warmly welcomed and everything was presented very nicely. Our room was clean and spacious. We did have an 'industrial rooftop view' to one side and a view of the courtyard to the other. It was my husband's birthday and we were delighted to be left a bottle of fizz and a basket of goodies too. We had collected our car immediately from the airport which meant we had to park at the hotel. The cost is expensive compared to London city centre hotels but seemed the same everywhere we stayed in California. I think the location is fantastic. You walk right out of the front door and you are on Union Square with one of the famous cable car lines right there. You can take this cable car to get to Fishermans wharf. We had considered booking a hotel at Fishermans Wharf but having visited I would definitely recommend a stay around Union Square. If we go back (which I am sure we will!) we will definitely stay at The Handlery again. P.S Three top tips: 1.) ride the cable cars first thing in the morning for fab experience without crowds. 2.) Book Alcatraz before you arrive, we went off season and almost missed out on getting a ticket 3.) Try Darren's cafe near Fishermans wharf for the best breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travellercanada2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in late June, and the hotel could not have been better. Well located, easy access from SFO via BART, down the street from Union Square. The rooms were good - we chose a quieter, inside room which was very quiet. Front desk and concierge service was great - the staff is very courteous and helpful. Breakfasts were included in our package, and were more than enough to eat, and the service was first rate. A really great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful reasonably priced room on Union Square!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel524
Reviews.Content: A summertime rate of $145 with free parking?! Amazing. Just off Union Square, next door to Lefty O'Doul's and steps away from Macy's and all of the great Union Square shopping! Our room #300 was beautiful, with 2 double beds and a separate sitting area. Very very clean. We even met the owner/President Jon Handlery! Enjoyed the bar in the adjacent Daily Grill restaurant. Hotel is also only blocks away from our favorite breakfast spot, Dottie's True Blue Cafe on Jones.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: RDB27
Reviews.Content: Recently, we stayed overnight for the first time at the Handlery, and was very pleasantly surprised. Being from the SF Bay area, we had a special package heard on KGO radio. The package included free parking and a 20% discount at the Daily Grill, a restaurant connected to the hotel. The family-owned hotel, one block off Union Square, has been recently renovated and the "moderate" double/double room in the "Historic" part of the hotel was spacious, clean, quiet(we asked for a quiet room on an upper floor), and very well-outfitted. The beds were comfortable. A welcoming basket of "goodies" was also a surprise. The bathroom, while small, had all conveniences, including a magnifying mirror and a pullout clothes line in the stall shower to rinse out sox, etc. The niche for the toilet was narrow, and I would not recommend a heavy person to stay in this particular room, although I am sure there are other rooms in the hotel that have a different configuration. The A/C had a thermostatic control, and while a little noisy, worked well. Also appreciated was the iron, ironing board, and small safe in the closet. The little frig was very convenient to hold the two complimentary bottles of spring water given to us with the goodies basket. All hotel personnel were pleasant and friendly. We ate a lovely breakfast at the Daily Grill. The food was great, reasonable, and the portions "gigantic." I am not used to three-egg omelets! Besides the slightly noisy A/C, the only other complaint I would have is that the wooden blinds were inadequate to keep out the early-morning light, since the room had three windows.

Reviews.Title: “Just spent 2 nights there & was overall...”
Reviews.Author: JoeEagles
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights there & was overall quite satisfied. We were able to check in well before check-in to allow us to stow our gear & attend an afternoon Giants game. The staff were very quickly attentive to our requests for a rollaway, extra pillows & towels. They were also quick to provide a plunger (or send an "engineer") for a clogged toilet. There lies the only source of dissatisfaction with The Handlery - the toilet did not flush very well. Parking was $36 a day but the valet was always available & retrieved our car quickly. The rooms were clean & relatively quiet. The location is very convenient to food, shopping & transportation. Our experience there was good & I recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: rak4nd
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Handlery Hotel was fabulous! We were celebrating our thirty-fifth wedding anniversary, so we wanted a place close to the Orpheum Theater (walking distance), fine dining (The Grill at the hotel) and shopping. The Handlery fulfilled our "wants" beyond our expectations. The rooms were beautifully appointed and clean. We could not have asked for anything more. It is was also a short cab ride to Nob Hill where we went for drinks and dancing at the Tonga Room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: catloverDevon
Reviews.Content: Myself and my tenage son spent five nights at the Handlery Union Square on a room only basis booked through Hayes and Jarvis as part of our San Francisco - Las Vegas - Los Angeles multi center holiday. The hotel is located right in the heart of San Francisco. It's really close to the cable car which takes you through China Town all the way to Fishermans Wharf and costs $5 each way. It's also close to the trains and tourist information and plenty of shops , both high street and designer. The hotel has a restauraunt and offers room service but we didn't eat there as there were so many great places to eat and takeaways nearby. We had a twin room which was quite small but adequate for our needs as we spent most of the time out and about. Our room had twin queen size beds, a TV, fridge and coffee maker and a small bathroom with a shower/bath. There is a swimming pool at the hotel which we didn't use as it was a bit cold during our stay to be swimming out doors. If you don't have a laptop computer you can log on in the hotels computer room ( 5 terminals ) by purchasing a token for 20 minutes useage for $5 or pay by credit card. The hotel has what I'd call proper old fashioned customer service. There's a Bell Boy to help with luggage and a Concierge who knows all about the best places to eat etc and will book tables, excursions , airport transfers for you. During our stay we did two excursions booked through Viator. The first was a half day trip to Muir Woods to see the Giant Redwoods and a visit to Sausalito. We chose the afternoon departure so we could have a lie in and it was a great trip out . Muir Woods was so tranquil but quite cool at times so take a jacket. Sausalito was beautiful and the market there was fab - biggest and best strawberies I've ever tasted. We also got some great pictures of the Golden Gate Bridge on our way out. We also did the day trip to Yosemite National Park which was a very long day with an early start but well worth it. Stunning scenery at Yosemite but dissapointingly we were unable to see the Giant Sequioas as late snow prevented the coach acessing the area. The quides on both trips were really friendly and informative and certainly earned their tip. All excursions included pick up and drop of at our hotel and were puntual. This hotel may not be the most modern in terms of decor but I think this lends to it's charm . If you want a central base from which to explore San Francisco then I would certainly reccommend The Handlery Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Little Spot in Union Sq”
Reviews.Author: arounddtheworld
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had mutual business trips and he had selected this hotel. While I usually book at a larger chain as I am a member of their loyalty program, I was pleasantly surpirsed upon arrival at how nice the rooms were (we upgraded to the back building by the pool). Although no one offered to assist me with my luggage so I had to lug up a large bag by myself up the stairs to othe other building, after that the service improved and everyone was very friendly and helpful. It was a great place to get some work done then relax by the quiet courtyard poolside, and a fantastic location right in the middle of Union Square. Top amenities in room but they could some in room movies (perhaps ours did not work) would be nice. Aside from that, the only areas that could use improvement is incorporating an onsite fitness center (you currently get a discounted rate at a gym very close by) and some free hi speed or wireless at least in the restaurant. Charming place overall and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, but don't choose a street-side room if you want to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: SheriReho
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at The Handlery for our 2-night/3-day visit to San Francisco. This hotel was recommended to me by a San Francisco native. It was a fantastic location at Union Square--very convenient to cable car lines, ticket booth, restaurants, etc. My GPS directed us right to the front entrance of the hotel; problem was that there was NO PARKING there. My friend stayed in the car while I ran in and checked in. Note that the desk clerk told me that, before 4 p.m., this is doable but the cops will start ticketing at 4 p.m. if you try to stay parked there (due to rush hour, I guess). The hotel is huge and built around an interior pool deck, which is really nice; however, this makes for a LONG walk if, like me, you asked for a city view and prefer to talk to the desk or concierge in person vs. by phone. When checking in, I was asked if I wanted city view or pool view. The clerk told me that city view is nice but can be noisy, but I was there to see the city so I chose it anyway. It WAS noisy. If I was to stay there again, I'd choose the pool view. The garage entrance is on another street. Parking in the garage is $38 a day!!! You can include parking in your room rate (maybe they give you a break on the rate if it's included in the room), but I wasn't sure if my friend was staying in the city with me or not (she lives in the suburbs), so I didn't include parking in my rate and had to pay it separately. The room was VERY nice--beautiful, in fact. Nicely appointed with 2 elegantly-made and comfortable queen beds, a flat-screen TV, a desk and quality office chair and a cabinet with mini fridge and coffeemaker. There was, however, no microwave. The bathroom is fine, though my friend was disappointed that the sink wasn't outside the bathroom like it was in our Yosemite hotels. I actually preferred that, since I'm the one that's up in the middle of the nite to use the bathroom and having the sink inside the bathroom meant I didn't have to worry as much about waking her when I got up at 3 a.m. Sleeping in the room, however, was NOT very nice. Between the obnoxiously loud grinding noise from the air conditioning system and the incredibly intrusive noise from the street (given that we were 4 floors up from ground level), sleeping was not easy. The AC noise bothered me more than the street noise, where the opposite was true for my friend, who was sleeping in the bed closest to the outside wall. Also, the thermostat for the AC system was very confusing--not done by temp (unless it was metric!). Another disappointment was that this beautiful luxury hotel had no exhaust fan in the bathroom. Even the no-frills motel we stayed at in Oakhurst had that! Finally, I had booked the room and I checked in. I was not asked if anyone was staying with me, though I told them I had a friend waiting outside due to no parking. I was given 4 keycards (why 4, I don't know), but my friend's keycards expired within 24 hours of us being there and she got locked out. The desk refused to let her up until they reached me, but I was in the shower when this happened and my friend was very nearly late to get ready for dinner and the theatre that night by the time they reached me. We ate in the on-site restaurant, the Daily Grill, for a light dinner on Saturday evening. We were seated immediately in a comfortable booth, and loved our waiter, who was not only a good waiter but very cute and personable. My friend had a dinner salad with ahi tuna and said it was very good. I had a side salad with house vinaigrette and the 3-cheese mac & cheese from the sides menu and both were excellent. Would I stay there again? Yes, probably, as I thought it was a beautiful hotel and it is in a great location. However, I'd get the pool view room to avoid the city street noise, and I'd make sure any travelling companion was on the registration to avoid problems there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Staff Friendly and Professional I would recommend this hotel and I would certainly stay again.”
Reviews.Author: HulseClan
Reviews.Content: On arrival and throughout our stay the hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and professional. The suite was comfortable, spacious and clean. The location is ideal for all the major areas with the tram stops less than a two minute walk. Plenty of places to choose to eat, the Daily Grill connected to the hotel is a must. We would definitely stay here again when in San Francisco and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, small, clean”
Reviews.Author: Mr.Elite
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in Union Square, basic pool, very small rooms, clean throughout. We had a room that faced a brick wall, so it was quiet, can't vouch for the others. One thing to point out is that parking ran us $38/ day...Youch! Internet costs extra as well. Would I stay there again? Probably not, I'll try something else. Would I recommend it? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: japswmbo
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Handlery Hotel was nice. Although an older hotel the bed and everything about our room was decent. The staff was friendly. Liked this hotel much better than the high priced Westin St. Francis across the street which had no service that was COMPLIMENTARY. Even to use their fitness equipment cost $12.00 a day! Outrageous. If I ever go back to SanFran I would stay at the Handlery.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellend service”
Reviews.Author: MatadorTodd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for a second time this past weekend and we couldn't have been happier. The room they gave us was incredibly large and with a view, no less. Plus the manager came out to greet us upon check-in. Note: we're not celebs or executives. Plain folk, if you will. Service and quality were all top notch. Only downside is $38/day parking. But by San Francisco standards, one of the best deals for the size and location. Thanks Handlery!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: cocoHonolulu
Reviews.Content: The Handlery Union Square Hotel was the perfect place to stay on our very first trip to San Francisco. We arrived late in the evening (at 10:00 p.m.) and didn't want to waste any time. After getting settled in our room, we wanted to get to know what was around the area. The doorman that evening was very helpful and friendly. Very informative. We received excellent service during the few days we stayed at the hotel from both the doormen and the concierge. The cable cars are located just around the corner and is an excellent way to get around the city. And if you want to travel by taxi, they are usually parked right outside. And if there isn't a taxi parked outside, the doorman will stand out on the street and blow his whistle. In seconds, a taxi is there for you. There are numerous shops surrounding the hotel that display art. And the hotel is a block away from Union Square where if you love to shop, you'll be in heaven. We also found a 24-hour diner (Lori's Diner) just around the corner. It's a diner that takes you back to the 50's. Once you leave the lobby area (of the hotel) and head upstairs to your room, the interior decor of the hotel is kind of vintage, like you were back in the 1930's or 40's. Loved it!!!! Can't wait to return and stay at the Handlery. Thank you Handlery for showing us a good time. Hope to see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Clean Rooms in a Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Deb_Mich
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in Union Square with sister, sister-in-law and 16 year old niece shopping for the perfect prom dress. The hotel is perfectly located close to Bart stop and all things Union Square. One of us took Caltrain in and walked to the hotel; it took about 20 minutes so if you aren't too loaded down with luggage, it's quite doable. Reception let us check in early so we could stash our luggage and begin our search. The room was very clean, updated, and very large for a hotel in a big city. It was a premium queen room (two beds) and had a large closet, two makeup mirrors, shoe-shine machine and weight scale in bathroom. Also, large flatscreen TV and sitting area. Only shortcoming was a single sink but we managed just fine. The hotel has a nice pool, although we didn't have time to enjoy it. Reception was pleasant and helpful. We booked our room through Priceline but didn't bid for it; it was a good value and we'd stay there again for a similar weekend. Recommend breakfast as Sears nearby (not the department store). It's a fixture in the city; food is great traditional fare and ambiance feels very San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: cappuccino9
Reviews.Content: Positives: We loved the hotel especially it's location. Staff were really helpful and friendly. It was great to have two double beds in the room. Never got to use the pool but it did look nice and inviting. Negatives:The bathroom was very small and dated. Cleanliness of the room could have been better (everything felt 'sticky' including the bedside drawers). Need more hangers in the wardrobe. I didn't like the bed - there is a felt pad between the mattress and the bottom sheet which is not secured and I am a restless sleeper so every morning my bed looked like a war zone! Air con set to 72 and not adjustable.

Reviews.Title: “I love the handlery and always stay there...”
Reviews.Author: Ldub808
Reviews.Content: I love the handlery and always stay there when in San Francisco! The service is excellent, you can't beat the price and the location is perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Chloeden
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Handlery. I thought it was a good hotel and provided great service. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Not too far away from the big sites such as Fisherman's wharf, the golden gate bridge and Pier 39. The pool was nice too, small but very nice. The noise outside at night was slightly annoying but nothing too serious. If i was planning to go to downtown San Francisco i would consider staying in the Handlery again. :D

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay - Matt at the front desk was extremely helpful.”
Reviews.Author: tpj0803
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was pleasant. The rooms were clean. The city area outside the hotel is a little noisy at night but it is in a great location for transport and ease of access to just about anything. Matt at the front desk was extremely helpful and very good at his job. The Daily Grill next door served great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: fiftyfiftyScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and found it to be very comfortable. We didn't use any of the facilities or eat here so can only comment on the room and reception/check-in. Check-in was quick as there was no queue. Our room was very big in the historic part of the building. Other reviews have said that their rooms were small but ours was certainly large with a sitting area and a bedroom area with the bathroom off the sitting area. We had no problem with noise either as the room did not look out into the main streets. The location is excellent for Union Square area and the trams/BART. We did a lot of sightseeing.
